description:
Shrimp Scampi with veggies and pasta 
Prawns with Scallops with veggies and pasta
Both dishes were excellent 
Only problem they served our dinner and salad at the same time
Otherwise all was very good
author: Joe M.

description:
Came here on my birthday back on July 12 and had a careless waitresses that had a horrible attitude. I completely understand that this is a tourist place and days might seem a little overwhelming at times but when we request an item from the menu and ask to bring it now, please dont respond by saying," we can start off with an entree first?" 
Its my birthday!!!!! Maybe I want room temp dessert by the time I finish my meal....
My husband was so mad. Unbelievable service! Besides the horrible service the bruschetta was good. The Captains Platter was overpriced food not enough for 2 people. Learn to treat your customers with respect especially on there birthday...
author: G J.

description:
We were here with out of town guests recently looking for some seafood by the bay. As we walked by, we saw a sign for super cheap $6 or $7 fish and chips lunch. There were also $4 beers, cheap clam chowder, and one other inexpensive item. I also liked the fries. My friend enjoyed the chowder. 

It was a great deal with plenty of food. Nice atmosphere. Moderately friendly server. Great location with indoor and outdoor seating.
author: Sara T.

description:
The restaurant is nice and clean. The servers are very friendly. I stopped by Pompei's as I was walking down the street. I ordered black cod with salsa and sides of veggies.. the fish was little underdone and the veggies seemed to be out of freezer. 
Most of the restaurants in this lane have nice outside seating area.
author: Tina K.

description: Our food came quick but NOT all at once. The kids burger came ONLY with velveta cheese and when we asked for pickles and mustard the waiter came back 5 mins later without either saying they don't use pickles in the restaurant. The waiter is also fighting a cold and probably had no choice but to be here which sucks for him and us. Won't be coming back here!!!
author: Sylvia C.

description:
All the places in/around the pier & wharf are 3.0-3.5 stars Yelp rated.  I wanted to a quaint place, not too-much touristy (yeah, right), for my gf and I to grab a bite.  We walked in to look, and found it perfect: very clean, newish, cute, and décor in blues, whites, and greys.

We walked in mid-week around 630pm, and got seated immediately.  I'm sure that's not the case on the weekend, but this added to the charm on this night.

$4 Sierra Nevada draft was a great way to start.  My gf ordered the Clam Chowder Bread Bowl [$12.95, 4.0 stars].  The chowder was great (with a little bit of bacon), and the bread was mehhh -- definitely better down the street at Boudin.  I ordered the Crab Cioppino [$34.95, 2.5 stars].  Overpriced, small portion, and the highlight was crab pieces with shell inside molten lava of a tomato-based soup.  I had to fish out the crab, let them semi-cool before cracking the pieces, making a complete mess of myself.

What's a good deal is happy hour specials advertised on the outside Ad board:  $5 chowder, etc.  All in all, I wouldn't return.
author: Randy B.

description:
From a long time I was planning to visit a fine dining seafood restaurant. 
We went over the menu of 3-4 near by restaurants and selected this one.
We ordered chefs special (bass) and Crab melt sandwich.

Bass was good the presentation was simple and sweet. By just looking a the dish you'll feel that the taste will be bland but once I tried it was perfect, also the broccolis was awesome(recommend item).

Crab melt sandwich was below expectation, bread had a lot of extra butter/oil and the quantity of crab inside was too less, so paying $22 for such quantity was a lot.

At the start they also give you breads and butter, the bread slice edge's was was too hard and difficult to eat.
Probably I may not come back here, will try the neighbouring seafood restaurants.
author: Naba C.

description: The Bloody Mary and calamari are pretty good. They don't give you to much clam chowder for the bread bowl and the mussels were over cooked. Service could be better, very touristy.
author: Phil M.

description:
**** Review 116 ****

While walking towards Fisherman's Wharf, we decided to pop in for a quick drink. This place stands out from the other local places by looking like it was brought straight from Greece. With the nice outdoor seating, you can enjoy a beer with the great Cali weather. While looking at their drink menu, the waiter told us it was Happy Hour, so that made us order a few more than what we expected. I also ordered the fried calamari. 
Being in California, the seafood does taste fresher, but calamari is an easy plate to mess up. Too much breading and that's all you'll taste, not cooked for the perfect amount of time and it becomes chewy or just uneatable. Their calamari was good, but not great. Would I eat it again? Absolutely, specially during Happy Hour. I've had worse, and paid way more. 
If you're looking for a chill place, cold drinks, and good Happy Hour specials, this is a good stop for you.
author: Luis S.

description: Excellent food, great service and good location.  We considered several places before choosing Pompei's Grotto.  Our orders were well prepared and served in a timely manner.  The prices were reasonable and we will definitely return the next time we visit San Francisco.
author: Mike K.

description: Oh what can I say. We have been dining at this restaurant for over 25 years...but it has all changed. The prices are outrageous and the food quality has gone down hill. The bartender was wearing a t-shirt eating his lunch until mgmt told him to wear a Pompei's shirt. Very, very sad. Poor tourist getting shafted and locals can no longer embrace. Good bye those bygone days of engaging service and great food.
author: David S.

description: Went to this restaurant our last night in SF. If you are walking the pier and come by Pompei's, my suggestion is to keep walking. The service is beyond slow (20 minutes to wait for someone to come to the table, and another 10 for waters). My wife ordered the chicken marcella which was good, I wanted to keep it light and ordered the spaghetti & meat sauce. It was tasty as well but I can't get beyond the service & wait staff.
author: Steve V.

description:
What happened to this place???? Like everything else in the city it has changed for the worse
I tried to have a meal and a drink in the bar and the bartender made it seam like everything I asked I was bothering him
Never will go or recommend to anyone
author: Curt F.

description: We ended up in fisherman's wharf which is the hub of mediocre dining. And this place fit the bill.  We just wanted a quick bite before we caught the ferry and their food was disappointing but not surprising.   Kids shared a meal and I got soup to go.   Soup was bland.  Would not go back.
author: Madhuri K.

description:
2-star food. Shrimp and scallops: looked nice on the plate, but the scallops had obviously been frozen for awhile, the shrimp was way over cooked, the potatoes were way over seasoned, the veggies were near soggy. Everything was drenched in butter.

2-star value. Nearly $30 for three medium shrimp and three medium sized scallops, especially given how poorly everything was cooked. I understand it's in San Fran on the pier, but still....

4-star service. Gino took great care of us (even if he came across a little...aloof?). This is WAY outdone by the quality and value, that it doesn't even matter at this point.
author: Jason S.

description: Very good restaurant. I had some grilled shrimp and vegetables. The wait staff as very courteous and friendly. The drinks were very good as well.
author: Sondra D.

description: Awesome lunch/happy hour spot along the wharf. We had a killer deal and the quality and timing of the food was perfect! We got lucky and had an outside patio table on a nice sunny day. Zonia was our waitress and was very helpful and friendly. She gave us a great experience. The $5 bread bowls were the perfect size and the chowder was fresh and hearty. $4 Sierra Nevada in draft & $5 bloody Mary's.The fish and chips were delicious as well, and had a nice light breading with fresh tasting fish as well. I recommend it to anyone looking for a nice, great priced, dining experience.
author: Amanda S.

description:
We came in to this place after a long day of seeing the sites of San Fran and we were exhausted. The menu out front looked good so we decided to give it a shot however my first clue should have been the  lack of customers inside. It was quiet and almost made us feel uncomfortable talking. Services was terribly slow slow slow, and the food sucked. The steak was over cooked and bland, the bread stale, and the potatoes were cold. We heard another table complain to the server about their food not being cooked as well. To top it off we were charged a $25 service charge because we were a party of 6 even though one person was not eating and for terrible food and slow inattentive service it just ticked me
Off.
author: Kel C.

description: Stopped in for the advertised $5 clam chowder bread bowls. It was perfect for a cloudy/cold day. We sat outside and watched the street as people walked by. The service was extremely slow! The chowder was great, but definitely only worth $5. I'm glad we went, but the money we thought we were saving was spent in parking because we were there for well over an hour.
author: Madeline B.

description: Great place to hang out and have a beer. Prices are good. Clam chowder in a bread bowl hot and fresh--SooooGood! Fish Tacos are excellent. Happy hour daily 3-6pm. I would definitely eat here again.
author: Arthur K.

description: We had a long 13 mile bike ride from the wharf and across Golden Gate Bridge then back so happy hour proves here reeled us in. We sat outside and people watched while we enjoyed fish tacos, mussels, chicken wings, and salad all for discounted happy hour prices. The drinks were good too. Service was a little slow, we had empty beverages for sometime. I was a little pissed off at a patron who took his beer to the bathroom with him then proceeded to walk into me with it while he almost broke his neck to check out my minor daughter. Maybe over serving is an issue? I was pretty close to letting this mans date (girlfriend? Wife?) know about his actions. Unfortunately this was our experience here. We overlooked it at the time as we were pretty exhausted from our day in the bay.
author: Shannon C.

description: I came here one evening while walking around fisherman's wharf trying to decide what to eat. I was here alone for a business trip and it was starting to rain so I just decided to come in here to eat dinner. It felt sort of awkward sitting at the table by myself as everyone else was here in pairs or in groups and the restaurant wasn't really too filled up either. I was deciding between the fish tacos or the mushroom risotto but the waitress recommended the risotto so I ordered that and added chicken to it. The risotto was just okay; the rice was sort of hard but I'm not sure if that was done on purpose. Overall, this seems like just a touristy spot with mediocre food and high prices; I would probably come here if I was hungry while walking around fisherman's wharf but I would never go out of my way to come here or recommend this place. Service was good.
author: Victoria Y.

description: Great place to go for Happy Hour! A fairly inexpensive & warm meal is the key to my heart when visiting the city. My husband loves their fish & chips. I got the steamed mussels and was extremely satisfied. We also treated ourselves with a half off appetizer, Bruschetta! It was so fresh and delicious. Their regular menu isn't too pricey, although I would suggest taking advantage of their happy hour deals!
author: Kenzie C.

description: This restaurant was very welcoming and right on the pier at the wharf. The service was terrible, the food was terrible. I was expecting more for the price of the food. The decor was nice, but you're not going to a restaurant for the decor.
author: Tracy H.

description:
I don't really understand why this place has been getting bad reviews - the bf and I honestly enjoyed it!  

We had been walking around the wharf and decided to stop here for happy hour - best decision that day! We both ordered the fish and chips (we literally order this everywhere lol), and the fish was amazing - outside crust was crunchy and the fish so fresh and tender. I also ordered a bloody mary, which is not my usual choice of drink, but it was amazing!

The weather was beautiful so we decided to sit out on the patio. There were quite a few people outside, but very few inside. Our waiter was super sweet and accommodating, although it took awhile to receive our check. 

Definite recommend during happy hour :)
author: Dee B.

description: We walked in and we weren't sure what to expect. Aaron, behind the bar, greeted us genuinely and we felt right at home. We came in for a quick drink and stayed for oysters. I signed my card and accidentally left it there, and Aaron chased us down to bring my card back to me. I recommend this place to anyone visiting. Best service on the wharf, hands down. See you all soon!
author: Jill H.

description: We sat in the bar and it was an okay situation. We sat there for much longer than I felt like we should have waited to be greeted. Eventually she got around to us. The bartender was nice and running around to accommodate but probably should have asked for assistance. The food was my bigger problem, if I pay $20 for a crab roll someone needs to visit LA to see what that should look like. I got crab meat on toasted white bread...really? Crab meat served on white bread? That's the best you can do? I had a drink that was good but because it wasn't very strong, I'm not a big drinker. So I won't be back. When the highlight are the wings...at a seafood/Italian place they have bigger fish to fry. Pun intended.
author: Kristy T.

description:
No. Do not eat here.  - 
this food is crazy expensive incredibly basic and the poor servers are seriously over worked. It is an obvious tourist trap and I'm mad that we were so hungry that we thought it ok to try. 
Hope this saves someone else from spending $125 on an edible meal.
author: Yvette S.

description:
WHYYYYYYYY???????? Seriously, new owners. Who led you astray? You didn't get what a gem you had and why it was so awesome. I get needing to remodel and update a bit. But you should have left it as much alone and put it back with a similar look. First of all- blue is tragic. Red is so famous in eateries because red is shown to stimulate appetite.
Blue and grays? THE OPPOSITE. Yuck. And the outside LOOKED GREAT IN CLASSIC WHITE. People are paying expensive designers to try and recapture the look and kitsch/ feel of what you already had. Congratulations on turning it into a hotel lobby. 
Hey, I thank God you were smart enough to leave the glass and windows alone. It is more spacious feeling. I get that. But you should have went back to dark wood, reds and vintage feel. Cool old blue glass buoys, old nets, vintage vintage vintage. 
Thanks for making me want to cry on Mother's Day and killing my favorite spot. I worked on the water for years years ago, and the guys who ran the boats would say if you are taking a lady out you need to impress go to Scomas. But if you wanna eat? Go To Pompeii. I doubt they are saying that anymore. 
RIP

Update! So, I STILL miss the old Pompei Grotto. Ok so the new look has a stomach turning effect on me. I wish they would go back to the classic red and white. And for the love of God, Google the effects of blue on your appetite. Seriously. Is a real thing and some people are really sensitive to that stuff. Red and white check? Because red is known to be an appetite stimulant and Blue is a SUPPRESSANT! Why could you just freshen shit up and leave well enough alone?  You may get tourists, but you lost all your loyal local regulars.
author: Jo J.

description:
Sometimes the rating outlined on the site don't reflect the place. We did not book we just walked as
It looked welcoming. Nice setting and the food was tasty and clean. I had the Francesca Misto which I finished off with dipping the remaining bread into that broth. AmaZing. My son had the Angelina pasta which was very enjoyable. All in all a nice choice.
author: Dion K.

description: Ate lunch here today.  Unbelievably disappointing.  People were walking out due to being ignored by the staff.  I'm not sure if they were short handed, but it was no excuse for being rude and inattentive.  Food was not special at all.  They need to understand that there are many other restaurants and vendors doing it better and giving better service.  Prepare to wait if you decide to eat here.
author: Sean R.

description: The service was really good!... especially for a holiday weekend! The food was delicious and portions were huge! I'm giving a 3 star because the drinks were not so good! I gave back my martini because it was straight lemon juice and my sons Shirley Temple was full of grenadine.
author: Michelle L.

description:
One of the last stands of the old Wharf!

San Francisco's Fisherman's Wharf has changed a lot in the last 20 years. Many new eateries have popped up. There are even a few fast food places there now! Can you imagine the old days when fishermen came back from the sea and hung  out in their local fast food joint for a couple burgers, fries and soda?! Do you go to the wharf to eat in a fast food chain eatery? I didn't think so. Walk past all those junk food places and go straight to Pompei's Grotto for good sea food and/or Italian food. The drinks are good, the food is very good and the servers are friendly.  Come on! Haven't you had enough of that corporate burger or burrito stuff? It's time to eat like the good old days!
author: Afshin A.

description: I would give a 0 star if possible.  My boyfriend and I visited the San Francisco area and chose this place for dinner.  We were seated upon arrival and given menus and that was it.  We waited 15 minutes, no waiter addressed us, no water, no bread at the table no "we are busy I'll be right with you", no food order placed.  I'll note it was 8pm and they had a total of 6 tables at the time to several waiters.  Needless to say we did not stay, got up and left.  The serving staff walked by us for 15 mins as if we didn't exist!
author: Jessica D.

description:
Walked in for dinner on a Wednesday night and we were immediately seated. Service was courteous and prompt. 

Appetizer was a clam chowder bread bowl. Soup was warm and tasted good. Bread was soft with a nice crust. Nothing to write home about but definitely good. 

Dinner: my husband a Dungeness crab sandwich and he said it tasted like "warm mayo on lettuce" and had absolutely no crab flavor whatsoever. It looked like a sloppy tuna sandwich from where I was sitting. This was super disappointing considering it was a $20 sandwich. 

I had pesto fettuccine and it was mediocre at best. Not bad but pretty bland and basic. Added lots of salt, pepper and cheese! 

Waitress never once STOPPED at our table to check on us. :/ she would walk by talking and then be gone. Never got drink refills either. 

I wouldn't eat here again.
author: Ashlee A.

description: Great food and the prices are reasonable the service staff was very helpful and patient with my daughter highly recommend while in San Francisco
author: Pete C.

description: So, went twice in one day to this restaurant.  First was for lunch, had a great server, great food and the hostess and manager were on the floor and very engaged.  Went to the Ballgame, came back and went for dinner based on lunch-what a mistake.  The server was extremely disconnected and slow.  Took forever to get our cocktails and she quite honestly could not be bothered.  The food was mediocre and for two people and $80.00 I could have done much better somewhere else.  When the manager came to clear plates I stated "I have to say that the service, and excuse me in advance sucks". She looked at me and said "I'm sorry to hear that" and walked away.  Its nice to have built in business and not have to worry about a reputation.  Nothing lasts forever.  Not sure who the owner is of this establishment but they better pay attention.
author: Craig F.

description:
ABSOLUTELY the most disgusting oysters I have had in my life. The only way I can describe the taste and smell is fecal. Don't get me wrong, I am not one to be grossed out by oysters. I love them and eat them all the time. I eat them raw with absolutely nothing on them because I genuinely enjoy them that way and am able to note the difference between different types of oysters that way.

The first one I tried was awful. I figured it was an anomaly, a spoiled one, and that the other 5 would be great. The second one tasted equally disgusting to the point that I am very surprised I did not get violent food poisoning that day. I had to go wash my hands, not because they smelled of seafood, but because they smelled like feces.

Service was a 2/5.
author: Kathryn C.

description: This place sucks! I brought my mom here for her birthday and it was a complete disappointment in every single aspect.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I was playing tourist for the day in SF and ended up here for Happy Hour walking around Fisherman's Wharf.  Cute spot and very family friendly.  

They have a very decent happy hour special.  The Steamed Mussels with white wine butter & garlic was amazing!  I could not stop trying to mop up all the sauce with the house bread.  The Fried Calamari was very tender and tasty.  The white was $5-$6 a glass, which is a steal in my case since I'll usually have a couple of glasses.   Great spot to stop on by for some light bites before heading off to the next spot for more drinks!
author: Melanie N.

description: Mainly disappointed with the service: my salad came without blue cheese and when I asked for it I was told it wasn't supposed to be on the salad so I actually had to bring out the menu to prove that it was so our server would give it to me. Overall the server was inattentive and forgot to give us bread until the end of our meal. Seafood dishes were actually very good while our other dishes (pasta and chicken parm sandwich) were disappointing.
author: Kat D.

description: The food was delicious! I had eaten a perfect linguini and clams there. But aside from the food, the ambiance was also good. Despite the cold wind outside Fisherman's Wharf, the atmosphere inside was warm and the servers were hospitable.
author: Rochie C.

description:
Poor customer service!

Sat forever, waiting to be served water while all the waitresses were standing around. We were seated by host then forgotten about. 

The waitress had a bad attitude also, looked like she hated her life.

Skip this place, plenty of other good options in the area.
author: Sav N.

description: I came in for happy hour and ended up ordering an entree the Francesco Misto, Aaron the Bartendar recommended it. I had a vodka soda and the well Pino Grigio both were great. By reading the reviews I wasn't sure if I should try this place, glad I did. My review is from July 25, 2018. They have a descent HH selection. They seem attentive and the food was hot, that's a big must for me and the drinks were semi strong. Overall I'm pleased
author: Evita H.

description: Worst service with food. Ordered crab melt and was given crab (along with few hidden shell pieces) between stale toasted bread.
author: Shilpa S.

description: Server Judy was a hoot. She was very warm, & welcoming. We had a great experience and delicious food. She also drew a peace sign and a little heart on the check. Very nice gesture.
author: Amteshwar S.

description:
When in Fisherman's Wharf, you eat at a seafood place. Pompei's Grotto sounds like a total tourist trap of a restaurant, but it caught my eye from the sidewalk as looking more legit, which it was. The patio looks like a nice people-watching place. 

I ordered fettuccine gamberetti and it was good but not great. Shrimp were a bit lackluster, and there was too much cream sauce for my taste. The waitress was friendly and the food was good, but I would try something else in Fisherman's Wharf next time.
author: Katie U.

description: Didn't get any service, I searched for a waiter to get menus. Once we got seated, didn't even get any water offered. 15 min later without seeing a server, i left.
author: Erick V.

description: Updated review, been coming here for 20 years or so when visiting San Francisco.  Not much has changed.  I think tablecloths are blue instead of red now.  Anyway, I like this place because it is comfortable and the food is straight forward.  Prices are relatively reasonable considering what else is in the area.  Been here at least a dozen times and have never had an issue with service.  Our last visit was earlier this year with just my daughter.  She had some dungeness with spaghetti and I ordered the shrimp sandwich and chowder.  Couldn't tell you how the chowder was because she took it from me and finished it.  LOL.  Shrimp sandwich was simple where you could taste the shrimp.  The pasta was delicious, but how can you go wrong with fresh dungeness?  Looking forward to my next visit.
author: Mark N.

description: Instead of giving me a new burger, they recooked the burger I had bitten into and then served it back to me. (See pics) Totally unhygenic, I should call the health department. The manager was rude to me until I mentioned calling the health department, then he called me "maam" and was extremely apologetic, suddenly he deemed the situation "unacceptable" and said the chef was in alot of trouble. These guys need to close for this type of error. You cannot recook food from a patrons plate...it is called cross contamination. I am appauled that they dont know this.
author: Annie J.

description:
Sorry to say this was a sad experience. I soooo wanted it to be good experience because I wanted a mix of Italian with succulent San Fran seafood so the perfect fit was P. Grotto's. 

NOT! 

Absolutely no pasta dishes and nothing other than fried food and a happy hour menu was available on a sunny Sunday afternoon (during spring break to make matters worse m) because "1" CHEF WAS OUT AND CALLED IN SICK?!?! DOES THE MANAGEMENT OF THIS RESTAURANT KNOW ITS 2018 and one person SHOULD NOT SHUT A WHOLE PORTION OF A MENU DOWN!

To say the least I will not be back, but not because of the lack of mismanagement, but because the sever didn't even bother to mention that half of the menu wasn't available when we were ordering. Just after we had spent almost $30 on happy hour items and was proceeding to order our entrees, then it dawns on him to tell us about the lack of menu choices. 

Sorry, this place is no gem
author: Wanda R.

description: Walked into Pompei's for a quick lunch stop during our first stay in San Fran. Fisherman's Wharf is famous for their seafood and clam chowder and I was sure that a clam chowder soup from any restaurant in this area would be a delicious, safe pick. Unfortunately, that was not the case for Pompei's. The clam chowder was watery and did not have much meat at all, it was mostly vegetables with no creamy texture. I got it in a bread bowl and it was half full with not much to eat. Other than that, the staff was very friendly.
author: Victoria C.

description: Good stop on the seafood trek.  Had the steamed clams and they were delicious.  Served with yummy bread for lots of dipping.  Hostess or maybe manager was super friendly and accommodating. Server might have been a bit overwhelmed.  Think they had tables both in and outdoors which can sometimes be a bit much.
author: Devon R.

description: A lot of time has passed since I've visited this Fisherman's Wharf restaurant. New owners, new outdoor patio, remodeled bar. A great happy hour for drinks and eats. If you happen to venture to the Wharf try this place don't think you'll be disappointed.
author: Googie G.

description: Trash food do not eat here. Expensive food and it's trash. Go to a better option like in n out or boudin. Enter and die you will lose all your money and get food like it was taken out of a dumpster and served to you.
author: Kyle M.

description:
The service was a little bit slow and not the friendliest, our server seemed to be getting annoyed at us asking her questions about the menu.  Their happy hour policy is also a little confusing and inconvenient. 

The food was amazing though! We got the Mushroom Risotto and Franceso Misto and they were both phenomenal.  My mom got the chowder and I couldn't stop stealing some from of her bowl.
author: Jacqueline T.

description:
We were there for lunch on fleet day. At 11:30, the restaurant was not busy at all. I had my 3 year old toddler with me, and requested a table for 4. The waiter who served us declined my request, and seated us at a table for two. He told me the larger table was only for parties more than 2 people. 
In 5 minuets, this waiter then put 2 people at the table I initially requested. He did not even apologize when I made gesture to him about his inappropriateness. I don't know why he did that. The restaurant was nearly empty at the time.
author: Mike S.

description: We love this place near Fisherman's Wharf.  We come here each time we are in SF.  It quiet and quaint and the food is alway great.  We ordered the Pasta Angelina and the Clam Chowder/Crab Sandwich combo.  All was wonderful.
author: Amy C.

description: Walked here on a weekday. Hubby & I had the chowder, fish & chips, and shrimp Louie salad.  Everything was really good. Clean. Judy B provided excellent service and was very pleasant. Bathroom was clean too. I would recommend people to come here to eat if they were in Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Louisa L.

description: Surprised that it only has three stars just went for my first time today and ordered the cioppino and i can say its the best i have ever had! So much flavor and lots of seafood in it. Definitely worth the price!!! I will 100% come back again. Also the waitress gave us carafe of soda
author: Angelique M.

description:
I ate here because my parents went here on a date here when they were students. Unfortunately, when I went here, I felt like I wasn't treated like everyone else. We had a party of two, just walked in and asked for a table. Our waiter was polite enough, but he only came by when we asked for help. We weren't greeted with the same friendliness other parties were afforded, and we weren't told the specials or given the same attention. It might be that we look young or Asian and weren't tourists or families, but that shouldn't be a reason for subpar service.

I ordered clams and linguini. It was alright, nothing special. If you go here, I hope you get treated a little better or at least as any other customer would be treated.
author: Matt L.

description: On a scale of bad, okay, good, very good or excellent:  the food was okay.  The cioppino was good, but the shrimp scampi was just okay.  The water was awful...tasted like sea water.  The service was very good.
author: Jason F.

description: This place has really good seafood and a killer happy hour menu from 3 - 6 that includes $6.50 oysters, $5 bruschetta, and $7 wines. I come here with girlfriends during lunch and it's fast and tastes great. A great way to spend an hour on the wharf without spending a fortune.
author: Jessica D.

description: This place sucks more than any other place I've ever been to. Aaron D literally refused to give me avocado on my sandwich???? That was frickin wierd so my friend had to order a club sandwich and give me the avocado from theirs. There were three separate parties at the bar, including us. I got my initial drink and he never asked if I wanted another. I sat and watched him ask the other parties multiple times if they wanted another drink or anything else. Just flat out rude.... And the food sucked. I ordered a crab melt and there was maybe one tablespoon of crab (see photo) and the coleslaw was old and wilted. We left a tip for the first girl that started us off and a note for him. This place blows.
author: Mei H.

description: Sat outside.  Good people watching,  Saturday afternoon.  Tried their wild grilled salmon. Very good. Presentation good. Portion small ish. A little long on the steamed vegetables for the price. Guests tried the sourdough crab grilled cheese.  Very tasty.  Also had the bruchetta appetizer. Good portion and fresh. Very good. Fries about average at best. Service inattentive at best. Food came timely as we ate before the regular dinner rush, four pm, and hot. Three stars at best. Prices reflected the wharf in general but the food overall could be better. Attention to proper or lack there of to health department  table busing  skills observed .
author: Scott P.

description: Servers are friendly, if not a little rushed. Happy hour is great, terrace in the sun and if you order some little happy hour snacks (garlic bread or other similar tapas style snacks) you can drink as much beer, wine and well/short drinks as you wish! Good good place, especially for happy hour!
author: Kerry P.

description:
Disappointing food and service, not to mention overpriced. I would go somewhere else. My friend and I were drawn in by the happy hour menu and daily specials as I'm sure most other people are - drinks for $3-$6, bread bowl clam chowder for $5 and fish and chips for $8. My friend had the chowder and fish and chips. She reported back that the chowder was disappointing even for $5; there were probably 2 pieces of clam in the entire thing and the portion was close to half a can of soup you might get at the supermarket - ridiculous! 

I was most astounded, however, about the poor service and the fact that nobody took responsibility for it. When the bill came, we were charged $20 instead of $8 for the fish and chips. Upon inquiring, the staff sort of laughed and said that we "ordered the large size". In other words, too bad for me. At no point did the server try to clarify whether we wanted the fish and chips on special for $8 (which I'm assuming is a much smaller size) or the "larger" $20 plate. They were unapologetic and there was no attempt to resolve the issue. Ridiculous kind of bait and switch for a place with signs all over the place proudly advertising their specials. 

The bloody mary was pretty decent. If you go for the $4 bloody mary, make sure you clarify you want the one on special rather than the $16 one... at least they got that one right.
author: Sarah P.

description: I can literally just describe it as "food". It was fine.  Service was ...fine. Space wasn't great.  Unfortunately got stuck in a San Francisco tourist trap and was too tired to find anything else. 2 stars because it's hilariously expensive for what you get.
author: Stephen H.

description: Went on Saturday for lunch. They had Good service, had specials offered, and quick seating for lunch. Had kid's menu at reasonable price. I had the linguini and clams; my daughter had steamed crab.
author: Cyndi F.

description: Food is terrible, so as services. I would suggest to walk over to pier 39, you will find better food and better services for the same price.
author: Vincent C.

description: Awful experience. We ordered a variety of things--nothing was great -- food is sub-par at best. Possibly the WORST service I've ever experienced. Don't waste your time or money here.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
Horrendous experience with the management. Came here on a double date and had a pleasant time with actually very good food. Then it got weird. First a male worker walked in on our wives in the bathroom, then claimed he heard them "yelling". They weren't. Bizarre but we continued to have a nice evening. 

Then the manager comes out and gruffly says "wrap it up guys, we're closing". It was 9:50, they clearly close at 10, and there were other patrons still eating as well. I was blown away at how rude this manager was, and we had just spent $240. Who does that? Don't know his name but he should absolutely be fired. 

We live close by in Russian Hill and will tell everyone we know never to eat here.
author: Kevin M.

description: Don't do it. Just walk along the block and try something else. Service was fine but food was a huge disappointment. Just had fish and chips, not good. The combo Louie salad arrived and we were searching for the rest of it. In and out is across the street and we will be going there next.
author: V R.

description: Great place with nice indoor and outdoor seating areas, both very clean.  Fast service and attentive bartenders.
author: Chris C.

description: The food was good and good service.  My family was very happy and so was I.  There was nothing wrong with the waiters.  And my parents loved the clam bowl and I loved the chicken parmigiana. I appreciate everything thank you.
author: Dalton H.

description: Sat at the table for 15 minutes with 3 servers all in the area and none of them contacted us, once someone finally did she disappeared after our order. They then messed up our food orders after that. The food once it was right was almost average. Would not come again.
author: Emily C.

description: I wanted San Francisco food for my last weekend here, and that's exactly what I got: mussels, clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl, half a crab. The outdoor seating!! Is awesome!! Service was a bit slow but I didn't mind because it was so nice outside. Would definitely recommend if you're willing to spend (what I would consider) a bit more money on a nice meal.
author: Kevin W.

description: My husband and I were looking for a place to sit down for a drink and a small bite to eat. This place had really good specials for smaller serving sizes. We ordered the fish & chips, clam chowder in a bread bowl, and a Bloody Mary. The fish and chips were good, but the clam chowder was lukewarm. All in all, everything was ok for the price, but I would probably pay a bit more next time and go to a better restaurant or one of the street vendors.
author: Kate P.

description: Slow service and pricey for the quality of food. I ordered the club came out with no bacon. My girlfriend's crab salad and too many shells in it. Wouldn't recommend. Better options in fisherman's wharf.
author: Jeff M.

description: Place looks good and cleaned so we went in. Inside was empty but the patio had 7 tables . So the place wasn't packed at all. Our waiter was stressed an very unorganized . My plate came with a decent black hair on it ,so the waiter saw it and he took it with no problem. Waited for almost 15-20 min and all my family had finished their food almost , so I called the waiter and asked him about my order . The answer was " sorry I thought you don't wanna eat anymore " , I was hungry and actually starving after a long day walking in SF .  I ended up closing my check and went across the street and ate at in and out . It was delicious and consistent . Thank you for the good service , that's not how it supposed to be done . As a courtesy they should at least offer something instead , and I know these things in restaurant happen , but waiter should be more professional .
author: Michael S.

description: This was a a great restaurant along Fisherman's Wharf. We decided to sit and eat rather than standing in long lines and having to look for a place to sit and eat. Our server was personable, friendly and attentive! He even double checked if the cooks mixed the cookware with seafood and non seafood foods because my sister is allergic. They have happy hour 3-6 daily and when it's not happy hour they have specials like $5 clam chowder bread bowls and fish n chips. We sat outside on the patio. No dogs allowed inside or the patio. The chowder was good but it did have a lot of veggies in it which was different.
author: Janelle O.

description:
We came for Happy Hour deals. Got a Clam Chowder, a fried calamari, chicken wings and mussels.
The clam chowder tasted like hospital food, and the portion was very sad.
The the fried calamari was soggy (it's supposed to be crispy, right?)
The mussels and wings were 3 out of 10.
The deals weren't even that good - $5.50 beers, $8 appetizers.
Don't recommend.
author: Marina S.

description:
I went to have a dinner at Pompei's before my flight back home. 

The restaurant is conveniently located in Fisherman's Warf and offers a spacious patio and dinning room. 

I had the bowl of Clam Chowder that was filling, tasty and fresh. I liked the creaminess of the chowder and there was plenty of clams. 

I then went for the Francesco Misto ; seafood linguine served with a zesty tomato cream sauce. I was pleased at how many seafood was served with the dish. 

Like some other people mentioned, this place could had gotten a better note if it wasn't for the service. It's not that my waitress was bad but she lacked personality and warmness. Her service was very bland. Thankfully the manager was very nice and personable.
author: Bruno G.

description:
The bar tender fills the glasses to the brim with ice to reduce on the alcohol. And the service is terrible. A waiter talked badly to us and then we waited for 20 mins before someone came to take our food order and then when we said we're unhappy with the service he started blabbering things about bad customers.
Very unhappy with the place
author: Mina B.

description: Some of the worst service I have ever received. I should have known when the host was kind of rude, not wanting to answer our questions. The host ignored us and put up his hand to not serve us when we asked for water. They threw our plate down in front of us and one of the servers was watching us closely. Definitely made us feel like we didn't belong together. Made me wonder if they were racist!!!
author: Courtney T.

description: We went to Fisherman'sWwharf for some good seafood. This place had a sign out front advertising fish and chips for eight dollars and a bloody Mary for four. It wasn't on the menu, which was priced about 50% higher. so you have to ask for it by name. It came, it was good, we paid, and the price was what they advertised. Not a Ginormas helping of fish, but neither my wife nor I went away hungry. Very nice flaky and hot too. I asked for the Bloody Mary to be extra spicy, and it was.
author: Robert S.

description: Over priced for decent food. The clam chowder is good but I've had better. I also had the cocktail prawns which were nice and big but sadly they only give you about 5 prawns. Overall, a cool spot for an early lunch out on the patio area but nothing special here.
author: Mike Y.

description: After busy morning of fishing on the bay, I was looking for something to eat.  This was one of many seafood restaurants very close. I didn't expect much, but it is located on fisherman's wharf. Seafood should be pretty good, but this place missed on the mushroom risotto with prawns.  No flavor (zero!) on the prawns. Mushroom risotto was made with tomato sauce. I had to add a lot of salt and parmesan cheese to get any kind of flavor. Disappointing!
author: Russell H.

description:
Avoid. My husband and I attempted to have a pleasant dinner at Pompeis, however we didn't make it past the front door. So this is how the story went... My husband and I decided to put our names down to get a table. We stood in front of the podium for about 5 min while the hostess attended to other guest inside . As we waited to be greeted, two older women stood behind us, forming a line. When the hostess came back to the podium, she called the two women behind us to the front of the line, happily asked them how many in their party, and proceeded to take them inside. At this moment, I couldn't believe what had happened. We were right in front of the podium, yet she acted as if we were invisible. I was enraged but most of all disappointed. When she came back from sitting the older ladies she stalled before getting back to the podium. She then proceeded to let us know her only available table was inside, but the happy go-lucky hostess who helped the ladies behind us was nowhere to be found. we got a stale response. I looked her straight in the eyes and kindly told her "thanks but no thanks". I truly felt discriminated. We are a couple of color and felt that we were neglected and ignored because of our color/race. We happily took our money somewhere else. After reading other reviews we truly didn't miss out on anything worth paying. 

Stay away.
author: Emma A.

description: Been coming here since a kid.. used to be much much better. Food is average now but still has the same feel and location which is nice.
author: Mark P.

description:
This is right smack dab in the middle of touristville. With that said, nice happy hour.

Reasons why I would possibly come here again.

- for happy hour before 6pm. Why can't HH in SF be until 7pm like normal cities?
- for people watching
- for outdoor seating

That's all.
author: Priti K.

description:
Looking for a quick spot on Fisherman's Wharf to grab a drink and some grub. We saw a sign for happy hour, so we couldn't resist. 

Decent prices on mixed drinks and beers on draft. Food was unimpressive and bland. There wasn't anything too memorable about this restaurant, but it does the trick if you have low expectations and feeling thirsty.
author: Emily R.

description: Did not plan on going here but after a long day of biking and our original plan being put on hold, we decided to check this place out.  First of all it was happy Hour and we seated ourselves in the bar area.  It was quite busy when we went.  The Bartender took our drink orders and came right back with our drinks.  We ordered two items off of the happy hour menu and got them within 5-7 minutes.  We then ordered the Captain's Platter and it was enough to share, this came in about 8-10 minutes after ordering.  All hot fresh and delicious.  Our Bartender/Server was always attentive and she was very courteous.  No complaints, delicious and I would go back here when I visit the area again.
author: Chelle L.

description:
If I could give them minus 5 stars I would... we waited for our food for an hour (no lie)and nothing.  All other tables that got there after us got their food but we still didn't even get outer drinks. 
We asked for a manager and he said.. "oh we are busy, your server should of told you that".  Look I understand if a restaurant is busy, we expect a delay of about 20 to 30 mins. But at least get our drinks and bring bread, I asked for a mimosa... a mimosa,  even my spell check knows what a mimosa is.  I was told oh we don't have whatever that is. PLEASE PLEASE.. DO NOT GO THERE.  We ended up leaving after an hour and a half (it took the manager 30 minutes to show up).
author: Yessi T.

description:
Came into this restaurant since I was taking a tour bus near by. Everything was pretty packed since it was Saturday and Easter weekend. We where sat right away. The restaurant itself was very cute and had a homey feeling. Our server took our drink orders and we also told her we wanted to order appetizers, which we did. 15,...20 min later the server drops off some bread. Then about 15 minutes later the oyster app. And also water, she mumbles that the bar is busy for our drinks. okay that's understandable. She later brings the second appetizer which was a shrimp cocktail
Worst 19$!! It had 4 shrimps and a lemon. We finish our appetizers and are about to leave and cancel our drinks when the server drops off our drinks. Half way done with my drink, she drops off my appetizer/entree. Two very late alcohol drinks and three appetizers (which where served at random times) later we get our bill 83$smh oh and the free hard bread basket. I don't recommend this place.
author: Mona A.

description: This is a wonderful spot for happy apps and drinks. I had a $5 chowder-sourdough bread bowl and my hubby had a bowl of steamed mussels for about $7.50. Both were good portions and satisfying.  The bloody Mary's were a good pour but nothing serious. the bread was soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. I wish there'd been more of it, actually. The mussels were fresh and nicely cooked.  I loved the bread, using it to sop up the broth in the bowl.  The prices were great. The one thing that probably ruined our experience from being a 5 star, bringing it down to a 3 star was that it was tough to get any assistance.  it seemed like although there were over 5 different servers on the patio deck, only one would help us.  I thought that team work made the dream work. I guess not!  we tried to get the attention of 5 different people who worked for the restaurant.  two of them were closer than arm's reach. I'm sure that he and his co worker saw and heard us calling to them and reaching for them. seriously, all we were asking for was a pen for the guests who were sitting next to us who had asked us for one just previous. anyway, we called out to them only to watch them walk away. we kept on calling out to the different servers. they were on their phones. they didn't come and ask if we needed anything. I wonder if they were bored because they didn't have much to do inside since the patio was where the action was. still, you would think that they would help out on the patio or that they would stay inside and just not do anything in there. it was horrible. the manager will be hearing from us.
author: Chris C.

description: Nice little place that didn't have a wait. Food was so-so but if you're craving saucy spaghetti that's hot and fast to your table, this is the place. Ask for Aaron; he gave us plenty of bread and was refilling our drinks before we had to ask.
author: Cheeky C.

description: We got the "snack" specials; bread bowl with clam chowder for $5 and fish and chips for $8. The clam chowder was tasty and a great deal compared to many of the restaurants that sell it for upwards of $12. It was also a regular sized bread bowl, not necessarily one I would title snack size. The fish and chips only came with two strips over a bed of fries and were a bit small, but still tasty. We went around 1:00 on Friday and were pretty much their only business and it has been pretty empty every time we've walked by since. Servers were friendly and attentive.
author: Emma J.

description: Wow, so disappointed in the restaurant Choices. Outside patio area looked relaxing and comfortable. Clever folks lured me in by the drinks on display they have outside the host area. Nothing sounds better then a drink after a little shopping. Well very limited drink/ happy hour menu. I had to order shots on the side to even be able to taste any alcohol at all. Really you have a great location here and just mediocre food and drinks. So disappointed.
author: Michelle S.

description:
We love San Francisco and have made it a point to visit the city when ever we get the chance. And being a fan of the wharf area we usually book a room close by as it has such a great atmosphere. Having said that it would only be natural for us to frequent the restaurants located there.

It was our second day in San Fran and we were having a hard time deciding where to go to dinner. So I went online and looked at several menus of restaurants close to us and one of them was Pompei's Grotto. The menu looked interesting and we thought we would give it a try. 

It was quite cool that evening so we decided to sit inside. We had a table close to the window so we had a good view of the action outside and the sun as it was setting. My wife ordered one of those fancy drinks and proceeded to down it quit quickly. Luckily they brought us some sourdough bread and butter or I'm sure she would have been passed out before the main course arrived.

Now, for our dinner... my wife had the Crab Louie salad. She was quit pleased with it as it had a generous portion of crab and all the fixings that go with it. As I had looked at their menu online earlier in the afternoon I had decided to get the Francesco Misto. It was a pasta dish that included fresh mussels, clams, scallops, calamari, and jumbo shrimp with fettuccine, fresh tomatoes, garlic, and basil in a tomato cream sauce. It was out of this world! A huge portion as you can see in the photo that I have attached, and to top it off they have a shaker of fresh parmesan cheese on every table... so you can shake to your hearts content! 

I only wish we had stayed in San Francisco another day as I'm sure I would have returned the next night and had the same dish again as I enjoyed it so much!
author: Paul P.

description:
Ask for Pedro. 

I came here while on vacation with my family after walking out of a nearby restaurant that failed to even bring us drinks. Right away I was greeted by a kind, smiling hostess named Diana. I never write yelp reviews, but Pedro delivered my family LITERALLY the best service I have ever received in a restaurant. He was extremely accommodating, friendly, quick, and humble. I WISH every server I had was even half as great as Pedro. 

We ordered fettuccine Alfredo, fish & chips, a crab melt, and the Captain's platter. All of it was great and reasonably priced.
author: Adrien H.

description:
I thought this place was fine but there was nothing special about it besides the location on Fisherman's Wharf. I ordered the grilled giant prawns which comes with potatoes and veggies and a house chardonnay. The food was good but pretty basic. There was nothing exciting about the flavors, presentation, or quality. Ambiance is also fine but nothing stood out. 

I would not feel particularly compelled to go back. I'm sure there are much more exciting and delicious seafood places in San Francisco.
author: Diane R.

description:
1st visit:

Had the breadbowl with clam chowder.  Good taste to it. The server was good. Attentive staff and helpful manager. 

2nd visit: 
Had the surf and turf. Great flavor and nice size portion of veggies. Just a few scallops wish they had more though. Server this time was just okay .
author: Julian M.

description:
Don't get discouraged by the low rating. I'm actually surprised why it's so low. We were apprehensive at first but came in anyway. Very delicious seafood. Best clam chowder I've ever had (yes I've had it in Boston). Seafood really fresh. The pasta misto is a must try! The tacos are delicious. The crab melt is fabulous. We shared the fried seafood platter also wonderful. The salmon blt not good at all. Don't get that. The service was ok due to lack of employees and unhappy, overworked waiters. Either way 
You should try this place if your visiting. Really fresh and delicious.
author: Anush O.

description:
My friends and I were tempted by the Happy Hour signs, which looked like a good deal, so we stopped here.  I probably should have known better because this place is located right by Fisherman's wharf on the waterfront.  

The five of us waited around 20 minutes for a table, which was kind of a bummer because we just wanted a quick snack.  

After realizing that the $5 bruschetta was just two pieces of bread, we decided against it.  My friends got the fried zucchini and said that it tasted soggy.  The crunchy part just fell off.  

I suppose the only highlight was that the server was nice enough to give us bread when we asked for it.  

I personally would never come back here.  I think that there are much better options if you venture a little farther from all the tourist areas.
author: Shannon L.

description:
I haven't been to this place in about 35 years. It's good to know that they are making the same excellent dishes now that they were then.

I remember my dad eating the crab ciopino. I was not brave enough to order it.

I can attest that the sanddabs, cod and clam chowder are still excellent. 

Going back next time I'm in the city.
author: David T.

description:
Where can I start??..
This place is over priced for the upsetting food they serve you. I would not come here at all, you would think being in San Francisco on fishermen's wharf, it would be amazing and worth the price. i come from los Angeles
And I can honestly say, I would rather eat seafood out there, money isn't a issue but the food is very important.
author: Damiana G.

description: Do not eat here! I was very disappointed! After a 13 mile hike my crab sandwich was so sad. Tasted like imitation crab and had no flavor at all and was the most expensive subway sandwich I ever had! I do not recommend This place
author: Vanessa L.

description: It's a cute little spot! Feels like a cottage with big windows to people watch. Why not stop by while you are strolling around the strip?! Friendly and funny host sat us 7 immediately by the window. It's really a family oriented restaurant, tho we were a bit on the loud side, waiters were friendly. We ordered mussels(yummy), calamari and loads of cocktails. Price were decent too.
author: Vee V.

description:
Our first meal upon arrival to San Francisco was here. It definitely got us started on the right foot! We were lured in by an outdoor patio and happy hour specials. The servers were nice and checked in on us frequently. My guy and I ordered happy hour beers, which were pretty much the regular price I'm used to paying at home (aka their regular drink prices seemed a bit high).

For food, we ordered the happy hour bruschetta ($5), I ordered the clam chowder in the sourdough bowl, and my guy got the happy hour fish tacos ($7.50 for 2). The bruschetta was two nice sized pieces, loaded with tomatoes, garlic, and oil. It was flavorful, and a good little appetizer. The chowder was great! I have no chowder experience outside of a can of soup (which I hated), so I thought this was awesome. I feel like maybe the bread bowl had been cut open recently and was in the early stages of drying out, but it didn't really take away from the meal. My guy enjoyed his tacos a lot as well. It was a good amount of food to refuel us after a long flight, and get us ready to go exploring.

I do feel like the prices are just a tad high due to the tourist location, but it was manageable overall. We left satisfied with our experience!
author: Suzanne B.

description: Went For happy hour Food was okay Like everyone else they have over priced draft for $5 a glass & happy hour food specials ranging from $5 to $7:50 I would save your money go in town where the prices are more reasonable
author: Lou M.

description:
Touristy area, but my cousin had never been to SFO before, so we took a stroll down to Fisherman's Wharf.  Inevitably we got hungry as we were walking, and this little joint was running some happy hour specials.

I had the fish tacos, the garlic fries, and a beer for under 20 bucks.  

Good service.  Nice day to sit outside.  

Everything was pretty decent.  Nothing out of this world, but a perfect little bite as we were making our way through the big bad streets of San Fran.

Not quite at a 4, but a little more than a 3 here.
author: Laurie V.

description: NOPE. Smells great when you walk in, but don't be fooled! The food is mediocre and the service is awful - if you can get your server to pay attention. Asked for manager to assist when check had been requested three times and he could not have cared less. TOURIST TRAP. Oh, and they add gratuity on their own.
author: Amelia C.

description: We had the fish and chips for $5. Bloody Mary was very spicy.  Sat on the patio in the sun. Good service. Good food.
author: danielle d.

description: Well let's start with the menu the price is not correct on the web or YELP.  The waiter was nice he said they are under new ownership and he would guess they have not updated the site.  Feel bad for him I'm sure it's not the first time he has been asked.  Order a appetizer of bruschetta and the bread was burnt  I will update the post as the meal comes.  Hope it's worth the price.
author: Corey S.

description: They were good. Waiter made great recommendations.  Seafood was fresh but they aren't worth the cost.
author: Jessica B.

description: Well not sure where to start for such a subpar place. The place was empty when we arrived and yet it took sometime to take our order and get our drinks. Seems the service time was busier catching up o what they did over the weekend. Chowder was pretty delicious however this would be our first and last time coming here.
author: Melinda V.

description: The food is good.  Classic bread bowl with clam chowder, fish tacos and beer. A match made in paradise!!
author: Robert W.

description: The place is small but the food and service were fantastic. Probably the best scallops I have ever had.
author: Wesley C.

description: My boyfriend and i went all up and down the warf looking for the perfect place to eat dinner. The prices for seafood were rediculous!!  we saw the reasonible prices for seafood and decided to give it a try.  upon entering, the bar actully looked really cozy. we went and sat there and were greeted by a bar tender. We had both a guy and a really nice red head was friendly and helpful.The food was good and the service was great.
author: Michelle L.

description: Service was good. Food was meh. Kids meals were inconsistent in size. One child got a very small serving of spaghetti, while the other had a huge platter of chicken fingers and fries. Chowder was ok. The roasted crab dish had some odd red sauce on it, ruined the crab. I would not recommend this restaurant.
author: Laura L.

description: Ordered fettuccini with prawns. Very disappointing. Food was cold and the sauce on the noodles was separating. I will not go back.
author: CaliFinfan B.

description: Just moved here from up north from Santa Rosa. It was cold and rainy and decided to get some claim chowder in a bread bowl. Went here because I saw a $5 claim chowder in a bread bowl deal. I ordered it. I got 90% bread the rest was soup. I was let down. Instead of paying $5. I paid $15. The claim chowder wasn't that good. I left very disappointed. Don't go here.
author: Frank A.

description:
II don't know why I keep giving these restaurants on Jackson chance after chance because I'm always disappointed. My daughter is a picky eater so fish is out, which limits her options so we generally stick with Italian. 

The service was horrible. We waited forever to place our order, when we were done and ready for dessert we waited to long and then when we were ready for our bill it again took much longer than necessary.

We ordered:

Scallops: zero flavor, greasy, over cooked veggies and they were cold. Boo

Lasagna: basic, nothing special and again it was not hot. 

San Francisco has an amazing amount of restaurants that are to die for. I will not waste my money on this tourist trap crap again. 

*this review was for a visit a few months ago that I started writing a review for but lost interest and dragged my feet to finish. Yes ... it was that underwhelming. This is a shameful example to unsuspecting tourists thinking this is "great SF food". Yuck!
author: Christie B.

description:
Fish n chips average at best.
Service average at best.
Ambiance not bad.
Decent happy hour prices.
author: H G.

description:
3pm-6:30pm starts a decent happy hour.  $4 house wines and well cocktails are always welcome in my book.

I also really liked how clean and creamy my clam chowder was.  Big chunks of clam, not over loaded with veggies.  I was actually a huge fan of how the chowder was done here.  It was not on the HH menu, but a cup was under $6 so I was satisfied with that price.

The HH menu had $5 calamari, fried shrimps, and something else fried that didn't look too appealing to me.  $3 for garlic parmesan fries (which we had)  were pretty good.  $3 for Bruschetta and something else...The absence of recalling the whole HH menu indicates that I wasn't overly impressed, nor did I dislike anything on it. 

 I the only food I had that had me excited was the clam chowder.

Overall, I like the history and quaintness of this place and you can never go wrong with $4 wine (right?).
author: Susan C.

description:
As I begin to write this review I notice that this restaurants management has not responded to any previous reviews so I hope this does not fall on deaf ears.  

My wife and I visited this establishment on Sunday evening. Our server promptly greeted us and took our drink order.  My wife really enjoyed her cocktail and we were pleased with the crab cake starter we ordered and then things went downhill from there.  

I ordered a fettuccine dish with a variety of seafood in a creamy tomato sauce.  My dish was a little bland and the pasta was slightly undercooked. In addition, the calamari was over cooked and chewy. I somewhat expect this in seafood combo dishes because some cooks are lazy and do not layer ingredients into the dish properly so no big deal.  

The real issue was with my wife's dish. She ordered a fried seafood platter consisting of cod, shrimp, calamari, and scallops.  The scallops were almost raw so we sent the dish back which only made matters worse.  Instead of cooking new scallops the kitchen made the decision to throw the entire plate back into the deep fryer which is a huge no-no.  While the scallops came cooked, everything else on the plate was now over cooked and greasy tasting.  

Our server was very apologetic when we decided to send back both of our entrees and call it a night.  We asked that both entrees be removed from the bill. At this point I expected to see a manager come to the table to apologize and try to rectify the matter but that never happened.  I actually apologized to our server and told him I felt bad that he was in the position of having to be in a customer facing role representing an inept kitchen staff and a manager that obviously does not care about his  customers or his staff. Our server smiled, nodded, and gave me a look that told me I was accurate.  

Avoid this place at all cost. If management continues to sweep these glaring issues under the rug and ignore their customers feedback I expect their fate will be much like that of the city whose name they have taken.
author: Bob R.

description: terrible service :( had to pay for extra bread for 3$! bad service food was satisfactory, i had the shrimp scampi and it was unnecessarily oily and just overall not a great place.
author: Jillian D.

description: It was a monday aroubd lunch time not busy at all. We were a party of 4. We were seated outside then we waited and waited. Saw 4 different servers walk by and go to other tables multiple times (one if them seated 5 minutes after us). I raised my hand a couple times but no one saw me, i would say we were there for 15 to 20 minutes. My wife was like , " ok if one more server walks by without greetung us, lets just leave".  True enough one walks by to check on a table. So we get up and leave. Once we get to the sidewalk we see a server go over and clear our menus off tge table.. it's like we were invisible.  Lunch here would have been close to 100$ for us, we ended up going to Boudins instead.
author: P P.

description:
We ate at Pompei's Grotto on San Fancisco wharf. First time the food was great! Second time just ok. Fried shrimp over cooked. Should of sent them back. My clam appetizer was very good. 
We were unaware of a 5% SF Mandat charge which $3.00 was added to our bill. It's their way of making the consumer pay for employees health care. After talking with the server, many of the other restaurants are doing this too.
author: Linda V.

description: Solid meal with no complaints but also unexceptional. Portion sizes are large and staff are friendly.
author: Michael H.

description:
We popped in here for happy hour in an effort to drink and forget our aching feet. We took a seat (ahhhh sitting) at a table in the bar area, near the window, which was great for people watching since the restaurant doesn't have a view of the bay. 

The bartender was friendly, but accidentally forgot us often. Regardless, their happy hour prices are good and we weren't in a huge rush. Husband got the fried zucchini and a beer while I was excited to have the mussels. Nathan made a face at my order, and the bartender made one too and talked about how they remind her of the texture of snot. I was taken aback. I just ordered it! What the heck. 

Anyway, the mussels were fresh and plump and in an incredible garlic butter sauce or something. SO GOOD. The bartender said she'd bring over some bread, which I planned on dipping in the sauce... but it didn't come. Then we reminded her. And still nothing. We'd all but given up on the idea when she finally came around. 

Husband's fried zucchini was pretty good. Satisfying and good for a happy hour snack, no complaints. p.s. For argument's sake, he ended up eating TWO of my mussels. He was surprised to find he enjoyed them a lot, saying that the texture is nothing like clams, which was what he expected.
author: Natalie G.

description: Very pricey and the food doesn't taste good . Our complete order was overwhelmed with tomato .
author: Anand S.

description: Maaaaaan they need to be giving out free breadsticks and stuff man while I wait for my food. Chicken alfredo is decent but the shrimp gambi something was dankies fam
author: Anthony D.

description:
Nothing special; service is slow and not friendly... very expensive mediocre food. The only thing nice is the atmosphere when you're sitting outside.
Not worth the money, that's for sure!!
author: R W.

description:
My wife and I spend a weekend in San Francisco a couple of times a year.  This year it was the 4th of July weekend.  Her favorite spot for dinner has been Pompei's Grotto.  We've been there at least once a year since we met 12 years ago.  Well, it seems that sometime in the past year they have had a change in ownership.  No problem getting a table on Sunday evening of the three-day weekend should have been our first warning.  We settled into the bar and actually decided to go ahead and eat there, one of those tall round tables.  The service was excellent as it always had been but the food was a huge disappointment.

We had crab cocktails that were mostly lettuce. My wife ordered a seafood fettuccine that turned out to be mostly clams and scallops, minimal prawns and she was hunting for crab.  One small piece of some sort of whitefish.  My order was Ok, a crab melt sandwich but they are better at the ball park.  Prices are now sky high and we spend $100.00 without ordering any alcohol, one soda and water, no dessert.  I did have a Ceasar Salad but it was pretty plain with no anchovies.  You can get a better salad at Strings.  Sorry to say we won't be going back, looking for our next favorite at Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Eric H.

description: They had the best chicken parmigiana I've ever had. Our waitress was very nice and answered all our questions. They also had the best clam chowder I've ever had. Great service and great food.
author: Morgan W.

description:
Was looking for a chowder bread bowl and walked up this place. I was there at around 11:30 and there weren't that many people there. Got seated as soon as we got there and since it was hot outside, I requested to sit inside and my group was the only one inside! 

Chowder was good but I'm actually not a huge fan of seafood, and there were a lot of clams which I didn't like. I would have liked more potatoes instead, but if you're a seafood person, this chowder is for you. 

They also served bread, but it was kind of hard and just mediocre. My friends got crab cakes and the crab sandwich, and they both said those were good so some other good options. If you're around fishermans warf, make sure to try the Dungeness crab- it's supposed to be famous!
author: Panny S.

description: Food is killer. We almost passed on the place because there is no ocean view (the ONLY REASON they got 4 instead 5 stars). I'm glad we chose this place! Perfect portions, flavors and price. We got the crab cakes, clam chowder  (best I've ever had) and fishermen's stew. I'd definitely eat here again and/or recommend.
author: Mike W.

description: Went there for dinner with family. The seafood was average, nothing exceptional. Atmosphere was pleasant and service was good. Only recommendation would be to warm the bread before serving. Cold bread isn't that satisfying, especially on a chilly summer night.
author: Sonam K.

description: Had house salad, which was mixed greens, Italian dressing. It had diced tomatoes and cucumbers on top. It was perfect for afternoon meal. I also had the clam chowder in a bread bowl. It was not very salty, but very chowdery. The outside patio was perfect for people watching while waI g to be served. If you come between the hours of noon &3, you can get the bread bowl chowder for $6. It's a better deal than at the pier. ;~} I would definitely come back and eat here
author: DreaAah G.

description: Clam Chowder is good, not the rest. The salmon appetizer looked like it was from Costco, the Risotto was overlooked and not fresh. Overpriced.
author: Robert S.

description:
My husband and I decided to spend the day near the water in SF and wanted to try somewhere new.  We settled on Pompei's Grotto as they didn't seem to have a wait at 7pm on a Sunday, had outdoor seating, and had a scallop dish - something I seem to be obsessed with as of late.

I really like that we were seated right away, we had two different waiters ask us for water, and the menu wasn't too long which would give me too many options and lead me to never settle.  

I ordered the scallops and shrimp and they were great; it was a bit of a wait but it was worth it.  My husband ordered the steak and he loved it - it was perfectly cooked.  We both think this is a great restaurant to visit after working up an appetite spending a day in SF.

Reason why I'm not giving 5 stars: I wish their outside patio had some heaters; I found it shocking that an outside patio on the water in SF wouldn't have heating sources.
author: A. Christina S.

description:
We were ordered "the best" dish they have ( seafood plate in tomato sauce) ... omg it was sooo spicy, I couldn't even feel the taste of food. They killed the taste ... crab cakes was good, but not wow. So if you wanna try some so-so food- you're welcome!
At least our waiter was really nice!
author: Anfisa K.

description:
We were seated for fifteen minutes before we even saw our server. When we finally were graced with her very annoyed attitude she insisted that we place the entirety of our order at once. This was at 2:30 in the afternoon (several open tables no rush). After we placed our order we didn't see her for twenty minutes until our appetizers came out. The calamari was cold and very lack luster. The main course was a lot of the same. I went with the captain platter and nothing was very good. My fiancé got the salmon and it was incredibly greasy. I would avoid if possible. There are much much better places to dine in the area. Just a few blocks away is Little Italy with amazing restaurants.

Poor service, poor food, poor experience.
author: John G.

description: They should be ashamed of themselves! Food quality very poor! From fried calamari which was desiccated, to pan burned scallops, to gross sautéed fillet of sole which was bone dry! Only positive was friendly server! Would stay away!
author: Stan N.

description: Avoid happy hour at all costs!  The calamari, shrimp and wings were worse than frozen.  Maybe the food you pay more for is better but happy hour was anything but happy.
author: Julie S.

description: This is one of many choices at Fisherman's Wharf and I haven't been to any other so couldn't say if I recommend it over others. What I can say is that they have a nice outdoor seating area and the indoor looked nice as well. I was lured in by the $6 clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl and it was totally worth it. I was seated right away but my waiter wasn't very attentive and took forever to get me the check. It was still a pretty nice experience.
author: Marisa L.

description:
We regretted eating here. The service was subpar. The food wasn't that good and was overpriced. We do not mind paying for a good meal... But this was just a meal.  The mixed drinks were pretty awful. For mediocre lunch for two (and two awful drinks) our meal was $90.00+ after tip. 
Walk a little more toward the water and there are much better places to eat.... We discovered a few other places in fisherman's wharf they were either less expensive and just as good, or same price and way better.
author: Kristen G.

description: I was appalled by their service. They didn't give me my bread right away. Don't recommend, and if you get orange juice just be warned that it might be spiked.
author: Nichole H.

description: We came here for a late lunch, hardly any other customers were here, however our service was TERRIBLE. About 10 mins before we even saw a waitress.... Food is just so-so. Not planning to come back.
author: Courtney G.

description: Food was good. Had the salmon blt and the cole slaw was awesome. Reasonably priced. Service was lacking. Sat on the patio.
author: Meredith B.

description:
I'm not too sure what to think about this place. First of all, their host was wearing a sweater of which one can pull up the hood to form a mask (very scary). Their menu has a nice selection of food, pasta, seafood in all variations, chicken dishes and so on. I personally chose fish and chips and was fairly disappointed as I had 3 tiny pieces of fish plus a massive load of chips - and paid $20 which I thought was not worth it.
The service was brilliant, our waiter was very friendly and helpful.
author: Sarah H.

description: This is for  their Happy Hour 3-6  Great 3-5$ apps amazing mussels and calamari sourdough bread with the stomach and I live or else I'll tell caring are $4 per well and $3 beers
author: Patti P.

description: The daily specials were affordable and tasty - $8 fish & chips, and $5 clam chowder in bread bowl. But everything else on the menu was obnoxiously expensive, much of it $20-30 per plate, except for appetizers (which were in the $12-18). Pleasant outdoor street side tables and friendly waitstaff.
author: Karl D.

description:
Greg and I were wandering around San Fran during a 10 Hour layover. I just really wanted some fish and sourdough. After checking out some places on yelp, We found this. It is right in the center of the main road going between Fisherman's wharf, and Ghiradelli Square. It is the PERFECT spot for people watching. We sat outside on the patio, and barely even talked as we watched all the San Fran Crazies go by. Our server was attentive, humorous, and friendly. 

The sour dough was perfect, melt in your mouth.
The fish was a native Pacific Ocean one, and tasted identical to cod. It wasn't anything special, and was served with veggie sides that were pretty nasty, and definitely not fresh.  The pasta was also way too oily, and had no flavor. I feel like there is much better food to have tried at other places. However, for my 10 hours that I had in San Fran, I was satisfied for choosing here.
author: Kim B.
