description: spent the weekend with family and decided to have dinner at the famous fishermans warf. we ended up going to pompei's grotto. they have a great outdoor seating and inside was simple but very clean. the food was delicious. the seafood was fresh and well seasoned. overall the restraunt was good! the reason for the three star, slow service from waiters. i dont know if they were short of staff but that needs improvement. and lack of receipt given to us. we needed to ask for our receipt. make sure to ask for it because they include gratuity already on the bill. hoping this review helps.
author: Jep A.

description:
We went for happy hour and no no no this place is all wrong.

The apps they serve taste old and barely warm. The portion size is very small but maybe because I'm used of the amazing happy hour scene in Boston.

I personally would not go again or recommend unless you like old tasting cold food
author: Guadalupe K.

description: Had the crab sandwich...hardly any meat and children could have executed this better. Also the spaghetti sauce seemed like it came out of a can...
author: Dave W.

description: My husband and I have enjoyed many an amazing dish of Fettuccini Alfredo here. Second to my mom's, truly the most authentic Alfredo I've ever had. Unfortunately something, besides the paint and decor have changed here. Service is TERRIBLE. Servers are not nice, neither is the hostess. Alfredo is as good as ever, but don't expect anyone to be nice to you. I miss the old days here.
author: Michelle M.

description: Great food, great happy hour, great location, perfect atmosphere but the worst service, bad waitress, waitress with a bad attitude, rude, Hispanic lady. Everything else was great, just bad service
author: Marianne L.

description:
Had lunch outside. 
The food was pretty good. That would have received 4 stars. 
The server lacked any personality at all. Serviceable, but the service could have really set this place apart. 
We also had to deal with folks walking by smoking. Surprised at the number of young people smoking in San Fran.
author: Ed B.

description: Wow!!! The best fish&chips I've ever had.  I'm not sure what's in the tartar sauce, but it was AMAZING!  Will be going back.
author: James W.

description:
I expected very little from this place based on Yelp reviews and initial impressions.

Yes, it took a bit for the waiter to show up.  Yes, I had to request the bread basket and the olive oil/balsamic tray.  Yes, the table was ridiculously small.

But it got better.

The Bruschetta was not worth it, especially not for $10.95 ... stick with the bread basket.  However, the Francesco Misto and the Fish Stew were both tasty and filling.

This is San Fran, a tourist trap and you should expect to pay $$ for just about everything.  Expect anything less and you will probably be disappointed.

When ordering a 2nd glass of Malbec, the waiter did recommend getting a bottle as it was 50% OFF based on what we ordered.  Kudos to him but wish he mentioned this before ordering the 1st glass.

They have a mandatory 5% SF charge tagged to their bill for higher wages.  Getting tired of this.  Either allow the customers to just TIP based on service or raise the menu prices and eliminate the TIP.  Customers will decide if it's worth it to keep on patronizing the business.
author: David P.

description: Excellent place.  Very friendly and helpful employees. Bar is awesome too!!!!  We come here every time we come to San Francisco.  (Been coming since mid 60's).  This place is a short walk from the cable car turnaround.
author: Larry H.

description:
Horrible horrible all around. Got seated right away and the lady that sat us and the server kept looking at us from the distance almost if they weren't sure if we were gonna take a bite at them. After the server got the guts to come up to us she quickly try to rushed us to ordered. Upon asking her for the selection of drinks she only offered us alcoholic beverages when she clearly saw us with our 8 month baby. When I asked her for her non alcoholic beverages she looked at us with this crazy look like if I'm asking her to marry her daughter lol. Again quickly gave us only 3 options she said, "umm coke? Apple juice, pineapple juice? WTF?

The food was horrible. I was surprised how quickly they brought it to us but only because its obviously frozen food. A quick bask in the fryer and boom got a $16.95 dollar meal. (I ordered the seafood sampler) 

My wife got the Caesar salad. Salad hardly tossed with the dressing. Better of with a McDonald salad seriously.

Aside from that I heard some employees and their drama. Something about the greeter not seating the people correctly and the servers upset. One of the servers walking around with some ridiculously big sades like he's Stevie Wonder not professional at all.

My server Lina a young girl with an accent was nice after she found out we don't bite.

On a good note the coca cola tasted great!
author: Carlos C.

description:
We were strolling down the wharf path on a Sunday night, looking for a place that offers a decent meal with happy hour deals. Pompei looked like every other Seafood joint on the block but they did not have someone hard-selling their restaurant in the front, which is usually such a turn-off for me. We were seated on the patio, which was very busy, but the inside of the restaurant looked a little dead (it's Fisherman's Wharf afterall).

We order almost everything on the happy hour menu ($5-7.5) except for the calamari:
- buffalo wings: no surprise, comme ci comme ca
- mussels: the mussels were tiny and not very fresh, but the garlic butter parsley sauce was excellent with bread!
- fried shrimps: tasted like pre-frozen shrimps but tasted pretty good with the tartar sauce
- fish tacos: really meh...
- garlic parmesan fried: crispy, and very flavourful! Liked this menu the most

We also ordered the fisherman's stew ($26) (tomato broth with mussels, shrimps, calamari, fish with a side of sourdough toast). I'd give this a 7/10, they didn't cheap out on the seafood, but the broth was a little too tangy, and did not absorb the flavour of the seafood well enough. The portion was huge though! We were stuffed by the end.

The ambiance was great but food wasn't too exceptional. Service was excellent!
author: Ivy W.

description: Ok so this may seem harsh but the outside looks great and inviting. The hosts was terrible. No passion for her job and boy can you tell. Food was ok and our waiter was great. Made the experience manageable. We have to children so we like a proof service and they did have that. Again mostly down to out waiter. The tables are a nightmare. Piece of paper for on top of a table cloth causing an unsightly and annoying tablecloth cover. Not like the ones that are neatly clipped down. Over priced and wouldn't recommend.
author: Kyle H.

description:
Late in posting this but interesting to read all the reviews since we were there. 

Reviews are like people. Everyone is different.
We had come to San Fran from Oregon in June, 2014 for medical reasons. 

We ate at one of the classy Pier 39 restaurants the day before (owned by a famous San Fran. family) and was absolutely disgusted with the service, the price, and over rated food. View of Golden Gate and Alcatraz nice but not very edible. Next day, tried Pompei. No view but what a difference. These places were a late lunch for us so seating not much of a problem.
 
Pompei's Grotto is the place for linquini and clams. I died for it. My wife had the sea bass and was absolutely in love with it and she's a really picky sea bass person. 
The good Italian wine with the great sourdough bread and butter was another hit. 

Seeing the pictures on the wall near the bar area was neat as I had been coming to Fisherman's Wharf with my parents since I was a kid. (I'm 69 at the time of this writing.)

Some people didn't like this place or its food. Take it in stride as the City is a tourist mecca and places cater to that. But don't go to Alioto's unless you are rich and don't care about the level of service.
author: Dave R.

description: Food was just okay, pretty overpriced for basic food. Clam chowder was horrible. Chowder on the street market is way better. And service was very disappointing.  Not welcoming at all and made us feel rushed, and for a place where gratuity is included?
author: Joy P.

description: My dad said his clam chowder was decent not the best cup he's ever had. The Pirates punch cocktail what had a funky taste and the food took a while,  even though we only ordered salads and apps.  The girls next to us arrived after us and were served first and were cleaning their plates before we got our food. But the servers were kind and accommodating. The blue cheese dressing is home made here and it's delicious! Not a destination spot but not a bad place to stop if you're in the area.
author: Jennifer S.

description: This place is amazing!  The fish and chips were amazing and the tartar sauce was the best ever!  $8?  Seriously?  In San Francisco that is unheard of! The clam chowder is on point as well!
author: Carrie W.

description: We're visiting from Oklahoma and thought we would give this restaurant a try. We both ordered the $8 fish and chips, and it was underwhelming but it was $8 so you get what you pay for, I guess. The service was slow. We spent more time waiting for someone to help us and for our check than we did actually eating lol. The food came out pretty quickly, but we spent maybe 15 minutes waiting for our check. We finally just got up and asked for it. 2/10 would recommend. I would keep walking if I were you.
author: April K.

description: Very delicious crab sandwich, good service although I'm typing this as I'm waiting a little too long for the check. Cute decor and atmosphere, no AC!!
author: Lauren K.

description:
Love this place.....

We walked back and forth and appraised all the menus on the Wharf before choosing Pompei's, and were very glad we did. Fairly decent prices for food at what is a tourist site. Also really liked that they accommodated my requests to change the pasta and side for the chicken piccata without charging me extra (and the chicken piccata was very tender and delicious, which was fantastic). Waitress was so friendly.....

Choose this one when at the Wharf!
author: Augusta J.

description: We could not have had a better experience - delicious food, prompt service and a good deal for the area. Definitely recommended.
author: Ralitza M.

description: They trick you with the signs out front saying $8 fish and chips but once inside they tell you thats the kids size. The adults portion seemed to be a kids portion.
author: Chad B.

description: Visiting from Southern California and we were expecting delicious seafood seeing as this was a pricy restaurant right off the pier in SAN FRANCISCO!!! I honestly don't know if it was because we ate outside for the happy hour (no happy hour inside) that our food was seasoned with probably whatever was in hands reach and our calamari tasted as if it was fried hours earlier and left sitting out under a hot lamp. I've never had calamari with marinara sauce before (don't try it!). My husband had the wild salmon with veggies and was not impressed but disappointed, I had wings and fries with a side of what I think was mayo mixed with sour cream (gross)..the wings were no BWW and the fries tasted like they had been seasoned with celery and oregano. Extremely disappointed with the quality of food for the price thank goodness we ate during happy hour. I am however giving them two stars because the staff was very courteous but seemed to be either understaffed or have no organization because they were all over the place trying to help each other out but kept almost giving the wrong order to the wrong table multiple times while we we there (about an hour and a half).
author: Maylein M.

description: I've been coming here for years during my visits to SF. Unfortunately, it's gotten 'not so great' in the past 2 years. My most recent visit, January 2017, will be my last. I don't mind spending money on a great plate of food but this was far from great and it hurts to pay for food that just isn't worth it. I ordered the grilled seafood plate- 4 grilled shrimp, 4 grilled scallops, potatoes, and veggies. The shrimp were overcooked and rubbery, the scallops were tiny, and the potatoes were dry. The best thing on my plate were the fresh veggies. Nothing had flavor and lacked seasoning. I was with 3 other people and they all thought their food was just ok, nothing special. Time to move on. Next time I'm on the wharf in SF, I'll choose somewhere else to dine.
author: Coño G.

description: Amazing servers who made the experience a blast, and equally amazing food. So glad I picked the right place for lunch at the wharf!
author: Michael V.

description: Our server was pleasant but slow. The food was passable. The service overall was terrible and slower than  I could ever imagine. The olive oil and balsamic vinaigrette was blatantly watered down. And worst of all, everything was overpriced. There are better tastes of San Francisco.
author: Mark W.

description:
This is a pretty good place. The fish and chips were pretty good. Actually, the fries were exceptional. It's such a huge thing for the fish and chips, it typically comes down to the chips. But the flat pieces of fish were good. If you like your fish with tons of batter, you might want to check some place else. 

My wife had a nice pasta dish that again was good. The clam chowder wasn't too creamy, which is good for me. But can somebody find me some good Manhattan clam chowder? 

I was torn on what to give this joint. It was good. There is no doubt about it. If you stumble into this joint, you'll have a good meal. It's just that, I probably won't ever eat here again. Not because it was bad, but more for the fact that nothing stood out as exceptional. I don't mean that as a slight. I don't imagine this place is a local's haunt, so there's that. 

So, yeah. I'm not sure this is useful. You'll have a good meal and that's about it. But sometimes isn't that the point?
author: Adam R.

description: I love the atmosphere, the settings. Probably some the best crab cakes I've had in long while, and I'm rather picky about crab cakes! Kind of felt like the staff was giving me the "stink eye" because of my attire but that did not deter me from enjoying a good meal. I also indulged in the calamari and some mimosas' cheers.
author: Thurston T.

description: Love the Frutti Di Mare one of my favorites! Service could use a lot of improvement though.
author: Rocky M.

description: The lunch prices are what drew is in. I was cautious because it only got 3 stars. We got a cold $4 beer, $4 chicken wings (only 4 but delicious), clam chowder in Bread bowl and the Fish and Chips. The clam chowder was pretty good, lots of clams. The fish and chips was okay. It would have been REALLY good, but the oil that the fish was cooked in was old and tasted stale...which gave the fish a funky flavor. The fries were also kinda old tasting.  Again the prices were good. I'm not from this area but when I return to SF, I wouldn't return to this place...Especially if it was full price! I would go to Scoma's around the corner. My friend recommended it but I didn't listen. Oh well. Lesson learned.
author: Summer C.

description: Sea food was decent enough, service was really lacking. It's the service that killed it for me. Happy hour was lack luster.
author: Chelsea B.

description: Good happy hour. $5 beers 3-6pm on the patio and happy hour food specials. I'm allergic to shellfish so they grilled my fish tacos which I appreciate. Fish tacos were on point!
author: C M.

description:
Not bad for the heart of Fisherman's wharf. 

We had the lunch clam chowder and sandwich combo on a weekend just before their 3 PM happy hour.

Service was quick, if perfunctory. The sourdough bread for the table was excellent, served with those little gold wrapped Darigold butter squares. The sourdough slices for the sandwiches were also fresh. 

But the shrimp or crab sandwiches were just good and hardly fancy. They also weren't very generous ($18 for the crab sandwich and chowder and with crab season in high gear now, and crab prices low, it surprised me how little crab there was for the 1/2 sandwich). 

This is the tourist and location effect in action. Outdoor seating (rather cramped) in the near center of a major tourist draw, and the prices rise.

The bowls of clam chowder were large and very good however and overall this combo was more than enough. 

All told, this was decent food, just not very inspired. To throw a spoonful of crab salad or shrimp salad on fresh cold slices of sourdough (with no additional preparations like lettuce or toasting) and scoop some bowls of chowder, you think that they could do a bit more for the effort and the money, but you could do worse.
author: Glenn H.

description:
Overrated in my opinion...

Def, not even close to Best Chowder!

I'm not a fan of extremely chunky chowder with lots of fixings. To loaded for my taste.

Crab Salad was fantastic with the Louie Dressing. My favorite by far.

We also ordered crab jack sandwich...
It was good, they say a favorite.
3 of us tasted it and felt it was just ok.

Felt over priced in general for the quality of food, typical of tourist area.

Determined to find the best chowder in San Fran
author: Andrea C.

description:
The hostess was very accommodating and quickly prepped a table for large party of eight. After that was meh.

I'm a huge fan of oysters and unfortunately the raw dozen oysters were awful. They were not served on ice, not sure if that's a San Francisco thing, had one plump oyster and the remaining were shriveled up and warm. Even found a dead pea crab. Skip the crazy price tag and find another restaurant that serves $1 oysters. They would probably taste better.

The crab cioppino was ok, the sour dough bread was cold. Overall extremely overpriced for mediocre food.
author: Victoria G.

description: Overpriced. Spent $100 on a family of three. Honestly the meal was worth half that. I had the wild salmon and it was average at best. I honestly expected it to be very high end given the location and the appearance from the outside.  The service was lacking. Was never asked for a refill, so I had to flag down the waitress myself. If prices were in the normal range then I'd give this place a 3. But given that it cost more I expected more.
author: Todd C.

description: Love this place! Every time I come to San Francisco I come here. The staff is very friendly and the food is good. I love to sit outside on the patio and just relax and watch the crowds walk by. Decent menu prices for being in such a tourist area! Awesome little hole in the wall mom and pop restaurant.
author: Rob C.

description: Fantastic outdoor ambiance and customer service. The food is authentic and reasonably priced. Definitely recommended.
author: Sue C.

description: Stopped in while on vacation for happy hour for a drink, didn't realize happy hour ment they weren't coming back for an hour.....terrible service for such a small establishment! Every waiter and waitress was right there....a few changes like attitudes and maybe helping each other's stations and you could probably fix a few things
author: Melinda N.

description: This place only had three stars, but we loved it. The food was amazing, the server was comical and attentive!!  We all tried something different so we could taste several menu items and they were all good.  The drinks are good, too.
author: Tearani W.

description: Average at best. Caesar salad was all the yellow ends of the romaine lettuce. Clam chowder wasn't bad but had carrots and celery and other stuff (should be clams and potatoes for me).  Calamari was good. Bruschetta was very good. Steamed clams were very fishy tasting and not good at all. On the plus side they served Coke and not Pepsi.
author: Peder A.

description: The manager and the British hostess clearly don't know laws in California which allow assistance and non-assistance dogs to be with you at restaurant patio. Denied entrance. Food isn't good anyway, so they did me a favor. Boo.
author: Ess C.

description: Came in for their happy hour special while we waited for some friends. Ordered a beer and a mixed drink.  Took 20 minutes to bring it out and then they gave us our check without asking if we wanted anything else. Apparently drinks take low priority here... along with customer service.
author: Jessie A.

description: Decent food but very overpriced. I had a $20 order of fish and chips (however I was drawn in by their happy hour sign that was left out late advertising $8 fish and chips), and the plate came out with 3 small pieces of fish and a LOAD of fries to cover the rest of the plate. My girlfriend ordered a $10 Caesar salad, and the lettuce didn't look too great to her but oh well. Service was mediocre at best. I ordered a $3.25 Arnold Palmer and got it and was not even asked if I would like a refill, regardless if it was extra or not. We had to wait for our waitress to pass the table several times after we had finished eating before she decided to ask if we would like the check. Then as we were getting ready to leave a busboy comes out of nowhere and hits my back and the back of my chair since I was seated in an aisle, no apology or acknowledgement. Overall, I could've paid the same amount for a much better experience and meal, and wouldn't recommend you to eat here.
author: Dominic P.

description: Terribly overpriced glass of Mediocre Chardonnay and the Clam Chowder didn't contain any crab whatsover. I guess they made a mix of potatoes, vegetables and some boiled down version of the crab leftovers of the other menu items. Not recommended.
author: Dirk V.

description:
Pretty much a tourist trap, no?

Decided to park ourselves here after ending up at the wharf somehow. 

Happy hour? Sure! $1 off drinks and food specials. 

Unfortunately, I had the most unhappiest fish tacos ever in my life. 

Honestly, when I say Del Taco makes a better fish taco, I truly mean it. 

Dry tortilla, half a piece of fried cod, 5 pieces of shredded lettuce. And they only have Tabasco sauce? WTF!!!!!! 

Their fried zucchini is actually over-blanched veggies for entrees, dredged, then deep-fried to produce a mushy finger food. Next time, just blend it all together and make me a green smoothie. 

At least the beer was cold.
author: Aren A.

description: Great food.  Friendly staff. I had the chicken piccata. Was amazing !!  Great flavor good portion. I highly recommended it.
author: Bert P.

description:
Service is horrible here. We were greeted by the host which she seemed nice at first then while eating she starts hurrying a server. Who does that in front front of customers who are eating. She's right behind him giving him a lecture
The host also took our shade down since we were outside for other convenience instead of asking if we were okay with it
Our server which name was deidra seemed like she was new. Wasn't great with the menu. She seemed more attentive to others. Doesn't let us know what comes exactly I our plate asked for a bread bowl and got extremely rude. 
So much for a family owned restaurant. I would not ever think of coming here again. 
They should train there staff better
author: Maria H.

description:
EXCELLENT!!

Will meet and exceed your expectations - tourist TAKE NOTE - it is the best in the fisherman's wharf!

THANK YOU FLAVIA!

Went there Saturday June 20th, 2015 (busy, sunny and windy, nice day at prime time -3pm) loads of people walking around, mostly tourist.  

ARRIVAL:
When I arrived I was greeted by the lovely, FLAVIA. she was very sweet, sincere and immediately took care of me.  She knew exactly how to handle my needs, i was in no time for being a tourist but wanted a quick and excellent SF meal before my departure. 

I was in a hurry and don't know the restaurants there, haven eaten at Scoma's and others in the area in the past and none were great but fair. I liked the name of the place and love Pompei, plus with her Lovely accent, i decided to imagine being in Pompei where i have had excellent food.  She made sure that i would have a special, non-menu item.

ENTREES: BOTH EXCELLENT!!!

1. SAND-DABS
 a MUST when you're in SF - like a dover sole, it is EXCELLENT and the touch of lemon and light butter in a simple meunière style were superb! they were some of the best i had with the perfect seasoning and sauce - it was OUTSTANDING!!

2. FISHERMNA'S SOUP / Cioppino
i chose the fisherman's tomato based soup as opposed to the ciopinno b/c i don't care for crabs. IT WAS EXCELLENT - and MUCH BETTER than Scoma's b/c it was not a tomato paste broth but fresh tomatoes - if you know how overwhelming a thicker paste tomato is and is not good. the fish was full filet pieces and excellent fresh clams, shrimp.  i would guarantee the cioppino is some of the best around

3. Bread - famous Boudin SF sourdough - a perfect accompaniment to the soup and the sandabs. 

If you're looking for a god meal, in the area of the embarcadero / whaft area, YOU MUST GO HERE, get these items and explore some others. 

My whole bill was only $40 and that was one heck of a deal!  i didn't have cocktails but they do have a happy hour which seems to be quite good. 

When I am back in the area i will eat here all 2-3 meals and try all other SF items like the clam chowder, etc
author: Wayan T.

description: Definitely would not recommend this place. Came for dinner with two other people. First table we sat down at had a flickering light and that should have been a sign. The food wasn't memorable at all except for the sauce that drowned my meager cod portion. The half dungeness crab had a great sauce but the fish wasn't fresh and neither was the crab. We're in san Francisco and the waitress admitted that they don't get their fish caught fresh. Which is ridiculous. Kind of ticked we didn't go somewhere else with REAL fresh caught fish.
author: Gabi J.

description:
Pompei's grotto for me is one of those, guilty pleasure restaurants. I really didn't want to like it. Heck, after trying it and having a little love affair with the food, I still can't say I'm completely sold on it.

In a bout of hunger, the BF and I decided to stop here for lunch. Coming here wasn't a random occurrence; With a plethora of restaurants to choose from along the walk of the wharf, the number one reason we decided to make the pit stop here was based on the suggestion of several friends. "Francesco Misto" and "Crab Louis", their words echoed. To me, the establishment screams out touristy, but I can't exactly put my finger on why. Location? Ambiance? Though I normally do try to avoid tourist "traps", I made sure to keep an open mind before taking the plunge. 

The Crab Louis ($22) is one of the pricier salads I've had in my life. The sheer portion size though, makes it worth it! I didn't know that it was possible to actually overdose on crab, but I think if that's your goal, order this! Mountains of fresh crabmeat, already de-shelled for you, piled atop a mountain of fresh and tasty salad. I wish I knew prior that the Louis dressing closely resembles Thousand Island though... Not too huge of a fan.

The Francesco Misto (also $22) was freakin' life changing. Like the Crab Louis, the portion size of this is gigantor. Pasta, accompanied with bits of the ocean: mussels, clams, scallops, calamari, and shrimp. No skimping here either! There was so much seafood in the pasta, it almost felt like a bottomless bowl! I loved the sauce too. Perfect flavor, and thicker consistency... No soupy pasta for me!

I can't lie, the food here is pretty damn delicioso. Service on the other hand, is another story. Staff here isn't particularly friendly or pleasant. One of the hosts walked right past us as we walked in, and we waited awkwardly in the hallway for someone else to seat us. Our server was a little pretentious, for who knows what reason, in an empty restaurant. Service here is also s-l-o-w, even though at the time, there were only four or five other groups dining. Water refill? Keep dreaming. Plus, does anyone in this place know how to crack a smile? 

The food here is definitely worth a return visit... But next time I'll remember to do takeout!
author: Donna M.

description: Too much drama... cheap food and beer, but hostess was crying about something and another waitress complained about having to wait on customers.... eeird atmosphere.
author: Kelly F.

description:
Tourist trap restaurant (and I'm a local). In an area with tons of crab options I figured they would have to at least do the crab sandwich right. They did it terribly. Thin layer of crab with iceberg lettuce and dry bread, with a side of soggy fries -- for $23.

So disappointing that this is the quality of food our many visitors experience.

I left a message for the manager.
author: Julia B.

description: Service was adequate, servers are nice for the most part here! But the happy hour prices seem great but, definitely not worth it. I ordered the Fried shrimp and when it came out and there were literally 6 of them. Also the clan chowder bowls are bland. Okay food... Would I come back? Probably not
author: Jeff P.

description: This place had above average food, and amazing service.  Ask for Pedro because he has amazing service skills.
author: Jackson H.

description:
After day of walking around the Fisherman's Wharf area we decided to grab a quick bite to eat and chose Pompei Grotto.

The staff was very friendly.  We got there in time for happy hour which included $5 and $5 snacks... Just what we needed.

Pompei is right in the heart of things and offers outdoor dining as well as indoor and bar area.

While the full menu looks really great and had decent prices, we opted for the happy hour menu.... It hit the spot!

Definitely stop in for a bite and make a couple new friends!
author: Philip T.

description:
We found ourselves along the wharf area when hunger threatened to take us down, and despite being surrounded by dining options, we were paralyzed with indecision.  This is not a part of town where we had much experience eating so much as people watching.

We chose Pompei's because of their kitschy red and white checkered table cloths (made of actual cloth), dark wood paneling, and port-style round windows.  Something about the decor just said that the place has been there a good long while.

We chose well!  Our server was friendly, attentive, and paced the food very well.  She kept the wine flowing, and had good recommendations.

We split a series of appetizers, including: the New England clam chowder, the mussels in wine/garlic/butter, and both the prawn and the crab cocktails.  I would order any of those items again.  All were fresh and good.  We were joined by a small group of family as we were finishing up our appetizers, and we sat through their meal as well.  I was able to try their chocolate ice cream truffle dessert - get it.  Wow - just get it.
author: Danni D.

description: Good value for happy hour. Reasonable drink pricing and we enjoyed our appetizers. Bruscetta nice!
author: Mary J.

description:
Asked a local and they said come here. 
The staff here a really nice and help by making suggestions if you're unsure. 
Try the crab jacks, it's a crab meat and colby jack cheese grilled cheese sandwich.
author: Jason Y.

description: I ordered a medium rare New York Steak. It took them over an hour to bring it out and it was NOT medium rare. When I presented my concerned to the manager she argued. Not recommended, go somewhere else.
author: J C.

description: Service was definitely non existent, the hostess was great though! Everyone's food was cold. Bathrooms were NASTY!!!
author: Katy H.

description: Can I give 0 stars? This place is absolutely awful.  Seriously terrible.   I went there with my fiance over the weekend while we were in town and I have never felt more ripped off.  He ordered a bloody mary - which was disgusting.  It was a glass of V8 and I doubt there was any vodka in it.  He ordered the chicken club samdwich and sent it back it was so awful.  The chicken didn't even cover half the bread and the "bacon" was scraps and burnt to a crisp.  I had a cheese burger that was barely edible and the bread they put on the table wasn't fresh.  Do yourself a favor and stay away from this place.  Our waitress was nice enough - I felt bad that she has to serve this garbage to people and then bring them their ridiculously over priced check.
author: Chrystal C.

description:
There really is just nothing special about this place. 

Came here for supper with the bf because it looked like a decent place. The food was nowhere near decent, though (except for the clam chowder). 

We ordered the seafood sampler, 2 cups of clam chowder, and a Fettuccine Gamberetti.  

The seafood sampler had a combination of battered and fried calamari, popcorn shrimp, and white cod with tartar/cocktail sauce. All three of the fried items were bland, the cod was tough, and the tartar sauce was overly sweet (we asked them not to give us the cocktail sauce).  

The clam chowder tasted okay. It had a good amount of clam meat, but was not as hot as I would have liked. 

Ugh, the Fettuccine Gamberetti... Terrible. It was tossed with rock shrimp, tomatoes, garlic, and basil in a bland cream sauce. Well, the rock shrimp definitely earned its name; its outer texture was rough and the inside of it was dry and hard. You know how dead shrimp tastes and feels like? Yeah, sort of like that, but worse. Add on, the tomatoes, garlic, and basil were barely fragrant and noticeable. 

As our first official dining experience at Fisherman's Wharf, we're quite disappointed. We came here thinking we'd be served fresh, sweet, tasty seafood, and, instead, we were served what seemed to be seafood that's been dead for a while or perhaps just frozen seafood. And no, we will not be coming back.
author: Joyce G.

description: Was looking for a place to have lunch and I came across Pompei's Grotto. Glad I did. The waitress I had was very friendly and helpful with the menu.  I saw the mussels and was like got to have. It was amazing! a must have. The view was great.  Check them out you won't be disappointed.
author: Nicky C.

description:
Clam Chowder Bread Bowl Ingredients:
1 Tbs Clam Chowder
1 Roll (yesterdays dry bread)

Service Minimal

Though the bowl is only $6, the amount of soup in it is ridiculously small. They never refilled our water.
author: Janelle R.

description:
Stopped here during a walk around the neighborhood. Their menu was overpriced and the food was nothing to write home about - kind of greasy and sloppy. 

We had the crab bruschetta app which was messy, crab didn't read stand out and the tomatoes were soggy. I got the fish tacos for my dish, they were a little better but nothing special. 

And I could do without the aggressive woman out front trying to bring people in. This isn't Miami Beach.
author: Amanda A.

description: A great place to spend Happy Hour in Fishermans Wharf. Beer for $5 and tasty appetizers (calamari) for great prices $7.50. The crab cakes and Creme brûlée are also good (not happy hour). The 4 instead of 5 star rating is for service - it took a little over 10 minutes for someone to take our drink order. We'd visit again!
author: Jennifer K.

description: I do think their food is good. Loved my dish. The scallops were really good and buttery and the potatoes were my favorite. They were like MOJO style, crispy on the skin and soft in the inside. Love love love. Food was quick and customer service was friendly. My only issue was my drink and the portion size verses price. I love ordering cocktail drinks in all places but I really felt ripped off for mine. It was not worth the $9 for this tiny champagne size glass. I could have gotten a bigger glass elsewhere for sure for $9. And for $17+ for a scallops dish was ok at most places. But when my dish arrive, I felt my food lacked alot of space on my plate. So I guess it is pricier and not worth the price if that's all I am going to get.
author: Mai Y.

description: Not a bad happy hour place. Very good appetizers and reasonable pricing. Nice and friendly staff. I would definitely come back here for more
author: Jilma B.

description: Most unfriendly people and atmosphere. I hope the owner know show rude and ignorant his manager and hostess are. We came in to have a Bloody Mary, the restaurant was empty and they told us we couldn't sit for "just drinks" until 3pm.... Did I mention the restaurant was empty? I asked the hostess why they would turn away business and she said "whatever!" This was Sunday 8/24/16 at 2:50pm (so the owner can see who was working). What a joke. I will NEVER come back. Good Luck, I'm not sure you'll be in business much longer with that staff!!
author: Donna Z.

description:
We were walking around Fisherman's Wharf looking for a nice place to eat that was reasonably priced. After reading the positive reviews on Yelp we decided to eat here. 

We came during happy hour (3-6pm) so alcoholic beverages were $4 and appetizers were $3-$5. We ordered mussels, fish tacos, garlic parmesan fries and chicken parmigiana (part of regular menu). The food was pretty good, nothing to write home about. The garlic parmesan fries were good though and at only $3, you really can't go wrong ordering them. 

Overall, decent food at a decent price with pretty good service. Would return.
author: Kelsi-Ann M.

description: Came here at the weekend with some friends, the concierge at the hotel recommended it and WOW what  location, we sat on the patio and from the minute we sat down it was a great experience (probably the best we had in this city). Our sever Rebecca was a delight from start to finish and gave us some great recommendations! I had the Pacific Rock Cod and it was amazing! Definitely be my 1st stop on my return to the
author: Marie T.

description:
I got a groupon for two for this place since I'd be in town and I thought it'd be good since its located at the fishermans wharf..it came with two clam chowders, two entrees, two alcoholic drinks and a dessert. It wasn't busy since we got there for an early dinner at 5 on a weekday. The server said that we couldn't share our 2 person groupon with our party of 3..which was more then enough food but he said the third person couldn't eat or they needed to order something. The groupon doesn't state that you can't share so I was disappointed with their poor customer service.

Time to review food. The clam chowder was mediocre. You will be better off going to boudin down the street. It was watery with no potatoes and too much celery. A good amount of clams though if you're into that.

The baby crab cakes came with a pesto sauce, they came out lukewarm with our entrees and cost $15. They were probably one of the best things on the menu but I always love crab cakes.

The captains platter came with fried shrimp, fried scallop, fried fish and fried jumbo shrimp. It's a lot of food to not share. The scallop was very soft and the shrimp were good. It came with veggies and fries. They were regular fries but the menu said shoestring. They weren't stringy at all!

The sea bass was delicious. Pan seared with a hint of garlic. It came with two large square pieces. The fingerling potatoes were not crispy even though the server said they're oven roasted and crispy.

The tiramisu was very soft and wet. Not a good combo.

We won't be coming here again and thank goodness it was half priced minus the crab cakes!
author: Angelina L.

description:
Came here with a co-worker for happy hour and was not impressed. 

I ordered a rum & coke which was waaaay too strong. I sometimes appreciate a heavy handed bartender but not when I have to choke my drink down. She was also not very friendly and unattentive. 

We shared the calamari appetizer and it was blaahh. Not much flavor and extremely rubbery. The cocktail sauce it came with was really just a blended up tomato sauce.
author: Janee M.

description:
Very typical tourist trap restaurant on the wharf. Exorbitant prices for what they are offering, but they get away with it because of the location. I ordered the fisherman's stew(basically cioppino) and asked for no calamari and when it arrived you would of thought I asked for extra calamari. In their defense, the waitress noticed and brought me a desert to make up for the mistake. Overall it was very mediocre for a really high price.  It's also strange that the price of Dungeness crab doesn't change with the season. In-season.. $22 for HALF.

Please, if you are coming to San Francisco, go to a decent restaurant. Don't get sucked into the trap.
author: Logan T.

description:
Poppei's Grotto is a small restaraunt down the street from Fishermans Wharf. Has a decent atmosphere however there were flys flying around the restaraunt which was a little bit annoying to me.

The food was not bad. We ordered some crab cakes which came amount lukewarm at best served with some Arugula and Pesto sauce. I was visiting with my girlfriend and cousin.

Next we ordered a Captains Platter which had a mix of food items including fried cod, jumbo shrimp, scallops, baby shrimp and some veggies and fries. This dish wasn't bad at all and I have no complaints about it. A good first timer dish!

My cousin ordered the Sea Bass served with fingerling potatoes which were a bit soggy and veggies. The Sea Bass was cooked very well and didn't have a strong fish smell to it which is a plus for me. The potatoes were a little soggy but had decent flavor the only thing I have to say was that they said they would be over roasted and crunchy but were not.

We also got the clam chowder here but I have to say if you like clam chowder your best bet is to go to Boudins and get the clan chowder there. The clam chowder and Pompei's falls short several steps.

Overall not a bad restaraunt but not the best ether.
author: Robert H.

description: Came here last week and had high hopes. Had the shrimp and my boyfriend had the clam chowder as well as the crab. The food was good but not as great as we had hoped. Also, I understand we are in San Francisco but the drinks were higher price than other nearby areas.
author: Elizabeth A.

description: Excellent!!!!  Delicious & great afternoon prices!  Wish we would've gone back for dinner!
author: Juli I.

description: we came here first time ...visiting from Los Angeles. 3 family 11 people, we got really good service and food was really excellent...Francesco Misto, sea food plate was really good....Fettuccine Gamberetti was excellent. Recommended to try for sure.
author: Martin L.

description: Came here for the $6 bread bowl special . Service was very slow and food was alright, nothing spectacular.
author: Yishan L.

description: Don't  order the clam chowder as well as the bloody Mary's lol there salad is good though.
author: Christian W.

description: The food was amazing. I would highly recommend coming to this place. I love the clam chowder. The pasta was excellent. I got the Francisco mistro but changed it for the cream sauce from another dish which made it amazing. I enjoyed every bite of my food and would go back again if I were in SF.
author: Christian P.

description: Clam chowder is amazing great bacon flavor!! The bloody mary was so horrible I had to send it back. Fish and chips had a great breading, fries were great. Bread was standard really good SF bread. Only 3 stars because you will only see a waitress about once every 15 minutes.
author: Gabriel O.

description: Prices were pretty typical for the area. They serve Boudin's sourdough bread with butter while you wait for your food.  My Dungeness crab was very good, with a tasty sauce, but so messy to eat.  My son ordered the Franciscan Misto, lots of fresh seafood with a terrific sauce.  Seating was tight - not sure how we would have been seated if all five of us were dining.  Good service. I would eat there again.
author: Jennifer J.

description: Had the special - fish and chips for 1/2 price- way good price and the fish was fresh and even tasted like the tarter sauce was fresh made. Started with cup of clam chowder and YES again very good- however, waitress was new and tried to bring both the soup and entree at same time - bad and then tried to take our bread away - she is temporary- the food good and likely to stay that way.
author: Dawn P.

description: Ok food with the same old touristy vibe as all other restaurants at the pier. I didnt find their chowder to be all that great. It tasted bland almost like it was progresso canned soup. I actually think the clam chowder at Bubba Gump or Franciscan is better..but I guess to each their own. The food was ok and enough to fill us up. Their fish and chips was just alright and nothing special. The Sole sandwich was pretty good and served on Boudin Sourdough. The crab sandwich was ok also flavorless. The chicken alfredo was good but nothing to brag about. This is an Italian restaurant kind of, but the food doesnt really have that authentic Italian flavor. They have a good happy hour with great Garlic Parmesean Fries for only $3. Just like every other place here..you're paying for overhead and location. The food is alright. The staff and service is great. Would I go again? Yes but for happy hour and maybe not dinner.
author: Vince N.

description:
The boyfriend and I were on vacation in San Francisco. It was his first time there and my sixth. We were recommended this restaurant and decided to give it a chance, since we were looking for some authentic seafood restaurant on Fisherman's Wharf. 
The food was quite reasonable but the service was dreadful. While everybody seemed to be enjoying their time and being treated nicely by their waiters, we were utterly unlucky with our waitress. 
She was extremely rude from the time we sat down until a bit before she brought the check. That's when she slightly tried to make things better. It did not help. She didn't get any tip. For the first time, this extreme measure was not only required, but also deserved.
Only the fact that she poured water and ice all over our table more than once without apologizing or doing anything about the mess would have been enough to spoil the dinner.
author: Rennie M.

description:
In spite of the good food there was a lot to be desired when it came to quality of service, timeliness of service, attitude and even getting the order correct. Firstly we waited 30 minutes for a table though all the tables weren't full. Then we waited for another 30 minutes for someone to take our order and finally another 45 minutes before our good started to come out. 

Once the food showed up they got both orders wrong. That's when the excuses started to come out. We were told that the employee that took the order was new. Then we were told by another employee that the restaurant unexpectedly got a large group in. In any event at that point we weren't looking for excuses and clearly the restaurant was just trying to justify their culmination of errors. 

It almost seems like that just be chase this restaurant is in a high traffic tourist area that they don't need to worry about quality of service as the tourists will leave town and the next ones will show up. Yes location is important but so is quality of service together with the quality of food. It takes both for a restaurant to survive in the long term. 

One employee chose to sound off on me and say that he heard me once after voicing my displeasure... That was the icing on the cake. I really don't care if the food is good in the end if the experience is this poor. I would never eat hear again and I do not recommend.
author: Hameed J.

description: I went there with some friends once. None of us is really familiar with Italian food, so we ordered food based on random selection. It turned out that the choices was good, and we enjoyed the scene there.
author: Felicia F.

description: Salad was small for the price. Crab cakes and crab roll were ok but not great. Tables were really close together and our waitress didn't really seem to care about our table. The bus boys were very nice and attentive. Overall ok experience but there is definitely better places on the bay for seafood!!
author: Morgan W.

description: The absolute worst restaurant in San Fran! At the harbor, I expect fresh,  succulent seafood. We received over cooked and under par food. When we asked to speak to the manager, he was extremely rude and defensive. Save yourself a trip!
author: Felicia R.

description: Best chowder I've had. Great waitress too. My only complaint is that we were attracted to the restaurant because of the happy hour sign we saw. We were disappointed to find out, once we sat down to order our food, that the happy hour was for eating outdoors. Outdoors in 40F weather! We had a 5 month old with us and the happy hour sign didn't mention it was just for outdoor sitting. We had our waitress ask the manager if they could make an exception for us, and although more than half of the indoor tables weren't occupied, they didn't let us order from the happy hour menu.
author: Elsa S.

description: Calamari and clam chowder were amazing. Service was attentive and polite. Main dish Francesco's misto was to die for. We had an amazing experience.  We strongly recommend this restaurant.
author: Joseph U.

description:
Another great find and yes, it's at Fisherman's Wharf--who knew?

This is a warm and inviting, red and white checkered tablecloth kind of restaurant.  The tone is mellow and very comfortable.  The dishes are a mixture of Italian/American and seafood.  A full bar is offered too.

We shared the steamed clams and the crab sampler platter for our appetizers.  The sampler platter included crab bruschetta, crab cakes, and a few crab legs--it was very good,  The clams were a little on the small size but there were at least 18 of them in a nice, subtle broth.

Our main courses were :
1. the lasagna,
2. the linguine with olive oil, garlic and crab and 
3. the crab and scallops in a light cream sauce that were served with sliced fresh zucchini instead of the pasta that it usually comes with.  (We asked for a substitution.)

The linguine was the favorite at the table--the roasted garlic was actually sweet tasting and the red pepper flakes gave it just the right amount of kick.  

Service was very good from a cheerful and funny bunch of people.
I was actually surprised at how much I liked this restaurant.  It just goes to show that it does pay to experiment a bit with restaurants in different neighborhoods--even at Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Thomas D.

description:
Good food and service. Clam chowder is homemade and grad great flavor and it's not gritty like stone clam chowders can be. You are greeted the moment you walk in and are thanked for your business as you leave. Very few places really acknowledge that you are the bread and butter so it is nice that they do. 

Will definitely be back next time I am in town.
author: Georgina R.

description:
I've only lived in San Francisco since 1984 (broken record) so I am rather jaded about service not food and prefer to eat good fresh simple food dished by a friendly old-school vs. overpriced pretension served by over-educated dolts who loathe service ..I would take my Mother to PG's and she would have loved it.

 After watching Check Please on PBS I had my mouth set on their fresh fish finally the day arrived my husband loved the clam chowder and he doesn't like clams and a friend enjoyed everything and the leftovers were tasty.

Sue the waitress allowed me to be kinda goofy about the experience because I am a fresh fish fiend. The food is not snobby you won't get fancy sauces with silly names and the fish is fresh which bears repeating cause there is lots of old fish being sold for 2x the cost charged at Pompei's Grotto

Because its in walking distance I'll  be back during the day for the specials and will sit outside with the tourists and enjoy every minute.
author: SF T.

description: The crab cioppino was excellent, possibly the best I've ever had.  I went back the next day and had the shrimp and scallops sautéed with butter and scallions, also delicious.  The service was great and minimal waits when we were there.
author: Chad F.

description: There are many positives and negatives to this restaurant. The service is terrible. It is clear that they are short on staff. My group had to ask the bartender to serve us. It is not that clean either, my water had stuff in it and plate was very stained. But the food was very good. I recommend getting the half sandwich and chowder
author: Sammie B.

description:
*Note: this review is long overdue, but I stumbled across this restaurant page, so I thought I would post.

So I'm a local and I used to go to this restaurant all the time! It was reasonably priced, the food was pretty good, and the owners and servers were usually nice to us. Well, after the last experience I had, I will NEVER EVER EVER!!! be returning!

I first stumbled around this place back in 2012. It was Thanksgiving day, I was with two of my friends, and this restaurant was one of the few that were open and reasonably priced. We sit down and order the clam chowder, bruschetta, and pasta with salmon. Everything was delicious and we were probably one of two parties in the restaurant. The server (who was also the owner) was really nice. The only downside was that because they were open Thanksgiving, they automatically added 20% tip to our bill. Okay.. my friends and I decided that it was a good restaurant spot, but we wouldn't come back on holidays. 

Fast forward to about February 2014. At this point, I had been there a few times. Usually I sit on the left side of the restaurant, but because I had gone there for dinner, everything on that side was full. It was also about 6PM. When we arrived, the host said it would be about a 10 minute wait. Okay, no problem. We waited for about 7 minutes and they showed us to a table in the dining room area. We sat down and waited. I don't know if it's because we were younger or not tourists like the people that were sited around us, but we had been waiting for a good 10 - 15 minutes before we asked what we wanted to drink! I believe that she was purposely avoiding our table because she was serving the table to the left, to the right and behind us, both left and right sides and directly behind us. 

When she arrived at our table, she did not smile whatsoever, which was really strange because my friend and I had been WATCHING her for a good 10 minutes and she was laughing, cracking drinks, refilling drinks, etc. She bluntly asked what we wanted to drink and left. She returned a few minutes with a drink and left us to look at the menu. 

We had to wait another 20 minutes! EVENTUALLY, another waitress had came by and took our order. It was funny because she serving the tables in another part of the restaurant, but just came by for our table. This server was really nice and very prompt with our order. 

The food tasted delicious. The seafood tasted fresh and I was starving, so I was happy to finally eat. When it was time to pay, we had to wait another 10 minutes to ask for the check and when I put my card in it, my server was nowhere to be seen. I didn't want to spend another 10 minutes waiting, so I alerted the blonde server's attention. She looked at me very rudely and basically said, "Okay, I'll give this to your server." We paid for the food and left. Dinner usually only takes about an hour, this time it took 2.5 hours. 

Usually, not that many things will bother me, but my friend and I were so disturbed by that experience that we promised we would never come back. I didn't appreciate that server's attitude and why was she serving everyone but us? It looked like she specifically served everyone with smiles, except us. The food is delicious, BUT THEIR CUSTOMER SERVICE NEEDS TO BE FIXED AND that server needs to be fired! I WOULD GIVE ZERO STARS IF I COULD.
author: Yubing J.

description: Went to fishermans warf wanting fresh seafood. Didnt get that at all here. Crab was overcooked and didnt even offer a side with the meal. Overall was a huge negative to our trip. Had better seafood back home in utah which is really sad to even compare
author: Josh A.

description: This place was nice. Not the same feel as the rest of the area, because even though it says grotto, it looks like a typical Italian restaurant.  I got the fettuccine gamberetti which was good. There were a lot of tiny shrimp and the sauce was a light cream sauce, pretty tasty.
author: Yasy R.

description:
JUST DONT! 
Literally this place belongs on the show restaurant impossible. Worst worst worst food and service ever!!!! Outdated decor. 
Do yourself and your palate a favor and go anywhere else!
author: Stephanie I.

description:
Seafood and Pasta is always a delicious combo and Pompei Grotto does it right!

I came with four friends from another establishment with an hour wait! Pompei had no wait, score!

I really liked the cozy feel of the place. It reminded me of a spot I went to in New York, where they had a guy walking around singing, "When the moon hits your eye like a big pizza pie, thats amore!"

I'd say that guy singing with an accordion was all that was missing! Although, Frank Sinatra and other classic jazz is just as good :)

We enjoyed the food from beginning to end. The calamari was delicious and we all passed our dishes around of Crab Tortellini, Meat Lasagna, Sautéed Combination and Crab Manacotti. 

Delizioso!
author: Earlene C.

description: Went on a Saturday night in March. The wait was extremely long even after the main evening rush dissipated. The service was very inattentive. Usually I can handle these if the food is outstanding...unfortunately it was not. Bland and uninteresting. Would not go back.
author: Juan H.

description:
We couldn't decide where to eat our last dinner of our vacation in San Francisco... We looked at yelp and saw Pompei's Grotto, and gave it a shot. I am very glad we did. 
Good for families, but also has a dim light romantic feel so it's great for dates too... It's right on the water so there is lots of traffic so I recommend taking Uber or a taxi....
We had a really good waitress, she was helpful and sweet.... 
We have a family of four, we ordered salad one Cesar and one house salad, both were really good big enough to share. We also had the mussels as an appetizer, it was delicious!! Perfect amount of garlic and butter and lemon, yum...  The grilled shrimp and scallops were amazing and the fetticini Alfredo was remarkable, also very big portion... good for sharing.
All in all it was a wonderful dinner, I will definitely make my way back here next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Lisa T.

description: Absolutely worst service I've ever had. Pedro took our order and never came back to check on us or ask if we needed anything else. I finally had to ask another server for our check, and when I asked him to split the check for us, he had no clue what we even ordered. I hate that we were charged an auto grat on such lousy service. And this review and one star is only for Pedro and his lack of customer service because the food great! Amazing Cioppino and clam chowder. I'm sorry that I couldn't leave more than one star because the food was really good, but based on Pedro's crummy service I won't come back.
author: Jennifer V.

description: Oh my goodness!  We have had a very tasty meal with clam chowder, Caesar Salad, fish and chip!  The icing on the cake was our very attentive waitress (Aisling) straight from Ireland.
author: Debbie H.

description: One of the worst places I have been to. Service was quick. Food and wine were horrible. The pinot Grigio tasted and smelt like diluted rum. The waiter offered a glass of chardonnay which again was a watered down version of GOK what. Not a wine by any stretch of imagination. My order of crab cakes was not prepared well, and tasted raw. Ended up with food poisoning my first night in SF. I would never recommend it to any other human being.
author: Shaila M.

description: Having decided to use my iPhone's Google Maps application to explore San Francisco by foot, I set off from the hotel at Market Street for the famed Pier 36 before arriving at the Fisherman's Wharf. Thus, I was tired, famished, and in real need of a power plug to power up my phone. Upon hearing my plight, the hostess sat me at a table next to the bar where the wall plugs are. As it was the World Cup season, I managed to enjoy the match between Brazil and Uruguay live on their TV screen! The service was prompt and was served freshly made bread with butter before I was presented with the menu. I watched Brazil score before ordering my bowl of Fisherman's Stew which tasted awesome! Thanks for your great service. I am sure to come again the next time I am here at San Francisco! :)
author: Hin Q.

description: One of the best clam chowders I have ever had. Oysters were super fresh & cheap too. Other dishes in the party were calamari pasta, fried fish & Grilled fish. All were tasty & fresh. Prices are reasonable considering all the other competition in the same street & around. Service was decent as well.
author: Mary A.

description:
It's average.

Atmosphere: Way dated, tight inside.
Service: Ok, friendly.
Quality: On the better side. Sourdough bruschetta? That's just weird.
Location: Good, in the warfs main drag.
Cleanliness: Hard to tell, the place is so plastic and tacky.
Value: Fair

My visit: Short, had some cheap wine at happy hour. The fried shrimp were nothing special, not bad, not different. Bruschetta was loaded.
author: Steve L.

description: Sad to write this review. I have been going to this restaurant since 1968. It was always one of the best Italian seafood restaurants in San Francisco. When the old man died it changed. His daughter Nancy, took over. She spends more time in the bar than managing the place. Sadly we have watched service drop to the point where even returning customers are treated poorly. You can tell this is a tourist trap now. It's obvious they don't care about return business. It's their location on the wharf and all the tourists to keep them going. Again sad to write this.
author: Wj F.

description:
Pompeii's Grotto... More like Pompeii's Ghetto.
I normally don't take offense to restaurants as every cook can make a mistake from time to time, but it's hard not to overlook a group of 4, each getting something different, that each meal was made poorly. 

Let's start with the crab jacks. Clever name and idea, but poor execution. Shells found in the crab mixture and an overwhelming taste of mayonnaise to cover what tasted like old crab.
The same was for the avocado stuffed crab. At least the avocado was good.

Then there was balsamic vinegar soaked Cole slaw referred to as Italian Cole slaw... Not appetizing.

The chicken sandwich was decent, but not worth the price.

Then there was the sea bass. I love sea bass! I'll get it whenever I see it, but what I had did not justify why i get sea bass. when you hear of a lemon butter sauce, I don't think of fish soaked in disgusting, heavy butter with a lemon on the side. The potatoes were dry, the veggies were also butter soaked and the broccoli was tough and tasted like fish.

Bottom line: not worth the price and definitely not worth the stomach indigestion I and other members of my party had. 
I love supporting Family owned businesses, but this one needs help!
author: Chris H.

description: *Love this place! My fiancé and I were taking a stroll on the Fisherman's Wharf trying to decide where to grab a bite to eat. We saw the Happy Hour sign and walked in. We sat at the bar with Michael as our bartender. He was so friendly and made great conversation with us. We tried the steamed mussels and the brushetta, which were sooooooo yummy! The drinks were good too! We will definitely be back whenever we're in San Francisco :-)
author: Karina R.

description:
One of the places I love around the Pier! I'm a sucker for red/white checker table cloth. Great serene music, great ambiance, great people, great employees. 

I went here for NYE with a couple of my good gals. we drank Pinot Noir wines on the side starting with bruschette crab on top, bold Italian complimentary bread with cream butter was so delish! Devoured the combination sauteed with pleasure in every bite - yummy scallops, medium shrimp and pasta looping around. 

Staff, thumbs up for keeping us comfortable and your attentiveness was top-notch. Let's give it a round applause! 

Pompei's, I shall come back to devour some more carbs and sea creatures.
author: Jan P.

description: This place is amazing. I had the Francesco Misto. This was the best dish I have ever had in my life! And I'm not even the biggest seafood fan. Amazing service from Juan coupled with incredible food. My wife had the clam chowder and my mother in law had steamed clams. All of them were top notch. If you are in the area you have to come here.
author: Brandon D.

description: After driving for an entire day we stopped at the wharf, which is just a block from our hotel, looking for a place that was still open. We stepped into Pompeii's Grotto because it was the most inviting. The wharf has many Italian restaurants. Unless you know the area or want to do the research, it's not easy to pick one over the rest. If you're looking for the usual Italian favorites, this is a nice stop though there isn't anything that stood out from our experience. Good service. Attentive but not overbearing.
author: LeaDan Y.

description: Very disappointed in the salad... Mainly iceberg with a little romaine thrown in.  Fish tacos were mediocre at best.
author: R M.

description:
tasty rock cod. bread and oil is good. glad we came here instead of lous next door.
cocktail cheap.
author: Darren A.

description:
I can't even begin to express how awful this place was. We contemplated on leaving before ordering our food. We made the mistake of staying and giving it a chance. First off, the host was incredibly rude and as soon as we walked up (party of 4), she immediately told us "NO HAPPY HOUR HERE!" We said that was fine and still wanted to be seated. She led us to a table, where we waited for about 20 minutes for a server to finally take notice of us. As our server took our drink orders, one of our party asked if she didn't like a drink she was going to order, if she could change it to something different. The server rudely stated "No. It's not free." (Didn't assume it was) Her drink came along about 20 minutes later, and it was AWFUL. She ordered the "Pink Lemonade" which tasted like straight lemon juice. We had to order cranberry juice and took one of our pineapple juice drinks to mix into her drink just to make it drinkable. The food was okay, we ordered a platter for an appetizer, some bruschetta, and avocado stuffed with tuna. Server never came back to check for refills, despite us having pushed our glasses literally to the edge of the table. If anything, the bus boy deserved our tip we left, he gave us refills, and later on took our plates off the table when we finished. 
Overall, this place needs to be less than 3 stars.
author: Yurdi H.

description: Food was good. Service was fast. Waiter was very friendly, but did not seem knowledgable about the menu. Seemed to cater more to the tourists. I had the salmon filet with veggies, my mom had the large fried shrimp with fries and liked it, they made a grilled cheese especially for my daughter. Overall good lunch.
author: Kim B.

description: We love eating here and ordering their crab Louise!  Love their clam chowder! Their seafood are fresh and there isn't a fishy taste to it! It is a little pricey but it's all worth it! The ambience is romantic and the servers are nice!
author: Cece G.

description:
I went here for a dinner with out of town friends. The server pretended to be Italian (although it was fairly obvious he wasn't). He was friendly and attentive throughout our meal. The mussels I had came with a fantastic white wine sauce and their bread was delicious.

However, the silverware was not clean and I had to ask for another set. I would give this place 3.5 stars if the option existed.
author: Christoph F.

description: Don't try to eat here if you have your  kids with you, the host won't even sit you! His first comment when we walked in: That's too many kids, sorry we don't have tables" !?! Really? In San Francisco? So disappointed, the ambience wasn't that great anyway!
author: Karla N.

description:
Bad First Impression - 

 My fiancee and I decided to take a day trip into the city for a nice, casual afternoon around the pier. We had our eye on this place for a while so we decided to stop by Pompei's Grotto after checking out their curbside menu and happy hour deals. 

  It seemed like they were short staffed for a Friday afternoon so I had no problem waiting to be seated for a minutes while the fiancee powdered her nose. I was standing nearing a table inside but directly in the hot, glaring sun. The female server handed me 2 menus and said she'd be back.

  When the fiancee came back, we noticed there were maybe 3-4 people inside the place so we decided to move to a cooler, better ventilated area of the restaurant since it was warm outside and wanted a break from the sun. I waited a few minutes until I saw the female server again and politely informed her that we moved due to the sun and pointed to where we relocated (which was closer to the bar and on the side of the restaurant where all the inside patrons were).

   As I was turning around she said "Oh we're not seating anyone right there now"  which I was OK with UNTIL she muttered something very pessimistic and negative under her breath. As I turned around the male bartender said "It's OK, you can sit there" which then she repeated aloud. I appreciated the gesture from him considering there were 3 or 4 people at the bar, but the negative attitude by the female server made a bad first impression and made it seem like our business was not welcome. 

 After consulting with my fiancee we got up and left. 

 We could've done without the attitude and a bit of professionalism could've gone a long way since I was already understanding of her request. We were looking forward to trying out a new spot but there's plenty of other joints along the way we can try out. Thanks for helping us cross one off our checklist Pompei's.
author: Josue L.

description: This is a great, simple long-time Fisherman's Wharf eatery that is not that touristy and has maintained basically the same character and food for decades.  It has been a family favourite since my parents loved the place and we can always get good, simple reliable seafood, Shrimp or Crab Louie, pasta, etc., with warm crusty sourdough, a real San Francisco place. We are never disappointed, although it is arguably lacking subtlety.
author: Wulfstan C.

description: Their Mussels are excellent! Although the portion is small, They are in the best I've had category.  Their bruschetta is also good, but small portions for the happy hour menu.  Seems to be a theme in the HH food menu.  All in all, not a bad place to grab a beer and a bite in the tourist trap of the wharf.
author: T M.

description:
The food here was really good, but the service is really really slow. 
The patio looks onto the "main drag" and you can see some interesting characters and cars on a Saturday night.
author: Jill O.

description:
The only reason I ended up here was because my phone died and I couldn't Yelp to determine which of the dozen seafood places on Fisherman's Wharf was the best. Overall, I was moderately satisfied, but I am confident that one of the other places in this neighborhood has to have better food. 

I ordered the Shrimp and Scallops (cooked in wine sauce with mushrooms & scallions). The shrimp tasted fresh. The scallops were not bad, but not the best I've ever had either. The pasta was cooked well, but the sauce left a little something to be desired. It was served with some zucchini that had bits of marinara on it. It almost seemed as though they picked this off another dish and threw it on mine. The tomato flavors just did not belong.
author: Stephanie J.

description:
The best of the meal was their bread and butter. I'm going to take a guess and say that their sourdough bread is from Boudin's. Yum! 

Linguine with clams was disappointing. Pasta was bland and clams overcooked.

Mushroom risotto was pretty good. However, this was my first time having risotto so I don't have anything to compare.
author: Linda L.

description:
pompeii's grotto is a casual, relatively inexpensive place to have a sit-down dinner. the atmosphere is slightly run down with red-checkered table linens, but the service staff was very friendly and the food was fresh.

i started with the steamed clams, which was a very large portion. the broth was buttery, garlicky, and relatively thick. the complimentary sourdough bread was slightly dry, but that did not stop me frmo dipping it into the clam broth.

i ordered the small salad which came with lettuce, tomato, avocado, shrimp. the dressing was extremely thick, so i was very happy that i had ordered it on the side. i was not expecting baby shrimp, but it ended up being nice to be able to have a shrimp with almost every bite, and there ended up being too much in the end as i was not able to finish it entirely.
author: Jamie H.

description:
Horrible, horrible, HORRIBLE service. We sat on the patio for happy hour and an appetizer. The server was atrocious. Took forever to get anything. They weren't that busy. Maybe that should've been the first clue.

Stay away. There are plenty of other places to grab a cocktail on the wharf.
author: Elite B.

description:
For an early Mother's Day dinner with our adult son we decided to go to Pompei's Grotto restaurant. We are locals and have gone there many times over the last 18 -20 years. When we arrived it was still Happy Hour so we asked about the Happy Hour menu. We were told Happy Hour was either at the bar or outside. That surprised us but we said ok, we'll sit outside. We did. The waiter brought the Happy Hour menu. My husband ordered the Chianti. The waiter said it is not on Happy Hour. My husband showed him the menu that he had just handed to us that clearly showed Chianti on your Happy Hour menu. The waiter said he would be right back. He walked inside, came back out and told us that he "ripped up our order ticket". We asked what that meant. He said we should leave! We looked at him and basically said "you are telling us to go?" He said "yes". We were appalled and embarrassed. We did nothing wrong, other than listen to what the inside staff told us and then try to order a happy hour drink from the happy hour menu.
 
We walked up the street and had a great dinner at #9 Fisherman's Grotto. Our waiter was appalled when we relayed our experience. He said this is a "make people happy industry" and could not understand the waiter's actions. We have referred people to Pompei's Grotto in the past. We will do the opposite now and never set foot in the establishment again.
 
Shame on the staff. What a horrible thing to do to a polite family trying to celebrate Mother's Day.
author: Alice J.

description:
I came here with my cousin and my uncle visiting from another country. The outside looked appealing, the menu offerings looked good so we decided to go in and try it. Mind you, we already had horrible restaurant experiences around the Wharf. 

When we got in, we got seated immediately. I thought that everything would be good from there. Unfortunately, our server took about 20-30 minutes to go to our table to take our order. When we got the bread appetizer, it was as cold as the butter that came with it. It took me forever to get the attention of our server, and when I finally did and asked him if we could get the bread heated up, he said that wasn't possible. HOW IS THAT NOT POSSIBLE???

Anyway, that wasn't the end of it. It took almost 40 minutes for our orders to get on our table. My uncle ordered the dungeness crab, and it was HALF a crab on some tomato sauce for $22. It really wasn't worth it.

i had ordered the small Bay Shrimp Salad and I have to say that was one of the most terrible salads I had ever had in my life. I could barely eat it. First of all, for $15, the salad wasn't even tossed. The weird thousand island dressing was served on the side and the plate gives NO room to mix the salad at all. It was basically a bed of lettuce with some largely cut avocados, egg, and bay shrimp. I don't understand how that took 40 minutes to deliver. No taste, no presentation, no bueno!

I should have known not to expect service or quality from most of the restaurants located around this area since it is a tourist spot. But more people should be aware of this so they don't waste their money.
author: Lia C.

description:
Had reservations at Scoma but cancelled d/t long wait and stuffiness..and i don't mean food either.  There were two Maybach's (two?!!) sitting outside and we came in shorts..Um..i think we better change our venue. 

So here we go Pompei.  Started of by calling and they were so UBER friendly! Were willing to take us last minute with two little ones by our heels.  When we got in they took care of our strollers, and sat us down with crayons and all. So very impressed it felt like a family style place.  Service was as relaxed as their vibe.  Definitely my kind of place.  

Ordered a bottle of chardonnay (33), Sea bass (19.95), captains platter (21.95), and grilled combo (21.95).  Kids at whatever we ate, no kids meal with all the above! They were perfectly fine with sides and their crayons.  Total about $106 for two.  Average price for SF Wharf type food I think.  

I thought food was better than Fog Harbor, the seafood was tastier and meatier, but it tasted saltier overall.  Not sure what it is about the vibe...but there is a difference just like there is a difference between Bucca Di Peppo and Johnny Carino's. You can't say either is bad...but there is something about one that trumps the other. 

I think if you want something more casual and less stuffy and more family oriented, this will be your go to place.
author: Lauren X.

description:
This place was absolutely disgusting!  The whole experience was a huge disappointment.

We went in and the host and all staff were in the bar area watching a basketball game and shouting at the TV.  We didn't know what to do so just waited until a random person just seated us.  Our waiter was terrible.  He kept forgetting our drinks so when we asked he said he'd bring it after he took our order.  We finally ordered and got our drinks but they were never refilled.  I had the Sea Bass and my other party had a caesar salad because the menu was not appealing.  The Sea Bass had to be cut with a knife...seriously...like WTF!?  Never have I ever needed a knife to cut fish.  The potatoes were so hard and seemed several days old and microwaved.  The carrots were not done and seemed microwaved as well.  Finally we tried to get our check.  It took so long, we finally got up and were going to walk out the door.  Then the waiter finally runs up and tells me he'll bring it to me.  I said no and followed him to the card machine.  I'm not sure what the staff was doing in the kitchen but I did not trust them alone with my credit card or anything else.
