Horrible experience and a tourist trap.  Take the extra time and spend the extra money at another quality restaurant.  

There were some people across the restaurant I overheard complaining about the place too.  They said they had been going there for 15 years but something did not feel right with the place.  Their waitress mentioned that there was new ownership or something.  One of the draws was that this restaurant states it has been family owned since 1940 something.  This place is an absolute fraud, spend your money elsewhere.
author: Trey H.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here because when we walked by the door it smelt amazing... and we weren't let down!!  We shared the crab melt and it was delicious.  It is a little pricey, but the portions are big and the taste is great.  The service was INCREDIBLE.  My water glass was never empty, yet they weren't in your face all the time either.

We lucked out and came on a day they had live music, which was the cherry on top!

It was an overall great experience.
author: Kristin D.

description:
Went here in July 2013 with my husband, my 10 year old son, my niece and her 7 year old daughter.  I ordered linguine pasta with chicken it was very greasy and I wasn't happy with the bland flavor.  My husband ordered the breaded Chicken Picata it was flavorless the chicken was juicy but the breading was very bland.  My niece ordered Crab Cakes but the older female waitress messed up and She was also preoccupied with two other tables I felt the service could have been better.  I advised her to give it back for correction but she just ate it.  We met a man on the F-Line his name was John he swore this was the place to go to.  

**Today Sept 30th we were at home watching Check Please and seen this restaurant on TV (Brian Boitano) talked about how tasty, warm and gooey the bread was.  It came out COLD we have had Yummy Hot Bread from The Cheese Cake Factory & Black Angus that tasted much better.  

My husband believes since Brian grew up in SF and has been going there his whole life his taste buds are off and I Agree.

The Atmosphere was older not modern it looked like it was family owned.  But we felt comfortable.  Our children ate at In & Out Burger but they had the Ice Cream for their dessert which was so good the Ice Cream tasted Home Made.  Not going back
author: Jay S.

description:
Food : Ordered crab salad & cheese sandwich w/Italian coleslaw. Tasted of only mayo for most of the sandwich- waste of crab, and that the part of the crab I did taste was not sweet, not fresh. I had shell in my crab as well.

 Half of my sandwich was sitting in the balsamic from the slaw and was too soggy to pick up and eat. -Dense and tasteless-

The slaw was not good at all- very odd flavor.  Balsamic was not appetizing. 

Restaurant: dirty, unkept. I felt uncomfortable.

I understand that this is a tourist place but plenty of other tourist joints nearby were sunny, clean, and had tasty food.  Pompeii's is relying solely on location for business and does not seem to care about food or customers.
author: H C.

description: Spent a wondeful luncheon in this outdoor bistro.Great job on the crab cakes. My husband loved his clam chowder. Most importantly, the service was otstanding. Stephanie  was very attentive as we're the other employees.
author: Mary Lou M.

description: Fresh seafood, excellent soup/salad and great wine!  It's a lovely, intimate restaurant that's fabulous on a warm evening or an evening that's cold outside!
author: Cynthia A.

description: My wife and I walked all around the ocean front looking for a quieter place to sit and eat outside.  This place looked good and inviting from the outside.  Had a nice meal on the front deck.  We split the fishermans platter appetizer which consisted of really good fried fish (the best thing of our whole meal, next time I would just get the fish and chips), descent calamari, OK fried shrimp.   Next up was the chowder.  Coming from New England, it wasn't the same but overall good.  Service was a bit slow but we didn't mind one bit enjoying the sun.
author: Derick W.

description:
Now that I no longer work in the Marina district I have actually starting dropping by the pier.

We wandered into Pompei because it was the least expensive and  the original restaurant we'd chosen, the Jazz bar next door, had the best acoustics I've ever heard... which meant you could hardly hear yourself think with all the nose.

The thing about restaurants near the pier is that they're tourist focused. So the horrible decor, ie fake flowers, checkered tablecloths and generally phony look about the place is to be expected.

I was actually surprised by the decency of the food. It's overpriced yes, mostly because as stated, it's touristy but take away the 3 dollar price bump and you have a delicious bread appetizer and wonderful clams.

Our service wasn't great, the waiter seemed to be overcompensating for either a bad day or bad wait skills, however all in all if you look past the fact it's overpriced, it's not a bad place to drop by.
author: Meg T.

description:
Highpoints: Clam chowder is tasty and some of the best on the wharf. Sourdough is awesome. Kids menus are well priced and the portions are enough to feed an average 10 year old. Small crab salad was anything but that with a nice heap of dungeness crab.

Low points: Seafood combo was not good. The scallops and shrimp tasted like they were cooked in the bottom of a pan that had been used about 10 times without being cleaned. The green beans in the combo were previously frozen. 

The net rating this one is tough. The combo gets one. The rest is probably worth a three or four. Unfortunately the negative weighs a little heavier.
author: Mark S.

description: We came to the restaurant for vacation and the service was excellent! Our server was a middle aged Filipino man and he was amazing, very personable and made us feel comfortable. It was my first time trying clam chowder and made sure I knew what it was all about. At the end he recommended some hot cider and that was delicious, made us feel very welcome, the clam chowder was delicious, glad we found this place :)
author: Juan D.

description: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY OR TIME HERE!!! Ordered calamari and it was the worst EVER ..dungenous crab sandwich nasty,shrimp sandwich was awful ..very disappointed ..the only thing that was good was the water..very very disappointed and wasn't worth the 105.00 for a family of four ..nasty nasty food
author: Amy G.

description:
Service was very good here. The waiter was very polite and attentive to everyone at our table, even when the restaurant was packed full. No matter what your preference in seafood is, you are sure to find something on their menu that you will like. They have a good variety from salads, sandwiches, pastas etc. I tried a cup of their clam chowder that was very good. i also had the fish and chips. the fish was great, I didn't really eat the fries but you really don't go to places like this for French fries no do you?!

Wonderful little restaurant on the wharf!
author: Jessica L.

description: My husband and I were in the mood for Italian food and decided to give Pompei's Grotto a try. We were not disappointed. A nice atmosphere and cutely decorated, we immediately felt at home. Our waitress, Susan, had a great attitude and was a lot of fun. We ordered the spaghetti with salmon and the gamberetti (fettuccine with shrimp and cream sauce). Both dishes were amazing. I know spaghetti with salmon sounds weird, but the salmon complimented the marinara sauce very well. For dessert we had the apple crisp and the cheesecake, both of which were delicious. We would definitely come back to try some of the other dishes. Highly recommend.
author: Charles R.

description:
Waitress seemed to be in a bad rush even though there wasn't too many guests. Ran back and forth and appeared rather impatient. Drinks came fast. They have a nice IPA, their cocktails are a joke. They come in a small soda glass (8oz?) and they weren't quite tasty either. Bruschetta was good, but the rest of our order was a disaster. My parmesan chicken probably didn't even see parmesan in its entire life. It was baked with Swiss cheese and drenched in tomato sauce. They claim this tomato sauce to be homemade, but I hope that this claim is not true, as there's better, less acidic tomato sauce in cans at any grocery store.

Stay away!
author: T F.

description:
Came here after touring Alcatraz as we were craving seafood.  We sat outside on the cute patio tables and started off dinner with bruschetta with dungeness crab.  The tomatoes were so fresh, and the pairing with the crab is inspired. Our only gripe was that they used a little too much olive oil in the bruschetta so when I took a bite an oily bit ran own my chin.  I also tried one of the drink specials (champagne and fruit juices ) and for $6.50 it wasn't worth it.  My husband got a local beer Anchor Steam Beer) and enjoyed it though.

For our entrees my husband chose the Alfredo pasta with bay shrimp.  I got Francesco's Misto and subbed the tomato basil sauce for a cream sauce because I was craving white sauce.   The  misto was worth the $20 from the amount of seafood in the dish alone.  In every bite I had a clam, mussel, scallop, shrimp, calamari or squid piece.  The cream sauce was light but rich at the same time.  I was full halfway through but finished every bit because it was THAT good.   The alfredo dish was rich, creamy and buttery and the shrimp were delicate and sweet.  The sauce might have been a tad too buttery, but after walking San Fran all day my husband didn't mind the extra calories.  

Service was great, we got our food quickly and with a friendly smile.  Towards the end of our meal a rowdy crowd with fancy old vehicles parked in the loading zone right next to our tables.  Apparently they had come from a car show and were friends with the owners. They were a little loud and quickly drew a crowd so we had people on our right craning to take pictures and a stereo bass bumping to the left.  I would have chosen to sit inside had I known that was coming later in the meal.  

We would definitely return here for a nicer dinner, although they have some very reasonably priced dishes (like a seafood risotto for only 13 dollars!) The inside of the restaurant could use a little updating, but has a cozy family owned feel.   Do  yourself a favor and sit inside unless you are okay with lots of tourists passing by!
author: Ashley S.

description:
On a short trip to San Fran for work, we decided to explore Fisherman's Wharf.  No surprise that the seafood was fresh and well prepared.  What was a pleasant note was how nicely cooked the steak came out.

Prices were reasonable and while our waitress appeared a bit out of it, service was still strong.  Even with a good crowd, food and drinks arrived promptly.
author: Michael F.

description: We visit San Francisco every few years and we always try to go to Pompeii's Grotto. On this trip we had the Bruschetta with crab meat to start.  It was excellent! I also had a cup of clam chowder...some of the best in San Francisco. For my entree I ordered the sea bass. It came with fingerling potatoes and vegetable. It was incredibly good!!!   Clam chowder. My wife had chicken piccata with linguini.  She said it was wonderful (and I couldn't resist a taste and it was indeed fantastic). The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because the service could have been better. The waitress never came back to check on us and never refilled water.  Definitely 5 star food, though.
author: Bill W.

description: Eh! We wanted to go to Codmother's, but they were closed on Tuesday so we ended up here. All I have to say is: they lost me when they served their fish tacos with iceberg lettuce instead of cabbage -_-
author: Amanda P.

description:
One of the smaller restaurants on the warf.  Its been family operated since 1946.  Old school inside with checkered table cloths.  Clean.

Overall dining experience was good.  

My wife got the Sea Bass and it was excellent.  I got the grilled prawns and shrimp based on some yelp reviews and its was ok.  I liked her sea bass better.

I saw a NY come out and it looked great.
author: Stewart B.

description:
Was hoping for some fresh seafood from the bay, but I ended up with something that could've been picked up in the frozen food aisle. I had the fish 'n chips and my girlfriend had the linguini with crab. Tasteless and drab would be the best way to describe both. Food was far too expensive for the poor quality.

Pompei's Grotto is relying on its prime location to attract customers, not the  quality of its food.
author: Jesse H.

description: Great place to eat while walking along the Fisherman Wharf.  Food sizes were plentiful.  The crew (Hostess, Waiter, Bus Boys, etch) were all great.  Prices are reasonable.  Only reason I didn't give a 5 is they forgot to bring out my soup prior to the main meal being delivered. Otherwise great place to eat with family.
author: J S.

description:
One of many selections on Jefferson.  I sat in bar, with full menu.  I got grilled shrimp and scallops, a recommendation.  It was very good, but I would try something else next time.  Not a "to die for" meal...
Service was excellent in bar.
author: Carla M.

description: Located in the thick of things Grotto is an easy stop. Especially if you're heading the the quintessential San Francisco experience of Ghiradelli and the cable cars. Though not on the water, it still offers greats of the sea. I had the sautéed shrimp and scallops and it did not disappoint. The service is timely and the manager (?) at the door was laid back and inviting.
author: Krisa H.

description: Typical tourist trap. Nice server but very average food for the price you pay. I wouldn't recommend their tuna sandwich.
author: Anna E.

description: Pretty location. Service was ok and the food was ok. Nothing memorable. We won't make an effort to go back. Too many other places to try. And we we stuffed I mean seated between two large groups when there were other tables available  not a welcoming move.
author: D W.

description: they put a sign on their side walk that advertised $6 special for a breadbowl. So I ordered that and when they brought the bill they charged me $12. I asked them about this and they said they charged me the higher amount because "I pointed to the clam chowder on the menu which was $12" (even though their sign didn't specify which size the special applied to). Rude waiter and bogus advertising. Won't go back there especially when there are so many other places to get chowder and breadbowls.
author: Ni P.

description:
The hostess should have greeted us with a smile but, she did the exact opposite. She was cold and didn't make much eye contact. She put our menu's on the table and I said thank you and she just walked off. RUDE! 

Our waitress wasn't any better. She wasn't friendly. She brought us a basket of bread and there was an open package of butter sticking to the bottom of our bread basket. Gross!! (see the picture). Our waitress didn't come to our table to check on us and make sure we were enjoying the food, once while we were eating. 

The food was just OK. We had bruschetta with crab as an appetizer. I had just a plain green salad. My hubby had risotto with shrimp and mushrooms. 

So, the food didn't "wow" us and the service wasn't great. We won't be back.
author: Natasha M.

description: Came during happy hour and was seated promptly, it wasn't busy. Unbeknownst to us, we had to say we were coming for happy hour so that we would be placed in a particular section of the restaurant. Instead we were charged for regular prices, including $15 for below average calamari. Cocktail sauce tasted like a tomato sauce blend. They wouldn't change anything about our bill either after explaining that we didn't know. I am not going back.
author: Tyler E.

description:
I think Pompei's Grotto has the classiest atmosphere of any restaurant on the Wharf. I know that's not exactly saying much, but still - classy on all counts.

The prices are reasonable, the portions are generous, and their array of sauces really do have distinct flavors (you're not getting the same bland tomato sauce with every pasta dish).

I was particularly impressed with the fettucini with snapper and sea bass. It was really flavorful without being overpowered by garlic. It felt light, tasty... I even ate the leftovers for breakfast.
author: Jiordan C.

description:
At 8:45pm on a Wednesday night, this place was pretty busy! Maybe it was filled with tourists, maybe some were locals on a date, but I was surprised by the number of people at the restaurant so late on a weekday!

I picked the place (based on location and Yelp reviews) and so when I met my date there, he mentioned clam chowder and the crab or shrimp sandwich as *the* things to get here. We opted to get a glass of wine each, so we asked the waitress for suggestions for a red wine. She pointed out a pinot noir that turned out to be quite nice. Then we ordered one shrimp sandwich and one crab sandwich, as well as two cups of clam chowder.

I'm really bad a gauging time when I'm involved in a conversation, but it didn't seem too long before our soups were in front of us! They were the perfect temperature to dig in (not too hot, but not luke warm, either). A cup was the perfect serving size for me. I'm not usually a huge clam chowder fan, but this was really good. It wasn't bulked up with excessive chunks of potatoes. There was a good amount of clams and pieces of diced celery, along with thin slices of potatoes. The broth also wasn't too creamy. They didn't give us any oyster crackers, but there was sourdough bread for the table.

When they cleared our cups, our sandwiches came out shortly afterwards. My date and I traded halves so we could try the crab and the shrimp sandwiches. The shrimp one came with bay shrimp coated in mayo with some added spices and a thick layer of iceberg lettuce on thinly sliced sourdough bread. It was pretty good, but not super amazing. The crab one, however, was really good. One bite into it and I could taste how fresh it was! The crab was also coated in mayo, but it didn't take away from the crab. Our sandwiches were accompanied by shoestring fries and a small container of dipping sauce (my guess is thousand island dressing). Our waitress also brought out a bottle of ketchup, just in case.

Service-wise, our waitress was very attentive, making sure our food was good and checking up to see if my date wanted another glass of wine when his was empty. We pretty much closed the place down since we got there so late and were involved in conversation, but our waitress didn't hurry us out or anything.

It was a seafood restaurant with good food in a touristy location, so it was fairly pricey, as can be expected. However, I feel like the ambiance of everything makes it worth it. Definitely not somewhere I would go on a regular basis, but for special occasions, it's nice. I would come back here if I were in the area.
author: Leana L.

description: Just stay away. Typical tourist food. Too any good places to chose this over priced, bad food restaurant.
author: Katie P.

description:
Only the chowder in a bread bowl was passable. Everyone else in our party received food that was simply awful. Fish and chips, kid's shrimp plate, chicken parmesan and crab sandwich were all poorly prepared and flavorless except for the salt.

We really wanted a special meal for out of town family - this place left us shop disappointed. It's as if the really don't even try.

Stay away.
author: Jeff J.

description:
So one of my BFF's and I are all about supporting small biz. After a long walk from the Embarcadero BART station, our appetites were on fire. FIAH. 

We split a sand dabs filet and I had a bowl of clam chowder. The sand dabs was described as a local favorite, which is why we chose it. It was good, but the pieces were pretty itsy bitsy. The side pasta it came with was nothing special. Veggies were just meh. The clam chowder wasn't core shattering either. I guess we should have ate at the marketplace for better food, but we wanted a place to sit and relax while we dined. The food here isn't anything special, even though I had hoped it would be. It's not bad, but don't expect to be wow-ed is all I'm sayin'. Our waiter was a sweetie pie though.
author: Joy B.

description: This was our "go to" place when we ventured down to the wharf.  I ordered the same thing I've ordered there for years, spaghetti with crab.  It had no taste what so ever.  I dumped practically the whole jar of parmesean on it and still nothing.  I was so disappointed and embarrassed since I brought along my out of town guests.  Now looking for another local Italian restaurant when we want to enjoy the hustle and bustle of Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Lori C.

description: Tourist trap. $22 and 40 mins for a poorly presented lackluster plate of grilled shrimp and scallops.
author: Brian J.

description:
Out of many restaurants we ate during our weekend in SF, Pompei's Grotto is the best.  The service was excellent and the food was very good.  I am very particular with my food and this is one of the best in the Wharf area.

Will definitely go back
author: Max T.

description:
In a word, this restaurant was okay.  Like most restaurants at the wharf, the prices are a bit higher than they should be, but since just about every touristy place, that's to be expected.  I had the salmon spaghetti.  It wasn't bad, but the supposed "fresh" salmon didn't taste quite so... fresh.  The flavor actually reminded me of the vacuum sealed salmon that I buy at Costco.  I'm actually not too sure if this speaks well about the salmon from Costco, or if it speaks badly about the fish in Pompei's Grotto.

The only real downside to this restaurant was that the wi-fi did not work properly.

If you had to eat at the Fisherman's Wharf in a sit down restaurant, you could do worse than this place.
author: Abraham P.

description:
Talk about right place...right time.  We wandered around SF for 2 hours trying to decide what to eat.  We were absolutely famished and getting cranky, but this joint looked good.  We walked in, grabbed a seat in the bar, told the waitress we were starving, and within 5 minutes, we had a bottle of wine, fresh sourdough, and calamari on the table.  Bingo.

My friends both got the surf and turf with scallops and totally cleaned their plate.  I had the fish and chips, which were fantastic.  The cod was flaky, flavorful, and not overly battered and fried.  Prices aren't too bad considering your basically next to the Wharf.  Service was great and surprisingly quick considering it was pretty late at night.  Not touristy or kitschy, definitely better than many places nearby.
author: William L.

description:
I hate reviews that start out "this is really a 2.5". 

This is really a 2.5. On the plus side, the lunch specials at Pompei's Grotto are far more reasonably priced than nearby Cioppino's and Capurro's, and the sourdough is really yummy. 

On the minus side, my salmon was overcooked as was the side of peas, and the pasta that came with the dish was pretty bland. I suppose they're gearing the food to a flyover state palate? 

Next time out for lunch in the Wharf I'd probably walk by Pompei and continue on to Scoma's, even though it is bound to be pricier it's worth the dough.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
Best Tasting Birthday Dinner EVER!!!!

With so many seafood places to pick from it was a very hard decision.  We didn't have a lot of money to spend and I was nervous about dropping $60 on a dinner that could have well sucked.  I  wasn't expected to be blown away.  The menu is simple, I had the grilled shrimp and scallops and my fiance had the sauteed shrimp and scallops in garlic.  Holy crap.  I've had quite a few grilled shrimp in my day and this rivaled all of them.  

Its not trendy, overpriced or touristy.  Just delicious.
author: Amber S.

description: Awful service. Rude waitress and manager. They don't honor their specials. Use old fish in fish tacos and very low end vodka. Have never been so unimpressed. Definitely would not recommend.
author: Sarah S.

description: Horrible service, dirty silverware and mediocre food. Won't be coming back here any time soon!
author: Suzy M.

description: Took my family of 6 there for dinner while visiting San Fran. So disappointed on our decision. The owner seemed nice but desperate while we were outside the restaurant trying to decide to eat there or next door. Should have went with my gut. I ordered the Ny Steak and asked for medium rare and it was well done. I asked for steak sauce and the waitress said they were out.  The waitress was a little ruff looking and when she put the plates down all hard i thought i was at Dick's. My husband was afraid to ask her for anything lol. I would never return to this restaurant way over priced for the quality of food you get and service. I would go into detail about the rest of our order but it was all bad.
author: Danita L.

description: Great!  Food was wonderful!  Fresh, unique, hot, and abundant.  The service was perfect!  The prices were average for the area.  Nothing to complain about here.  I loved it.
author: Pat M.

description:
We were stuck in sort of a wasteland of San Fran restaurants being our one night stay was in a hotel near Fisherman's Wharf.  Family owned Pompei looked different then the rest of the loud, big, touristy eateries in the immediate area.  It was warm and cozy with red and white checkered fabric tablecloths and a casual easy going atmosphere.  

The menu was pretty predictable for an Italian seafood place.  It had the required selection of beef, chicken, pasta and seafood.  The latter at least had some local offerings.

I wasn't in for a big meal, so I got the Louie salad with "bay" shrimp, crab meat, egg, and avocado over greens and their house made dressing.  My dining companion got a local fish, plainly grilled.

I almost had to laugh when the salad was placed in front of me.  I hadn't seen those tiny pinkie- nail sized shrimp from a can since I was a kid in the midwest.  As five year olds we may have oohed and aahed upon finding them in my Aunt's seafood dip, but now all I could merit was a groan and a chuckle.  For $24.95, I expected prawns for goodness sake.

I assumed the crab meat was harvested from a local dungeness, but after seeing the shrimp, who knows.  All I can say is I was hungry.  Everything seemed fresh, veggies crunchy so it satisfied my appetitie.  I'm not sure I would proclaim the dressing "house made" as it resembled and tasted like my mom's quick Thousand Island dressing sans the pickle relish. 

Fish dish was alright, but nothing you would come back for.  Atmosphere, service, house wine prices were decent.  Food, an afterthought.  No I would not come back.  Next time I will hail a cab.
author: Regina S.

description:
Um.... TOURIST TRAP!!

I ate oysters and one was rotten, had to get up and go spit  (almost puke) it out in the toilet...

This place is gross...
author: N. M.

description:
The only bad place we visited while in SF. After wandering the wharf, we popped in and sat in their bar to review the menu and decide if we wanted to eat dinner. A drunk man that seemed to be regular chatted with the female bartender while we awaited service for 5-minutes.  The bartender then walked away and we were left to engage with the friendly yet annoying ol' drunk fella. To escape we decided to move to the dining room and eat. We got seated quickly, but  waited another 5-minutes  for a server, she gruffly (and I'm being nice)  took our drink orders and then we began to reconsider ordering any food as the service was so poor. 

We asked for a few minutes to decide and were promptly told the rules that if we did not order we had to take our drinks and move...  She actually pointed at the menu to show us the rules... This was a 20-table fish restaurant, the pressure was odd. Her manager/host was a friendly younger man that supported her completely without taking the time to address us and our issues. There were many open tables, so they were rude for no reason and lost our business.  I found a highly rated restaurant nearby on Yelp named Scoma's where we had a great meal and good time. 

Just because it's a tourist area, you don't get to offer poor service. This is the first bad Yelp review I've ever written and it was earned!
author: Jill S.

description: Ewww- pretty sure all the food we were served was frozen. The clam chowder bread bowl was the only good thing at the table and they likely got it down the street for 1/2 the price. So disappointed. We should have just gone to in-n-out or Chipotle...
author: Carma H.

description: The experience of eating here was disappointing to say the least. It was clear that they had enough business from tourists that they didn't have to try hard with their food. I ordered the tuna sandwich, which was nothing spectacular. My friend ordered the cheeseburger, which was terribly disappointing. You could tell that it was just a patty they had taken from the freezer and warmed up with a piece of kraft cheese slapped on the top. It was on plain ciabatta roll, with a piece of lettuce and tomato. No sauces. In my opinion it was overpriced for the quality of food. It seems like a shame to eat somewhere like this when you are visiting the city. I recommend looking elsewhere for a better culinary experience.
author: Mary B.

description: I recently visited San Francisco for the weekend and decided to give this place a try. I must admit I was very pleased...I had the "angeliina" and it was DELICIOUS!!!! I WILL DEFINITELY GO BACK THERE,,,,,
author: Kim S.

description:
Great service, food, and overall experience was great. 
I tried the saute combo was delicious.
author: Lulu R.

description: Average would be generous . Soup and sandwich was uneventful. The soup was rather blah. It needed more spice and more clams. With so many options for soup in the area they need to step it up because It was nothing to write home about. The crab on the sandwich was good but was really stingy. The risotto was a good portion and it was very garlicky. The hostess is VERY loud and rude. She yells after customers and at waiters that are trying to do their jobs. The waitstaff seemed pleasant but slow. Make sure to check your bill because they may try to overcharge you.
author: TD S.

description: Drinks was good; food was okay; service was terribly slow.  Waited 15 minutes.  I had to finally get up and ask the front desk gal for some service.  Costumer shouldn't have to ask for service.
author: Erick H.

description: My sister and I were staying in the Fisherman's Wharf and happened to stumble upon this place for dinner. I would probably say that this was the best spaghetti I have ever had!! I know it is a simple meal, but something about the food was not simple at all. I also had their chocolate cake for dessert and that was amazing as well. You definitely can't go wrong with eating here and I look forward to going again whenever I'm back in San Francisco!
author: Maddie A.

description: Stopped in with my son and niece. This is a quaint and small restaurant near the piers. They lack an ocean view. My son had the cioppino, I had the crab & shrimp spaghetti and my niece had the crab cake sandwich. We all shared a crab sampler appetizer. The waitress made a great Pinot Grigio recommendation. The crab cakes are to die for! I took one star away only because I found a couple pieces of crab shell in my entree AND they serve their sourdough bread cold!!!
author: Lola M.

description: Lousy all the way around. Hostess with an accent and a bad attitude started us off. Next came the tattooed bartender/ terrible server. Food was mediocre at best. I guess i looked like a bad tip, so guess what? That's what he got. I wouldn't have left anything but didn't want to wait for my change. Just wanted to leave.
author: G A.

description:
Over all it was A-OK...

Clam chowder -decent amount of clam but nothing amazing...

Portabella mushroom Risotto - simple looking but this one was good; the risotto was nicely done, and they use decent size portabella mushroom

Seafood Pasta -  It was ok, the fresh on it was fresh but nothing wow about it;  I thought the sauce was very 'out of a bottle' like instead of homemade

The bread was cold, and  not much service to speak of...
author: Coco L.

description: I have been lucky enough to come to San Francisco approximately 4 times in the last 9 years.  The last three times I have visited I make sure to visit this restaurant, near the wharf, to sit at the bar and have my last (and best) San Francisco meal.  And it must involve Dungeness crab.  The past two times I ordered my martini (whatever kind they make me it really is a good, professionally made martini) and a crab sandwich.  This past time, I went for something different, a crab salad, with double crab meat.  I started with a special martini that the bartender Paul, made just for me and met the lovely manager, Fetenzo (sp?) who is from Sicily and just the nicest person, next to Paul the bartender, in all of San Fran.  I told them my story about how consistent this place is with their fresh crab and thus must be my last meal every time I visit their lovely city.  The manager went into the details of how they make sure it is fresh.  The salad arrived.  It was perfect.  And Paul didn't even think it was weird that I asked for drawn butter too!  So I ate half with Louie dressing (which tasted totally homemade and yummy) and the rest with butter.  I loved how they talked about this restaurant and it's owner who I believe they said her name was Nancy and how it is really a family run restaurant.  No corporations involved!  The decor is old school, and don't be frightened off that it isn't going to be good because it is near the cheesy Fisherman's Wharf.  This place could teach Scoma's something about fresh food, fresh ingredients, happy customers.  God it was so good.  And always is!
author: Linda H.

description: Love this place. We make a special effort to eat here whenever we're in the city. I love their Linguini and Clams! I love that they bring you a little bowl of parmsian cheese to go with it. Ice cold Anchor Steam rounds out a great meal. This place does not overlook the bay but when we eat on the patio, we're always entertained by the hustle of the street. My wife enjoys their shrimp salad although the price seems to have gone up on this and may be a little pricey. Great Riesling also!
author: Ron E.

description: Went to this place when we were wandering on Jefferson street. We ordered captain's platter, clam chowder, Caesar salad, crab and shrimp spaghetti and some white wine. Everything was just too mediocre and plain. The waitress was missing all the time. Don't come to this place if you expect some decent and fresh seafood!
author: Yuqi Z.

description: Real nice crab sampler - especially with that aioli. Best surprise: an amazing cucumber Bloody Mary.
author: Jason S.

description:
The owner of this place needs to see restaurant impossible or chef Ramsey kitchen nightmares. The service was dreadul. After a long segway tour, Shoutout to SF electric tour company :), we were tired and walked aroind a bit to find a place to eat. 
So from the side walk this lady, I think the owner, was yelling at us that is was happy hour and to come in. 
We looked at the menue and was like okay we can try it. 
The most the Yeller dis was put us at a table with one menu while we waited for  the most unfriendly waitress ever. 
Long story short 5 dollar fried shrimp looked and tasted like something from a grocery store freezer. Fish tacos over cooked and tasteless. Crab cake sandwich had much more bread thank crab cake with a tasteless pesto aoili. Barely a tip for her.
In the middle of the this horrible service a woman's toddler daughter waa brought in by anpther waitress soon to be on the clock. The bartender playws with her behind the bar. Played with her ball and bounced it around and continued working clearing tables and taking orders with her daughter in her arms! I did not see her wash her hands once after playing with this dirty ball and at the heart of it all the little gi srarts letting out these ear shattering high putched screams. She finally stopped but we were seconds from walking out the door.
The worst place ever never again!
author: Adrian M.

description: Far too expensive for the quality of food we got. It was like I cooked it myself and I'm not a great cook. Alfredo was super bland and tasted strongly of flour. Seafood seemed like it came frozen from a bag. Servers were really nice but we won't come back.
author: Sonia M.

description: Way over priced for small amounts of average food. Staff was very friendly. We will not be going back.
author: Bill C.

description: I won't return. Their signature Bloody Mary was $16.00 but didn't have any flavor. The kitchen failed to put all of the food on our plate and when we asked about the missing fish, the wait staff didn't seem to know what came on the plate or what to do. One waitress listened to our question then proceeded to help other guests without assisting us. The wedge salad had so much dressing it was inedible. I couldn't even taste the lettuce. Luckily the manager was very reasonable and comped part of our meal for the troubles.
author: Rosa P.

description: We got a delicious pasta with scalops and other sea shells and the service was exelent. We even got an opotunity to charge the cell phone as well. Lovely!!!!
author: Lennart B.

description: Not a bad place for a quick bite to eat. We both had the lunch special (soup and salad). The chowder was pretty good and they give you lots of shrimp on the salad. Sourdough bread was yummy. Our server was goofy and made sure we were taken care of. We wanted some good clam chowder for lunch and that's exactly what we got.
author: Vanessa B.

description: Not worth the price. Mediocre food, not well seasoned. Had sauteed shrimp and scallops. My daughter had fish and chips, and other daughter shrimp pasta.  All agreed it was ok, but for $70 i wish we had gone somewhere else.  Couldnt eat that price the rest of our trip, so i was disappointed.
author: Ali S.

description:
Anniversary Dinner with the wife.

Service=Really Good.  Our server was attentive and cordial without being fake.

Food=Really Good.  Appetizer Special that night was a Crab Cake, Crab Bruschetta, and some Crab Legs.  

I had the Seafood sampler and my wife had the Sea Bass.  Both awesome.

Very nice spot on the wharf close to where we were staying.

We will be back
author: Bill D.

description: It was a beautiful day in the city, they have a lovely outdoor patio.  The young man working the front Gregorio pulled us right in.  He made us feel welcome, and set up the umbrella for us.  Our waitress Stephanie was attentive, and had service under control.  Ordered the Cobb salad with chicken.  It was a good portion, nice and cold with a very good dressing.  My husband got the grilled shrimp with potatoes and vegies.  He was more than happy, and they were not skimpy on the prawns.  Will definitely go back.
author: tonya m.

description: Pretty dang average.  Was busy as can be on Saturday.  Service was fine.  Nothing special.  Steamed Mussels didn't taste right...they were big...just tasted burnt...weird thing to say about something that should've been steamed, I know.  Fettuccine was a bit below average.  I make some bomb Alfredo sauce at home.....their sauce was a bit musty.  Left my debit card there....was excited to leave and forgot it.  My bad....but wasn't it really their bad?  I wanted to leave because the environment was schtick and I was just ready to not hang out there any longer than I needed to.  Didn't feel that way at Lou's down the street in November.
author: J J.

description:
The worst attitude EVER !  We left hungry without ordering after 45 minutes !!

we waited under the sun with my 1 year old son and my dog and finally we sat down at a table after 30 minutes of waiting... They could at least offer us some water when we sat down .... 

The table next to us came after us, ordered their drink and GOT their drinks, and still no one had even come to our table to say HI !

I talked to the guy who seemed like the boss. He said we will be with you shortly !! 
5 more minutes and NOTHING !!! my wife goes and talks to him ... he is RUDE with my wife and tells her not to yell !!!  my wife was not yelling ... 

Finally we leave the restaurant after 45 minutes of wasted time and a bad attitude and hungry !!  I did not wanna give them any business !

There are many nice places in SF to eat ... Dont waste your time and your money on this cheap place ...  I rather have bad food than receive bad attitude !!
author: Kharazm S.

description: Clam chowder was not that good.. It had a loooot of celery in the soup. Bf had seafood pasta which was good, just a little bit too oily, i had the basic calamari with fries lunch combo. Calamari was delicious, well battered, and fresh! I was disapointed with the clam chowder...
author: Cristina L.

description: Great overall! Amazing fisherman's stew! So,so scallops and shrimp with pasta. Loved the atmosphere. A perfect dinner for our first meal in San Francisco.
author: Brandi H.

description:
Tastewise.  Excellent!    Service.   Excellent!    atomosphere.   Excellent.

there is  a but, however.     I went to the Pompeii today with a bus group.     I pre-ordered Prawns and pasta, which was very tasty.  However, the "prawns" were the size of a quarter.  I think of prawns as 2 or 3 inches long.   I was sorely disappointed.      The chowder was superb!
author: Jean H.

description: We found the place unpretentious, adequately priced (given that it's in the Tourist Zone), and a good value. My wife had the 1/2 roasted dungeness crab and I had the seared scallops. Both were excellent, cooked just to the point of being tender. Garlic was used to embellish each dish, but didn't overpower either. We ate at the bar, so I can't comment on the table service, but the staff we met, including the manager, were very friendly and efficient. We would go again.
author: Jim P.

description:
Downright horrible service! 
I took my clients from Korea to this restaurant and I wanted to make sure that my guests are treated well and experience good chowder in SF that they were craving for and this restaurant ruined everything. 
When my group entered the restaurant, the server stared at us like some monkeys in the zoo. As soon as they seat us, this server did not respect our time but rush us to order whatever in the menu. I was under the impression that this server talked down on our group because pretty much I was the only one who speaks English. 
When the food was ready, this server dropped them on our table like she can't hold the soup for 2 seconds and the chowder was spilled all over our table. 
Most surprisingly, when we get the bill, I notice a big fat word on the receipt that says "TIP!!" with stars around the word as an emphasis. Obviously, I leave no tips and our group had to endure a stingy look and some Italian words from the servers which I am pretty sure some racial remarks. 

I would never ever come back to this place. period.
author: Young S.

description:
Sunday night dinner after long day wandering the Exploratorium and surrounding areas.  Arrived at Fisherman's Wharf a bit tired but after a stint in the antique arcade, we looked for a place to rest and fuel up.  First picked Joe's Crab Shack due to location but quickly discarded that idea after seeing 2 star yelp rating plus it looked a bit fast foody when we checked it out.  Decided on Pompei's over Lou's by 1/2 star.  
Food was reasonable.  Scampi and linguine was fine.  Scallops were good. Crab not bad as was the cod.  But nothing to  write home about.  Best was the bread. It was from Boudin's.  Very  tasty.
Service was adequate.   Handled our allergy questions ok and was good to  check  to make sure the pasta was egg and dairy free.
All in all worked out well.  But would not be our destination choice in the future.  Probably would try something else to see what else is available.
author: B W.

description:
Great service. Great food. Great restaurant. From the reservation to the check, this place was wonderful. I worried because I read some 1 star reviews but I easily give it 5 stars and I am very picky about food and service. 

Our party of 11 was seated right away at the exact time we reserved our table for. We had a lovely Italian waitress who was friendly, efficient and so pleasant. We got water without ice as we requested. My small crab salad was huge and delicious with beautiful fresh avocado and yummy piles of flavorful crabmeat. The children liked their food as did the parents and grandparents. Carafes of sprite and water were delivered and filled as needed. 

Bon apetito!
author: Susie B.

description: Excellent service, orgasmic food. The seafood platter was so fresh n the risotto was perfetto! Will be back!!
author: Asia W.

description:
After just having climbed Telegraph Hill to Coit Tower, we were starved.  Although I did Yelp and see the 3 1/2 stars, I thought, how badly could they screw up fish and chips?  Well, so badly that if I could give no stars, I would.  

Let's start with the service.  Poor.  Extremely poor.  I suspected something like this when I saw a table of six women fighting with him because he'd screwed up their bill so badly.  For us?  Extremely slow and inattentive service.  People seated ten minutes after us had their main courses before he brought out our bread, not to mention the appetizer.   When he would infrequently come out of the kitchen to do what, I don't know, he wouldn't even look our way.  Getting drink refills was like pulling teeth.  I even explained the problems to the greeter and asked her to get a manager.  Did one show up?  Nope.  

Our food, when it did finally arrive (with an unfriendly apology explaining that he was servicing another table), was not even Long John Silver standard.  Cold bread and frozen butter.  Oreida frozen fries, warm.  Gorton's fish fillets, very greasy.  Tartar?  The grossest I've EVER had.  It was literally sweet pickle relish mixed in to mayo.  It was disgusting.   

All of this for $47.  Ouch.   Off day?  Nope.  We were only one of two tables he was servicing.  The restaurant was only half full.   I should have gone to In and Out Burger across the street.
author: Marie N.

description: Decent. We were seated immediately. Friendly service, but our poor waitress had the majority of the tables. She was working hard, but still managed to be as attentive as she possibly could. Clam chowder was amazing. Some of the best we've ever had. The rest of the food was decent. We had the chicken Parmesan and salmon. Nothing too special and somewhat overpriced. Don't regret going, but wouldn't go back.
author: Amie S.

description:
Having spent years in the SF bay area and avoiding the touristy dining areas, I just had to take my son walking around the wharf area and for a quick bite to eat there.   Parking around here can be nil or pretty expensive but being a former 'local' I know where to park for free, if you get lucky.  We got lucky and found one open spot, yessss!

After checking out the mechanical museum,  Pier 39 and the surrounding sights, we settled for hot bowls of clam chowder with good o'sourdough bread/butter.  Nothing beats sourdough bread made in the bay area here.  The sourdough southern California bakes just does not compare.

I wouldn't order the oysters on the half shell again; they were so dinky I had to send them back.  Otherwise excellent service and satisfying chowder.
author: M L.

description: Try the shrimp salad on an avocado at lunch.  So good!  Service wasn't very impressive.  My waiter was more interested in the girl at the restaurant next  door then he was in taking my order and explaining the items.  I had to give this a high rating based on the food and wine only.  That won't disappoint,
author: Geri P.

description: The two stars are for the polite and attentive hostess and waiter. The food was mediocre at best.  Cioppino's Restaurant in a few doors away and as we discovered the next night, the food is great, there.
author: George F.

description: In a word - "Meh...." Atmosphere is pleasant and service was great! We only had a half-hour until our Segway Tour, and they delivered. That said, the food was soooo underwhelming. You'd expect more from an eatery at Fisherman's Wharf! I had the warm crab sandwich and hubbie had the sand dabs. Both were bland, the coleslaw on the bitter side, and green beans needed "something." Our friend had the crab cake sandwich which she seemed to enjoy.
author: Donna R.

description: Went in for happy hour.....staff was very rude....waitress kept coming to the table saying "you done? Want something else??? Wine was cheap....box wine....too many places on the wharf.....wouldn't come back
author: Scott M.

description:
Very nice place.
Great service, amazing people.
And delicious food for very low price (lunch)
author: Elo C.

description: Had a wonderful dinner with my wife at this great family restaurant! Food was excellent. great atmosphere on the wharf in the middle of all the doings! U can relax and have a great bowl of clam chowder!
author: Dylan B.

description: Pompei's Grotto is a cute little place on the walk to Fisherman's Wharf that has great food! They have some tables set up outside, and a bunch of tables set up inside as well. The service here is also great- our waitress was very attentive and brought us probably 4 baskets of bread and even free clam chowder for the table. I got the crab salad-grilled cheese; it was sooooo good, but had slightly too much mayo in the crab salad- so beware! Also the portion for that was huge- too much grilled cheese for one person, plus french fries! I think it would be good to share (especially cuz it's a little pricey). This place was good- I would go back next time I'm in San Fran!
author: Lindsey M.

description:
It was a very expensive and disappointing lunch. 
My husband ordered the sea bass and it was drenched in butter and a normally light dish that is his favorite fish made him feel heavy and nauseous afterwards. 
My crab stuffed avocados were okay, but the crab salad had a strong flavor of mayonnaise and not so much the crab. I also did not feel well after the meal. 
The waitress was polite and made some recommendations, however the crab jacks sandwich she recommended to my friend was basically the mayo filled crab salad on bread with melted cheese. She even told us the fish tacos were so-so when our friend asked about ordering them. 

Bottom line- it is really expensive and not very good quality food.
author: Andrea H.

description: Great little restaurant on the wharf! Service was fast and friendly. Food was perfectly cooked and delicious!
author: Stephanie W.

description: Love this place!!! We've been coming here for the past 19years, it's definitely our go-to spot whenever we want consistent delicious, decadent, savory yum yum!! The owner is a sweetheart that treats her customers like family, and the service is impeccable. Love everything on the menu but my favorites are the crab bruchetta, calamari and Francescos misto, my tummy is grumbling as I write this!! Thank you for everything, especially for being so extremely delicious!! P.S. perfect atmosphere and ambiance, from date night to family date night.
author: G. Y.

description: Best linguini and clams u ever had. The big poppa IPA beer was great.  Gave it 4 stars for quality,  but some of the waitress was very unprofessional.  Looks like they meet up at the bar and start dirty mouthing their customers.  Overall the restaurant recommended
author: Sarath K.

description: I've eaten all over the world, and the main courses here were the worst!  I was embarrassed this had to be my sister's introduction to Californian food.  The appetizers were decent and fresh, but the main courses tasted nasty. My sister had the Alfredo and I had the spaghetti. The spaghetti noodles were under cooked and her Alfredo tasted like straight oil.  We sent the main courses back.  The manager was unprofessional too and rudely questioned why we were unsatisfied.  I explained that the Alfredo was really oily and the spaghetti noodles were under cooked. The manager argued that they make the Alfredo with butter and it's just fine. It was $100 for the two of us to eat here.  Save yourself time and money and eat somewhere else classier.  In-n-Out is right up the street and serves better food!
author: Helia H.

description: Great food and even better service ! Our food was fresh and delivered quickly to the table . Waiter was quick with our drinks and was very attentive . Crab Salad was good but not great . The crab cakes were heavenly and the crab bruschetta was an amazing treat. Salmon was salty but still very tasty .
author: Samantha S.

description: Over greasy fried zucchini and the sole fish sandwich was nothing to brag about- more filler than fish
author: Mitch R.

description: We had out of country guests came here all 6 of us. Sunday night few tables. I ordered sea bass...worst fish ever no flavor, both top & bottom OVER COOKED! Had a HARD crust WTF! Vegetables and fish in so much butter I felt my heart skip a couple of beats. My wife had spaghetti swimming in watery sauce. My bro's-in-law had shrimp ok flavor but OVER COOKED! I'm a San Francisco Native. I say DONT COME HERE NOT WORTH IT!!
author: Ricardo H.

description:
Just for dessert & drinks.
They were out of all gelato. So I had the NY cheesecake which was as boring as eating cardboard. The glass of Merlot was watered down and the bartender was a ditzy bouncy ball.

2 stars cuz the tiramisu wasn't half bad.
author: Barbara D.

description: I've eaten here a few times because it is down the street from a couple of hotels I stay at while in San Francisco.  Since I eat alone while on business trips, I'm asked at the front door if I want to eat in the restaurant or in the bar.  I've tried both but I've found the friendlier service in the bar.  The bartender in the bar is responsible for making the alcoholic drinks for entire restaurant and serving drinks and food at the 4 or 5 two seat tables in the bar area.  They have a good selection of fried, steamed, and sauteed seafood as well as Italian food.  I usually go for the fried seafood and I haven't been disappointed.   Very good but not quite great.  About average priced for the restaurants in the Fisherman's Wharf area.
author: David K.

description:
We were in town for the weekend, and of course wanted to sample the local seafood.  We love Fisherman's Wharf and stopped in to Pompei's Grotto.  The food and service was great!  Very fresh food, and a good selection of seafood.

I had the grilled shrimp and scallops, and my wife had the Fisherman's Stew.  We also had the Clam Chowder for an appetizer; we have been sampling all the chowder we could during our west coast road trip.  The food was very fresh, not spectacular, but very solid.  

This is a solid restaurant, with great service and good food.  A solid double up the middle, if you're a baseball fan.  However, the only thing I would mention is that the decor is a little tired and sleepy, and the food is a bit as well.  I can't 100% put my finger on it, but it's not fine dining.

I'll close on this.  You're on Fisherman's Wharf so this place offers fresh seafood that tastes great, with an older more rustic feel.  We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner, but to put it up against fine dining in San Francisco would be disservice.  But if you can  drop your pretensions, and enjoy being on the Wharf in San Francisco where fresh seafood is the norm and is a rustic place with some history, this is a solid option.
author: John K.

description: Five stars for the popcorn shrimp being perfect!!! Location location :) if u sit outside they have decent music playing and its fun to watch the tourist pass by on a segway tour or bike. They use prawn instead of small shrimp and cut them in half. They are huge and not over battered at all. That being said we only order fried  shrimp, calamari and clam chowder (we had other plans for dinner -Fatties) While in San Francisco we tried three different clam chowders and this one was the best (in fairness the crab chowder is to die for at the crab house on pier 39).  Our bill here??  A mere 66 bucks! Can't beat the location, and the staff was friendly andaccommodating.
author: Roselynn V.

description:
One word for this place: meh. 

Food: 2
Value: 2
Service: 4
Ambiance: 4
Cleanliness: 4

Went for a Sunday lunch and was very underwhelmed with my bland tasteless tuna sandwich with average French fries. For the money, I expected more flavor or something "different".  When my five min homemade tuna sandwich is better than a $11 restaurant sandwich...not good. 

Also had a fish taco that was pretty good but again, sorta lacked in flavor.  Better than the tuna but still nothing special. 

Kids had fried shrimp and fries. They were happy but they eat anything. Nearly $8 for a kids meal!?

Perhaps I ordered the wrong thing but I was just so disappointed for what we paid. 

I did  appreciate the staff who were kind and helpful.  Bathroom was clean too!
author: Brett C.

description:
We went here last night with family after looking at the reviews. At first we were sort of put off by the somewhat curt waitress, but maybe we caught her at a bad moment as she seemed to be much more attentive and friendly by the end of the meal.

We shared the calamari appetizer and I ordered the cracked crab special for dinner. Everything was delicious if a bit salty. Maybe a tablespoon or 2 less and it would have been perfect  The calamari was cooked perfectly and was a bit addicting, like eating good french fries where you can't eat just one. My 7-year-old was even trying to grab them off everyone's plates! My meal was very tasty, cracked crab and a side of pasta in a butter and garlic sauce, but then again, how can you go wrong with that? My husband had the pasta with clams and red sauce special. He apparently loved it since his plate was wiped clean. His only complaint was that it wasn't a very large serving.

All in all, next time we come to Fishermans Wharf we would go there again. We would just ask them to cut back on the salt a little bit.
author: Alana R.

description: Had the cioppino and it was ok. I was expecting something a bit better for the price but overall a good experience.
author: Genaro R.

description:
Took my Dad here for Father's Day.  This restaurant has apparently been around for a while, and my Dad used to come here all the time back in the day.

The exterior is very inviting, with a little patio area.  My Dad and I were seated next to the front window, as we didn't want to wait for an outdoor table.  The 2-tops were a little close together, but I enjoyed the location next to the window.

They have a pretty extensive seafood menu.  I heard the clam chowder here is amazing, but I already had chowder earlier in the day.  We shared an order of the clams for our appetizer.  Pretty basic sauce, but still very good.  The clams were cooked perfectly, and I loved the fact that all the clams were open (I hate when restaurants don't check for unopened shells)!

For my main, I had the garlic scallops.  I was surprised at how many different scallop entrees they had (love love love scallops).  They were good, however lacking a punch that makes the dish special from many other I've tried.  Perhaps more garlic?  They may have been slightly overcooked than I usually perfer, but I'm really picky about my scallops.  The side of potatoes were a little too al dente.  My Dad ordered the seabass entree (they were out of swordfish).  I didn't get to taste it, but he seemed to enjoy the dish.  The portion sizes were pretty good for the price.

Overall, the food is tasty.  Nothing out of this world, but more of a comfort-seafood type of place.  I'll need to come back for the clam chowder that my Dad recommended.
author: Gina L.

description: Food was very tasty. We tried the salmon pasta and the crab linguini pasta. Both were great. Good portions too. They have a good cocktail menu along with a long wine list. Not too expensive either. Service was fast but our waitress wasn't too pleasant. It was also a bit too dim. Made it more challenging breaking that crab.
author: Aleksandra C.

description: On 2/25 I got a sudden crab louie craving and headed to the wharf area.  I'm sure Scoma would have made a great one, but I couldn't stomach a $38 (+tax/tip) salad.  Lou's Fish Shack next to Pompei's had a better price of $22, but I decided on Pompei's $28 offering.  Of course choosing the least expensive fish dish can go very wrong, but I was quite happy with my salad.  Along with the free bread, it filled me up and had plenty of crab meat.  The service was great too, and they had many $14 lunch specials for when you don't want to splurge.  Five stars!
author: Gordon L.

description:
Yuck.  Another expensive lame lunch at the wharf.  Out of town guests just HAVE to go so here we go again.  Would someone with standards please find me a good place to go? Crab sandwich meh.  Manhattan clam chowder -ok.  The Ciopino was disgusting.  The crab didn't tastes of the best freshness. The sauce taste like Hunt's tomato paste mixed with water and not much seasoning.  After eating it I was still hungry.  Bread should be better.

We had 5 star service but it wasn't very busy.

The volcano needs to erupt and burn down Pompei so that a better restaurant can open.
author: pilou o.

description: Keep walking. Nothing Special here. Wandering the Wharf later in the evening and decided to stop and really wish I hadn't. Claim Chowder was decent the rest was sub par. The Crab was not very good at all. It was old and had very little flavor the coloring was even a little off. Definitely not worth the prices. Look else where.....Keep Walking.
author: Scotch E.

description: If it was middle school, it would be an A- restaurant, only because it isn't the best place in Downtown San Fran. I got the Crabjacks, which is crab grilled cheese. It was an excellent choice, but it was very messy! It was an above average restaurant, and I am over all glad I went.
author: Delaney G.

description: We visited just for drinks in their happy hour. Rude waitress who seemed like she wanted us gone asap. Ordered a Pinot Grigio, which didn't taste like a Pinot. Couldn't be bothered to argue as it would have involved talking to the rude waitress. The drinks were pretty cheap though...
author: Tom S.

description:
This restaurant hit the spot after a day of delayed flights.  Yes, I was a tourist visiting SF and stayed in Fisherman's Wharf, Pompei's Grotto was in walking distance from our hotel.  It's very quaint, not a lot of hoopla, which was appreciated after a day of traveling.  

Right away, the waitress was sweet and wonderful.  She made suggestions not only for what to eat, but also where to go in the city during our vacation.  She even gave us a guide book and mapped out different routes for us.  In fact, she was probably one of the best waitresses I've ever had and also I think probably the best waitress at Pompei's.  If you go, ask for Traci.  Out of all the places we ate on the wharf, this was the most enjoyable.  It wasn't overrun with kids and large families, just a cute and relaxing environment.  I only went for lunch and was told that it is busiest at night.  

Now, the food.  I actually ate there twice on my visit, that's how much I liked it.  The Gamberetti Pasta is delish- rock shrimp, tomatoes, garlic, basil, and cream sauce all tossed with fettuccine.  The Crabjacks are a unique twist on a grilled cheese, it's crab salad and cheese melted between sourdough bead. They also have Bouillabaisse, which is a whole lot of seafood mixed together in a tomato broth with green peppers and onions. 

Basically, everything was so tasty that we had to go back a second time!  As far as tourist spots go on the wharf, this place was the least annoying, it had decent prices, good service (gotta ask for Traci, I can't vouch for anybody else), and great food.
author: Morgan D.

description: Terrible! My wife and I sat down, she wasn't hungry, I was just getting their lunch special with a lemonade, and my wife got a hot tea, the waiter told me we couldnt order because they have a $15 minimum per person, even though their lunch special is $13.95.  Absolutely ridiculous, I've never encountered such a crappy policy or treated to poorly at a restaurant.  Highly recommend avoiding this place, go to Beach Street Grill around the corner where they have wonderful service.
author: Jason G.

description:
Wandered in here for lunch and really liked it. Sat inside and watched the tourists and freaks walking around. Ordered two beers and they came with chilled glasses! Nice!

The boss had the tuna salad with avocado. It was made with fresh tuna and was really good. I wanted chowder but I wasn't sure which one to have. I asked if it was "real" Manhattan chowder. To my surprise the waiter offered us a sample. He came back to the table with a cup of both chowders to try. The New England was not so hot. I didn't care for it. But the Manhattan was outstanding. We sent the cup of New England back and I ate the Manhattan. I ordered a bowl of the Manhattan and a Crab cocktail. Everything was fresh and very good!  So I had a cup and a bowl of chowder and only got charged for the bowl!

The Manhattan chowder is not quite authentic Manhattan, its more like west coast red chowder. It is very good and I would come back for it, but being a NY'er can't say it's really Manhattan.

Also of note the cocktail sauce does not have horseradish in it. It is very good though.

We had dessert too. Apple something or other with ice cream and caramel. It was also very good!  Espresso and Sambuca went well.

Service is excellent. Dan was a great server!
author: Henry W.

description: This place has some great seafood and awesome service. I came with the entire family and they had a table big enough for all of us. (10) then joked about a krabby patty from spongebob and you know what, he brought out a crab cake in a bun. It was really good! Others ordered cioppino and pasta with clams and fried fish and chips. Everything was fresh and cooked well with good seasoning and not too big of a fishy taste. Excellent family place for great seafood. It's by fisherman wharf so of course parking is kind of expensive. But ehh. Ill be coming back for another krabby patty
author: Matthew G.

description: It has a nice decor inside. I was not impressed with the food. The sour dough was good. The grilled fish and fried shrimp were ok. The sauteed squash was bitter and over cooked. The roasted fingerling potatoes were really sliced potatoes. They were soft and mushy, not crisp at all. The had a very limited beer selection. The service was good.
author: Frankie V.

description: great little place for dinner in the fishermans wharf/pier 39 area. The prices are not over inflated like many of the restaurants in the area, and the food was great. This place has a great atmosphere very cozy and relaxed. They were pretty busy for a weeknight  but we got great service and were very happy we came here.
author: Andrea A.

description:
Two friends and I went there for dinner at new year's eve. We compared different restaurants on the Fisherman's Wharf. We were first attracted by the overall mood in the restaurant, and followed by the Daily Special.
Two of us ordered the "Surf and Turf" - New York Steak + Half Crab, another ordered the seafood pasta. The waitress were extremely helpful and kind. The New York Steak was just AWESOME, we had medium-rare, and the meat taste was 100% kept, yummy. The crab was also excellent too, lots of meat. We had strawberry cheesecake + apple "pie" for dessert, both were delicious.
Last but not least, the pricing was totally worth it. $32 for "Surf and Turf", $20 for the pasta, I will definitely go again.
author: Wesley K.

description:
Wandering around Fisherman's Wharf on a chilly Friday night, we literally chose Pompei's because we were getting cold and didn't want to keep walking because the gusts were starting to get the better of us.

Our server was adequate but just... not particularly personable nor memorable. We ordered two breadbowls of the Boston Clam Chowder (always heard it called New England Clam Chowder, but whatever) and my dining companion ordered the shrimp and crab lasagna.

The soup was AMAZING. Perhaps the best clam chowder I've had, and served in a Boudin breadbowl. Just couldn't really be any better. The lagagna, in comparison, was rather mediocre. The sauce and the cheese had strong flavor which overpowered the shrimp and lasagna, for sure. That being said, perhaps we were just harsh critics because the soup wowed us the way it did.

Nothing too special about the decor but that was actually refreshing in Fisherman's Wharf; they weren't trying too hard like some other places seemed to. It was nice and warm and cozy and pleasant enough.

Would have had five stars if the server was just a bit more charismatic and if the lasagna would have balanced the flavors better. Overall a nice meal and a pleasant night.
author: Sean B.

description:
I'm going to say I'm surprised I'm giving this place such a good rating, as I never expect anything in the tourist trap district of San Francisco to produce good service (unless it's Scoma's).

My friend from Japan made a long trip from her short stop in L.A. to visit me - a four year reunion that resulted in lots of broken Japanese obnxious chatter. As eating out in Japan at nicer restaurants can be absurdly expensive and is usually a luxury left to up to parents to treat their children too, my friend decided she wanted to eat crab and have ambience while she could. We wandered the wharf in search of a place that did not fit the category of "crab shack" without breaking the bank too badly - and the three of us stumbled across Pompei's Grotto.

Let's just say that everyone was overly, absurdly nice and considerate to us. Not that we're young, but I'd say out of all the older more affluent tourists, we probably had the best service imaginable. Our hostess was amazing - sweet and escorted us to the bar. The bartendresses both doted upon us when only one as necessary to help us. When our table was ready after a short 15 minute wait, the hostess came over to grab us and offered us a tray to carry our drinks so my friends could manage their bags and heavy coats (we refused, but couldn't believe she went to that extent of effort).  

We ended up adding a fourth friend at last minute, which they swiftly set a place for at our table. Our waiter was swift and attentive, several of the staff helped out in small ways like picking up my friend's hat the fell on the floor as she went to go grab it. While my choice ( I don't eat seafood, so my food review will not be a selling point! ) of manicotti wasn't anywhere near amazing, the crab sampler and scallop tortellini I was told was very tasty. For three people, our bill was only $65 (drinks were only $6.50 at the bar..and that included upgrading to Maker's Mark). We had a blast and didn't feel like we were being rushed out of the restaurant. So despite horrible reviews, I'd say if you have relatives visiting from out of town or get stuck on the wharf in dire need of food that isn't In and Out, go for it!
author: Alita M.

description: My daughter and I ate here twice while in San Francisco. For lunch we had the veggie sandwich and chicken sandwich. Both were very good. Service was great.  Atmosphere is casual. For dinner we had shrimp scampi and the shrimp and scallops. Very good. They have indoor and outdoor seating.
author: Michele C.

description: Really wanted to like this charming family-owned place, but too many dishes were either too salty (tuna sandwich, seafood pasta) or too bland (clam chowder); definitely not worth the price of admission.
author: Steve B.

description: Never go to this place again!!!!Terrible foods! Cold bread like a stone! The seafood not fresh.The services very bad!High price and low foods!
author: Monica J.

description: Considering most of the places in this area cater to the tourist the quality of food here was really good.  A lucky plus was they had open tables on valentines day and we walked in without a reservation.  Took the trolley out here from Union Square and had an appetizer sampler, wedge salad and the Sea Bass.  All were excellent.  A very good experience.
author: Jason O.

description:
I liked how the waitress is patient with men, ladies, foreigners who ask where the beer is from, and babies and their chairs. 

The vegetarian eggplant was good. Plenty of food, got some for home. My tortellini were also good when warm, and MORE than plenty! Pretty heavy and oily.. so again we packed the rest for home. 

Just a sit down restaurant with warm food (and the espresso I got at the end!)  What's not to like?
author: Jordan G.

description: Service was a little slow and they were not busy at all. Food was pretty good... Conveniently located in Fishermen's Wharton
author: Maria A.

description: Food was very good, the service lacked in attentiveness. The busy boys were a lot better in help with the bread, tea, etc. the waitress took our order, brought us our food, and then disappeared until it was time for the bill, and then she waited for the money!
author: Meme Y.

description: Don't was your time! I was going to be in SF so I picked this Groupon up. Food wasn't awful, but wasn't amazing. Server was okay, but no life in her. Cheesecake wasn't that great either. Many other places to enjoy at the wharf.
author: Brenden B.

description:
Four stars are for nice Russian Waitress and Latino Waiter who waited on our table. Negative trillion stars for the food.  

Kids burgers were charred hockey pucks. I know, I know what do you expect from kids' menu fare. Edible would be good.  My kids choked the burgers down only because we'd been site seeing and hiking and they were ravenous. Frankly, I am pretty sure they would have eaten me at that point.

Clam chowder has to be Campbell's from the can. Not saying that Campbell's is bad, but for the price, come on!

Grilled Trio selection was three of the smallest and most tasteless bits of ocean-going animal ever! And again for the price, come on!

Francesco's Misto (think that was the name of it) pasta with various seafood bits, was great LOOKING but way under-seasoned and flavorless.

Glad this place is NOT in Oakland.
author: Mary P.

description:
This was my second visit to Pompei's Grotto.  The first experience was good but I was not on Yelp at the time so I can only comment on my recent visit.

The food was good but the service started out very slow.  The place was busy but what annoyed me the most was other tables who sat down after us started to receive their food before ours.  I spoke to our waitress and the only response was "we have a large party."

After 35 minutes of waiting  my family and I prepared to leave and one of the owners came to our table and apologized.  She offered free cocktails and apologized again for the slow service.   Our food came a few minutes later and everything was delicious.  I had the crab sandwich and chowder.  The sandwich was good but the soup was so so.  Once our meal was done they offered free dessert and we declined.  I really believe they made an good effort to keep us as future customers. So for this visit I can only give them three stars.   If the owner had not come to our table I would have given them one star.
author: Gary W.

description:
I've eaten here many times over the years and have always found it 
satisfactory. When Dungeness are in season, I always order a whole crab and have them bring it to me without cleaning it....I like to take care of that myself, armed with lots of sour dough bread and a good white wine. 

Last week, when a good friend was in town, an F & B manager for Royal Caribbean, we had a lovely lunch here. Our waitress was very accommodating and friendly - of course, there were very few other people there on a February Tuesday for lunch, We shared an excellent crab 
sampler with Dungeness claws, crab bruschetta and a crab cake. My entree was sand dabs and my friend had a delicious portobello 
risotto. The lunch entrees were quite reasonable at $12.95. 

So far, I've never been disappointed so I'll keep going back to Pompeii 
until something convinces me I shouldn't. I like the place because it's 
a nice respite from the big touristy caverns one encounters along Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Carmen H.

description:
Visited during Labor Day weekend 2011.
Should not have purchased their risotto!
It was not risotto; it was a Mexican dish, a horrible Mexican dish.
Who the heck puts tomato sauce in risotto?
After dinner and parking, I wasted over fifty dollars
author: Gail F.

description: Got a groupon deal and the deal was great.  Food was good.  Not too bad.  We ordered a drink but they were out of the stuff to make it and the steak was more like well done rather than med-well.  Other than that it was good.  We did think that the waiter forgot about us a couple of times but he didn't. TG
author: Gloria M.

description: I was very disappointed with the Chioppino here.  It was store-brand canned tomato soup with some over cooked crab and other seafood thrown in.  No taste.  Unfortunately I can't recommend this place.
author: Susan T.

description: Came here on the recommendation of a friend. This place would have gotten 5 stars if it was just based off the food but the service and atmosphere was so atrocious (on our anniversary night no less) that I had to downgrade it severely. It was a long wait but because we were on fisherman's wharf, kinda goes with the territory, however there was only one small bench and hardly any standing room while you waited and about 4 groups were waiting at all times with no offer to go to the bar while we waited. Plus, constantly being bumped by the staff and other guests made the wait seem longer. Finally got a table after roughly a half hour wait and the blonde server was completely frazzled, confused and rude. In the middle of our wine bottle order, she yelled at us to hold on and she would be back which she did finally come back several minutes later still looking disheveled and not remembering our order. I thought if I mentioned it was our anniversary that maybe she would have realized it was an important night for us but she didn't seem to hear me and definitely didn't acknowledge it. She took our appetizer order and said she would be back for the rest of our order later. The appetizer was a crab sampler with a crab cake, crab bruschetta and crab legs and it was tasty and well made. But she never came back to take our main course order. We finished our appetizer and two glasses of wine each as we watched her frantically move around her side of the room but accomplishing very little. I finally had to say as she bumped my chair from behind that she still needed to take our order for the rest of our anniversary meal, thinking that mentioning it again she might do a better job finally. She didn't. Instead, she took our order in a huff with no apology.
