We both had the fish and chips (on recommendation from previously mentioned friend) which although doesn't sound like I high dollar item it did run $17.95 per meal. The breaded cod was crispy and not fishy and the fries were adequate but quite frankly the dinner had been ruined by our servers appalling behaviour. I kept wishing we had the other brunette server who was working our area as she was doing an excellent job. At the very end of the meal, I think our server tried to do damage control before bringing the check as she brought a small scoop of vanilla ice cream with a candle in it. Honestly, I was so irritated by then I didn't care what she did to get a better tip. It was very apparent why she changed on a dime 5 minutes before she brought us the almost $100 bill. I understand that severs can have an off-day but this was way beyond that. Even my husband who is pretty patient man was appalled at her lack of ability to do her job.
author: Jenna C.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night with 2 friends. We were walking around Fisherman's Wharf/Ghirardelli Square, looking for something to eat and decided to try this place out.

Food: I had the caesar salad with crab and it was so delish! There was a whole MOUNTAIN of fresh, sweet crab meat. My friends got the linguine and clams and the salmon pasta special--both looked good and the plates were empty at the end of the meal.
Service: Not amazing, but not bad. Pretty average.
Atmosphere: We loved the little porthole windows. No worries though, the sea theme is nowhere near tacky/overdone.
Prices: Pretty good for the touristy location. I paid $20 for my entree salad, a coke, plus tip and tax.

Definitely worth a try if you're looking for good food and decent Fisherman's Wharf prices.
author: Stephanie F.

description: Monday night in SF for the night for work. Thought I'd mix it up and stay near Fishermans Wharf. Wandered into Pompeis to eat alone in the bar and found 4 men (2 crab fisherman). Colorful conversation to eavesdrop on and good service. Clam chowder was average. Ordered the crab sampler appetizer. Bruschetta bread was very greasy, crab legs were fine but the crab cakes were embarrassing. It was like eating warm mayonnaise with soggy bread crumbs and a little crab. I expected much more in something as basic as a crab cake adjacent to Fishermans Wharf.
author: Courtney J.

description:
Worth the trip just for lunch. Clam chowder in a bread bowl is perfection on a plate. 
You dont need anything else when you go here, just this tasty selection and a glass of water and you are set. Keep it simple and enjoy the soup. Of course i like to over do it on the adult beverages but thats how i roll. 

Next time you are in the area, or even if you are not, you owe it to yourself to give it a shot. 

Maybe i'll see you there!
author: Jeff H.

description:
Enticed by the cozy vibe and lots of diners, I went to Pompei's Grotto for a a birthday dinner with my fella last night and I've got to say, we won't be coming here again. 

The place is cute enough, in a silly Fishermans Wharf kind of way. The cocktails were TERRIBLE. Seriously, the "Pearadise Cooler" tasted like I was drinking a Glade candle that was about 89% ice, and my man's rum punch thing was no better. Service was good, but the waitress was drenched from head to toe in cheap perfume, and that didn't help matters much. The food was way overpriced and only ok.

We had the bruschetta with crab and crab cakes for appetizers and those were yummy, though the portions left something to be desired. My fish and chips was pretty decent, but their tartar sauce needed a whole lotta punch, and my date's snapper was pretty good though kind of a meager fillet. 

My general advice: skip this place. But if you must go here, stick with beer or wine!
author: Sarah F.

description:
Situated slightly off from the main Fisherman Wharf tourist trap..right across from the tried and true In n Out.

We sat outside on a very windy, sunny Sunday afternoon.  Its always weird sitting outside at a table where on both sides you have bystanders walking by and peering at what you're eating.  Nothing against Pompei, but just odd the set-up here to sit outside.

Anyhow had the following...
Clam chowder:  Not very good.  Not creamy, more watery/light than anything.  The clams weren't that fresh either.  2-star!
Crab Sandwich:  Better.  I really liked the crispy, warm bread used.  It didn't tear up the top of my mouth, but was lightly toasted on the inside sides of the bread.  The crab itself was fresh enough and tasty.  3-star!

Service
Not the best by any means.  Its like a start of a bad relationship when you have to wait 5-7 minutes and actually call someone over to serve you instead of the server swinging by and saying either "sorry, I'll be with you shortly" or introducing themselves upfront that he/she is your server.  

I also explicitly asked for water with NO ice.  And I got water WITH ice.  Small annoyance.
author: Yup S.

description: Great find on a crazy Saturday night where the flashy spots on the  Wharf were a long wait.  Decor wasn't very modern but that added to the charm of this family owned restaurant open since 1946!  The food was phenomenal, even the bread and decaf coffee!  Incredible seafood, great service!!!  I'm always on the hunt for spots my out-of-town in-laws will like when they visit and this is definitely on the list!  We will be back!!!!!
author: Sandra H.

description: I wanted to use the restroom cause I'm pregnant  and the drug looking hostes said I can only use the restroom if I was a paying customer. I said I would buy something and she followed me and stayed until I ordered something. The restroom are awful. Never coming here.
author: Rosa L.

description: NO STAR!  This has got to be the worst restaurant in the whole fisherman's wharf.  We were seated at the restaurant at 6:21 PM, which is still during the happy hour.   The waitress came to our table at 6:31 PM.  We asked if Happy hour is still available since we were here for 10 mins before happy hour ended.  Her respond was "you weren't here for 10 mins, but okay you can order it" with a really bad attitude.  I was in shock to hear her respond.  I'm in customer service industry and have never experienced such a rude experience in my life.  I told her if there is a manager that I can speak to....and her respond was "NO".  I went in the back and look for the manager to complaint.  And of course there was a manager available at the time. After filed a complaint, I walked out and would never ever come back there if these are the type of services that they are providing.  No one should pay for a meal and get treated that way.  If I can give a negative star, I would!
author: T N.

description: This was our worst meal experience in the 3 days we were in San Francisco.  We ate here for lunch and were very disappointed.  Service was horrible.  Fish tacos was awful, the instant ice tea should never be ordered, the French fries weren't good.  One of my friends did have the avocado & crab salad and was very happy with her dish and thought the clam chowder was ok.
author: Kimberly R.

description:
Great place-Great food-GREAT PRICES especially for such a touristy spot. 
My only wish would be for fresh flowers instead of the fake ones and for the bread to be warmed first before serving. excellent and quit server.
author: Rachel R.

description: Delicious! Had the salmon, a little pricey but expected by the location on the pier. very attentive host. Waitress not so much.. high score of the 96 which make this a grade "A".
author: Shakei D.

description: Great Italian and seafood!!!!! I had the Linguini and Clams and it was one of the best meals that I have ever had. Delicious! However, service was slow and the server took away my daughter's food without even asking if we wanted to take it home...which we did. The restaurant was busy so this may explain the inconsistent service. I still would still go back again for that delicious food! Just keep a close eye on your food! : )
author: Luanne D.

description: We recently enjoyed dinner here with our friends after a day of sightseeing and visiting Alcatraz. Tired and hungry we did a yelp search for restaurants in the area that would meet the diverse needs of our group.  The Pompeii Grotto was an excellent choice! The pasta dishes and seafood selections were Terrific and the bread was really yummy. This is my first Yelp review and I wanted to share our wonderful experience!
author: Gail S.

description:
Really nice atmosphere.  Ordered the Seafood Sampler for appetizer which was crazy good. I swear the white cod melted in my mouth.
For the main course my husband ordered the CRAB SANDWICH, which he said was the best he had ever had. That sandwich is all about the crab, no heavy sauces messing with the flavor. I had the Filet of Sole which was heaven in my mouth. It was served with green beans, perfectly cooked, and penne pasta in the same light lemon sauce the fish was cooked in. 
Wait staff was very attentive but not overboard.
author: T Lee T.

description: The service was by far the worst I have ever experienced. The food was not bad, but for the price we could have gotten a whole lot better some where else. The server was one of the rudest I have ever met and should not work in the service industry.
author: Marta D.

description: We went here for dinner & we will definitely be back! Loved the old school decor, red/white checked tablecloths, it was exactly what we were looking for. The staff was extremely friendly & very attentive & we loved the fact that it was family owned. The food was also delicious! I had the clam chowder & Cesear salad, both were very tasty. My husband ordered spaghetti with meat sauce & said it was the best he's had in a restaurant. The prices were nice as well. We will absolutely be coming here again.
author: Elaine H.

description:
I was not expecting a whole heck of a lot based on some of the yelp reviews and so I was quite pleasantly surprised. We ate dinner here on July 4. They did not take reservations, which we knew in advance, so we planned to just walk in and hope for the best. We showed up at 6 expecting to be told there was a 90 minute wait, but instead we were actually seated immediately. Awesome!

The menu had a lot of variety to it, though of course there were many seafood dishes. I found it to be pretty vegetarian friendly. The drinks were strong, the food was good, and I would love to go back to try some other dishes. If you're down that end of the wharf area definitely check it out, it's a great little place.
author: Evey G.

description: After browsing around The Wharf for lunch we stopped here. The Crab Grilled Cheese Sandwich was divine, and the calm chowder was voted the best of the trip. Lunch ran each of us about $20 but we left with full bellies and left overs!
author: Amanda S.

description:
Ok.....People
This place for me....and my buddy Carmine this is hands down the best place in San Francisco to feast on  Dungeness Crab Cioppino made the old fashion way, what ever the cost... it's always good....I've driven up from Monterey on a few occasions just to have it.....but for me....I always order with a double order of crab....always fresh...always good...always great....and the bread dipped in the sause after is always a treat....they even have a wheel barrow in the back for guys like me that need a little help gettin out of da place
author: AJ C.

description:
This place looks inviting at night especially when streets are deserted.

The seafood is fresh. We had sea bass which is cooked well. The sauce is a bit too sour. The other items we ordered is linguini with clams. It came with a lot of clams. The clams are big and fresh. The linguini taste very good. The sauce, however, way too salty. 

Service is ok.
author: Chun L.

description: My friends and I had dinner here the other night and lunch today.  Atmosphere, service and food were all good.  Did not have to wait for a table either time.  For dinner had a pomegranate martini and fried scallops and enjoyed both.  Lunch selection was a Caesar salad with loads of fresh bay shrimp.  Two comments:  they used too much of the yellow center of the Romaine lettuce for the salad, and I like my sourdough bread served piping hot.  Would definitely eat here again.
author: Kathy W.

description: Best Spaghetti in the Wharf!  Try the lunch deal.  $13.75 for spaghetti, sourdough bread and salad.  The meat sauce is thick, fresh and authentic.
author: Desiree G.

description: We took a day trip to the city and toodled around town until very late when we realized food was needed.  The only restaurants open by that time, that we were aware of, were Rainforest Cafe and Pompei's Grotto.  We first attempted Rainforest Cafe and had a horrible experience, so bad, that we walked out before our food arrived.  Further down the street and towards the car we walked, when we stumbled upon Pompei's Grotto.  Fortunately, they took us in as the last guests and sat us, although they were minutes from closing the restaurant for the evening.  The staff that stayed later to serve us were food angels.  Service was prompt, food was tasty and well prepared.  Drinks were so-so.  We will be coming back.
author: Tim K.

description: OMG!  The Dungeness Crab pasta is to die for!  My friend had the Sea Bass, it was also excellent.  I recommend this restaurant.
author: Melissa L.

description:
After over two decades of dining out in San Francisco I can say, sadly but with no doubt, that Pompei's Grotto has been my worst experience. I took a friend visiting SF for the first time and was not just disappointed but embarrassed. The service wasn't rude but not friendly either (our server was pregnant, so a lot of slack must be cut towards her, but her demeanor wasn't a good start).

We started with watery, tasteless cocktails, then came cups of clam chowder, one New England one Manhattan, both devoid of taste, their only redeeming quality being heat. The crab bruschetta we shared had more taste than if it had been plain bread, but not much. My black cod, his salmon, and the pasta and veggies surrounding them, were no better, both fish dry and insipid, and pasta and veggies overcooked and bland.

In principle I avoid speaking badly about anything, and if I don't like a restaurant I just don't review it, but this meal was such a fiasco I felt compelled to warn everyone to stay clear of this place, which seems to have not a trace of passion for food.
author: Max L.

description:
VERY fresh seafood and fish!  If you eat pasta: Francesco's Misto, if you don't: Cippino (sp?).  I've been coming here forever and the food has always been great, and great portions!

This is a local joint, laid back and casual.  The fishmen hang at the bar kind of local and casual.  Of all the restaurants in the area this one is worth it's bang for the buck!

I'm bummed that they no longer have the marinated calamari on the menu! :(  big big sad face!

The side salads aren't worth it...get something like a cup of soup instead, the clam chowder is made fresh n yummy!
author: Q L.

description:
Came here during fleet week for lunch. There were 3 adults, 1 toddler and my newborn son. We had no wait and the staff was very attentive to us. We ordered our food and I was pleased with how quick they brought my sons food. (especially seeing how toddlers have very little patience) he got the fried shrimp and loved it. I ordered the pasta with calamari and enjoyed it very much. My husband got the fish and chips and was pleased and our friend had ordered the crab sandwhich and enjoyed his as well. I wouldn't judge this place on the negative reviews since we had a great experience! 

They also placed the stroller in the back for us seeing as the inside of the restaurant isn't very big. The staff was wonderful!
author: Jasmine R.

description: Service is deplorable. I hope the food is good because the service so far has been having their own chat session instead of serving. The only way this place is still open is tourist falling into it. This sucks.
author: Tim T.

description: Service was ok but not great. Decent clam chowder and surprisingly good oysters though a little expensive at $2.50 each. ok place to go if you're in the area but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.
author: Russ C.

description:
This place is a nice little restaurant located in Fisherman's Wharf.  The seafood is fresh and really good.  I decided to order the Linguini & Clams (Fresh whole clams with linguini in a garlic butter and white wine sauce) with the Bruschetta (With Dungeness Crabmeat).  Both orders were excellent.  The linguini with garlic butter and white wine sause was creamy and the clams were fresh, which was a huge plus.

You must order the Bruschetta (With Dungeness Crabmeat).  Its by far the best Appetizer on the menu!!!  And it won't disappoint!!!  Not only was the Bruschetta made to perfection but the crabmeat was fresh which is what made this order so special. 

What is best about this place is that its a nice little place in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf.  Most of the other places are way overpriced and not as great as advertised.  Its nice enough to have a romantic evening or nice dinner with close friends while having a casual type of feel at the same time.  At night you get a dark room with candles on the table, yet not feel out of place if dressed casually.

Great food and an overall great restauant!
author: Glenn P.

description: Crab sandwich had pieces of crab shell in it, wait staff was more interested in the  World Cup  Game than the customers.
author: Ed A.

description: 3.5 stars. Okay service. The shrimp salad with blue cheese is delicious.
author: Katherine E.

description: Great dinner!  Our cab driver from the airport had actually recommended this place to us, and it did not disappoint!  There are a lot of Italian restaurants on Fisherman's wharf, which seemed over-priced and kind of generic.  But this place was small, intimate, service was great!  Our server was really attentive, and even recommended some other great places to eat during our stay.  I had the fettuccine gamboretti, shrimp scampi and tomatoes and broccoli which was light and flavorful, and my husband had the spaghetti with olive oil and Dungeness crabmeat, which he thought was excellent.  The prices were reasonable and we would definitely come back!
author: Keely D.

description:
Pompei's has been at this location virtually unchanged for 63 years, so they must be doing something right. Solid seafood offerings and fresher (so important with seafood) than most restaurants. However, the last few times I've visited, the quality has slipped a little below the excellence I remember, and as a result seems a bit overpriced.  I'm probably a harsh seafood restaurant critic:  Many of my relatives own seafood companies, etc, so I get more ultra-fresh seafood than I can ever eat -- and our family culture generally scoffs at what tries to pass as fresh seafood at most places.  In fact, at our family reunions, you don't want to admit that you've actually paid to eat seafood in one of these poseur joints.  Still, overall Pompei's remains dependable in a sea of Fisherman's Wharf poseurs.

Contrary to word on the street, Pompei's longevity has nothing to do with my Italian . . . um . . . Family roots which extend fairly deep into SF's historical seafood industry.
author: Jack H.

description:
Didn't have very high hopes going into this joint being that it's a heavy tourist district. So I wasn't to disappointed.

Pros:
 - Sit in the bar. There is a very cool older dude that works in there that is quite friendly and will give you awesome service without being in your face. The hosting staff was quite cordial too.
 - The clam chowder is the bomb....and I don't even really like clam chowder. I should have just got a big bowl of it.

Cons:
- A pretty sad beer selection.
- None of the other food we ordered was very good.  My girl doesn't even remember what she had, but she only ate half of it and she didn't feel that great later.  I got a seafood sampler that was pretty much all fried thinking that you can't mess that up to much.  I was wrong about that.

Summary:
 - If you're down anywhere near the wharf and are starving to death this is not the worst place you could end up.  If you're not starving walk back into the city a bit.
author: John B.

description: An excellent Italian. I had the sea bass - it was fantastic. O I started with their Pompei Homemade clam chowder, and it very good too. Can't wait to find another good place to eat I'm the area.
author: Donald W.

description: This is definitely the worst restaurant we've eaten at in SF. The waitress was incredibly rude, even to the child sitting at the table next to us. We spent most of the meal trying to figure out what we did to earn her vicious hatred. The food was very, very average. I guess that's what we get for eating on the wharf. Never again.
author: Cami J.

description: I popped in late on a Wednesday night and it was nice and quiet. Service was extremely fast and the staff was very friendly and attentive. The food was great, too.
author: Michelle S.

description: My husband and I loved this place. We waited a romatice place to eat for the price, and we found it. Food was great.  I would love to go back.
author: Wendy G.

description:
Delicious food, excellent service, warm and friendly ambiance. Treated extremely well by the hostess, the bartender, and the waitress. Wonderful dinner and drinks. I recommend it highly for tourists and locals alike.

We were treated like a great annoyance at the big Italian restaurant just down the street. Castagnola's - the host was rude and unpleasant. Glad we didn't stay to be mistreated there but found Pompei's to be just the right place to be.
author: Laurie Anne B.

description: I really love Pompei's Grotto on Pier 39. One of my good friends use to work there and turned me on to this place. The food is really good and fresh. I love the clam chowder soup! Nothing fancy about the restaurant itself except that that the food and services is really good every time.
author: Kathy G.

description:
I read the reviews for the grotto on Yelp and decided this was the place for our family outing of 7.

We had 4 year old twins, 2 senior citizens, and 3 adults. The staff was SO friendly and accommodating! The food was delicious and the service was EXCELLENT! As a mother of twins, I feel a bit self conscious when eating out with messy kids, but the staff met our every need. The calamari was memorable, so tender and tasty! The best part was the bill, so REASONABLE for the quality of this restaurant! We will definitely go back!
author: jenny h.

description: The food is here DELICIOUS!! You have to try the Chicken Piccata!! That wine/garlic/lemon sauce is amazing!!!!! Their seafood is also delicious!!!
author: Fè M.

description: Got the fish and chips. Who thought you could go wrong with that, you're near the ocean? Worst, I have ever had. I believe it was frozen not fresh.  My daughter got the Cheeseburger. Again frozen patty wilted lettuce and the patty was a gray color. She only ate half. My wife got the clam chowder and crab sandwich. Chowder had no clams and just bland. The crab sandwich had minimal shredded crab, that did not taste fresh, a wilted piece of iceberg lettuce and was on cold sourdough bread. The more I think about it, I think it was imitation crab. We complained about the chowder. The waitress who had piercings and tattoos told us the chef is getting a new batch ready. I think that was out of a bag, but who knows. By the look of the place and the prices, you would think it was a good place to eat. We were way wrong. This place was the low of my families first time to the bay area.
author: Brett P.

description: Saturday afternoon for lunch and we were seated immediately - one of the few perks this place has to offer.  The lunch menu is reasonably priced (for SF of course) and has a whole host of options.  I had the crab sandwich and chowder combination that EVERYONE on yelp raved about so much.  The chowder is BOMB... super creamy and the ingredients are so fresh you can feel the crunch of every bite of celery and the clam was delicious!  The crab sandwich on the other hand probably wasn't worth what it cost.  It was really dry even though the crab salad was probably pouring with mayonnaise.  The only other thing inside the sandwich was a big piece of lettuce.  I would've at least expected a tomato or something.    Overall, it's a relatively decent priced place for seafood and really good clam chowder.  Location is good - right along the wharf on Jefferson so you aren't too far from Ghiradelli for dessert.  The food isn't terribly mindblowing outside of the chowder and the sourdough bread but this is SF you can get that anywhere.  The service was a little whack but I guess if you don't want to pay $18 for fish and chips, you can come here and only pay $15 instead.
author: Reena P.

description: After a street car ride we stopped for a quick bowel of chowder. The New England Clam Chowder was very good. Not too thick.  If you don't like cooked celery you may not love this soup. I really liked it. We had it with a shrimp mixed green salad. Generous portion of small fresh tasting shrimp. Yummy bread as well. I would go back. We ate outside but inside looked clean and like an established older restaurant.
author: Jennifer F.

description: i encountered this place out of the blue when i met up with drew in fisherman's wharf. It was an out of blue choice and i wasn't disappointed and would like to try this place at a different time. While my company helped, the food was good as well :)
author: Anne A.

description:
How many ways can a night go wrong? Apparently, quite a few ways. 

I've been to places before where the service has been bad, or the food was questionable, or the server has been rude; and, I've almost always excused the situation as an isolated problem, that the establishment might deserve a second chance.

Well, Pompei's Grotto is never going to get that second chance. From the moment we walked in the door, until the moment we left, Pompei's Grotto exhibited all of the worst qualities a restaurant could ever have.

I'll break it down into four categories, (1) the time before our order was taken, (2) the time between our order being taken and the service of our food, (3) the time during our dining, and (4) the rest.

(1) Before our orders were taken. 

We made reservations for 10 through OpenTable.com for last night. The very first contact we had with the staff was with the server that we would come to dread for the rest of the night. He immediately latched his arm around the shoulders of my cousin, told us that it would be another 10 to 15 minutes before our table would be ready, and that we should go wait outside WHILE she stays with him! That was uncomfortable and creepy. And if we had known better, we would have left. But, we didn't.

The table was set for 8. They had to find another table to make room for the rest of the party. Umm, you had the reservations a day in advance, what the hell? 

(2) The time between our order being taken and service of our food.

Creepy guy came to take our orders, started at one end of the table and, at one point, stopped at one of the guests who wasn't ready to order. He just stood there staring at him, even after the guest said "skip me, I'm not ready". I swear, he did not move until our guest finally just chose a dish to get away from creepy man. When he got to me, I ordered half of a crab. He says back to me, "a whole crab?" "No, half of a crab!" I know, none of this sound significant. It will later. 

A couple in our group came late. Creepy guy approached the woman (she's in her mid 20's, he's in his mid 50'), bent down around her so he was right in her face, asked her if she wanted something to drink. When she replied, "no thank you, I'm fine", he said (I swear this is exactly what he said), "yes you are". Ohmigod!

(3) - The food.

Remember, I said something would be significant later, well here is why. Creepy guy came to serve our food, two dishes at a time. The first two dishes he brought out where some steak and crab combo. Apparently, they were for the two people who ordered first, who ordered (1) a steak, and only a steak, (2) prawns, no steak or crab. The first person didn't care, crab with the steak, just a bonus, so what. The second person did care. She started to protest that this was the wrong dish. He insisted that she had said "I want the same as him". Eventually, she caved in and told him, "I guess you're right, I must have ordered this." 

Plates number 3 and 4 came out. Here we go again. Wrong dishes to the wrong people, and creepy guy insisting that he's right. As it turns out, he had just confused the name of the dishes, thought "oranges" were "bananas" and "bananas" were "oranges". Nothing we couldn't rectify after he left.

My half a crab. Okay, I see three legs and a claw. Good, we're on the right track. And a quarter of a body, not half a crab body, a quarter. I felt a little insulted about the crab order. Then I tasted it. Let me qualify one thing before I make my statement. I am a born and raised San Franciscan. And, if there's one thing San Franciscans know, it's dungeness crab, and how to cook it. This was the worst tasting, over cooked, cross contaminated with fish tasting, and poorest example of how to crack crab that I've ever had. Without exception, the worst!

(4) - The rest.

How could we make this meal any worse? By completely insulting the person paying for it, of course. So, the bill comes, we pay in cash, and creepy guy picks up the money. He then proclaims, loudly, "we don't take cash here". Whatever. Then, he holds up our one hundred dollar bill, right in front of us, in the middle of the restaurant, and examines it. Not just briefly, but long enough for him to turn around in the light for the whole damn restaurant to see what he's doing!

That was the absolute, ultimate, most humiliatiing end for the worse meal that I have ever had, in my life! The worst!

No stars for you, Pompei's Grotto.
author: Jonathan P.

description:
I decided to kick off the 4th of July weekend by treating my mom to a delicious dinner (and of course, Lilly, my puppy wanted to come along!)

We decided to eat at Pompei's Grotto because the menu had great options, the prices were reasonable for being right on the wharf & because they have outside seating that allows dogs in the patio area! 

This is the perfect place to eat at when it's nice & sunny at the wharf because you can enjoy the food while laughing at the world famous Bush Man scare the unsuspecting tourists! I just love watching the girls jump & scream and it's even better when a man does it! 
(He is usually there by boat tours or In & Out Burger)!

I ordered the tortellini seafood special & my mom order the salmon spaghetti dish! Both dishes were amazing and the coffee was fresh & hot! 
The service was also excellent, the waitress ensured that our cups were always filled with coffee & Lilly's bowl with water!

I will definitely be returning when I am out & about at the Wharf & have Lilly with me!
author: Stephanie M.

description: I was disappointed. We waited a while for a table on a Wed night, the service was slow, and the food overcooked.  Won't be going back, too many other great places!
author: Veda P.

description: Yummy in my tummy.  My husband ordered tortellini seafood something or other and I got the fish and chips.  The tortellini was terrific.  My fish sat in the deep fryer a little too long so they are just lucky I like over cooked slightly greasy, crispafied fish.  I loved my french fries too.  Good service, reasonable prices, especially for a tourist trap type area.  I'm not sure if I will come back for seconds.
author: Vanessa M.

description: Came here for my boyfriend's birthday lunch and the service & the food was excellent. Our waitress was very peppy, talkative and positive and kept checking up on us to make sure everything was good. The portion is generous. I'm not a huge seafood person but I do love Salmon and very picky on how it's prepared but they did it perfectly. Definitely a spot to hit up if your in the city.
author: Sabrina Alexandra L.

description:
I hate tourist traps as much as the next guy. But I double dog dare you to find anyplace that is not a tourist trap in Fisherman's Wharf.

Hey this place has both New England and Manhattan clam chowder. Both are excellent. Good service, great location, and reasonable prices. 

I have had a lot worse on the wharf.
author: Wayne P.

description: This is a nice place to eat. The food is not great, but it is good and decently priced for being in the middle of a tourist trap, Fisherman's Wharf. The Bruschetta is actually very good. The Picatta dishes are okay as are the Alfredo dishes.  The Risotto is actually very good. Service was fast and friendly. Would stop in again when in the area.
author: John M.

description: We ducked into this place to warm up after playing on the nearby beach, and we were pleased! They happily provided an off-menu hot chocolate for my shivering 8-year-old, and their irish coffees hit the spot for the grown-ups. Happy hour calamari and garlic-parmesan fries were inexpensive and tasty. LOTS of garlic on the fries! Warm and welcoming staff, good happy hour menu, and tasty warm beverages.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Boyfriend (Euge L.) came to take me out to lunch during my break. Pompei's Grotto. Right across the street. Heard it was good from co-worker. Decided to try it out.

First of all, their popcorn shrimp is something I'd actually blatantly bitch about to my mother if she made something like that. And I barely ever complain about her cooking (when it's not that good, which barely happens anyway). Let's just say it didn't taste like "fresh-off-the-boat."

The seafood sampler is okay. Yes, their crab legs were small. I thought it was kind of insulting for its name. The legs should be the essence of the sampler. Make it big! I like the crab cake though. Bruschetta's pretty good too.

He didn't like his Halibut because it was overcooked. And had bones in them.

He gave this place TWO stars.

But I give it THREE stars because I ordered the PASTA GAMBERETTI (Fettuccine with prawns tossed with fresh tomatoes, sliced fresh garlic, basil and spices in a cream sauce). Oh goodness, it was so good, it almost made me forget about the bad popcorn shrimp. This plate is a four-star by itself, but not five because I think the shrimp in it might've been bad too, I just couldn't taste it. This just made me sad because it has five-star potential. Oh well.

I'd go there again, but avoid the shrimp and halibut.

Order the Pasta Gamberetti!
author: Nance W.

description:
My boyfriend took me here on our first trip to San Francisco together, said they have the best clam chowder.  I don't really care for creamy soups but I said "Why not," I mean we were in Fisherman's Wharf which obviously has fresh seafood.  

We started off with some bay shrimp cocktail and they give you a pretty big portion.  Then, we shared a bowl of clam chowder with some tabasco and sourdough bread...MMMM....I'm salivating just thinking about it.  That's the only way to eat clam chowder.  Then, my boyfriend got the louie salad and I got the crab jack sandwich and both were delish!

Definitely good enough to go back, but I still want to try other places since I only get to go a couple times a year.
author: Elaine K.

description: Delicious, fresh clam chowder. Big, fatty clams, real sourdough. Yum! But don't order the Sailor's Folly drink. Too bitter.
author: Kelly M.

description:
The out-of-towners wanted seafood....If only I had known in advance, I would have Yelped, I would have made reservations, the deal would have been great and I wouldn't have to eat flavorless fish. The guests didn't seem to mind, which is great. Being from a SF though, I'd prefer to brag about the city's amazing seafood. I'll bet some of those stands on Fisherman's Wharf have better seafood. My fish was not fab, ok, but it's the little things that really annoyed me. It's because it's little things that are easy to fix. For example, if you have a big dish with just ok fish, dress it up....put more than 1 sad potato on the plate. 

Maybe I'm just spoiled. I've been eating in SF for 12 years and mostly avoided the touristy palces. 

The bottom line is if you are stuck on the Wharf there are better places to go for seafood. I know that no local would come here, so this this for the tourists: trust me, SF is better than P's G.
author: Aristocles P.

description:
The other night I said to the bf, I said, "Hey! It's time to play tourist again. I want to go to Fisherman's Wharf!" Originally I wanted an In&Out Burger, but he didn't want a burger. We decided to walk past every rest-o-rant from Pompei's to Scoma's to those that line the wharf itself, and choose based on the price for Fish & Chips. Pompei's wasn't the cheapest of the lot, but it was the only one that came with veggies. Most of the other places were too loud, too crowded, or both. Pompei's had their Sinatra/Ella/Italian Opera Faves CD turned a bit too high, but it went well with the red check table mafioso decor and the porthole windows. It wasn't crowded and the lighting and mood were pleasant.

Now, If you want a fancy italian dinner, or a fancy seafood dinner, this is NOT the place to come. There are a great number of restaurants in this City that serve fish in ways that are like little bits of heaven on your tongue. You do not go to a restaurant on the wharf and expect anything other than a tourist experience. 

I got just what I wanted, a touristy experience and touristy food. I was surrounded by tourists. This was, as I might have mentioned, what I was looking for. My Fish was thickly battered and crunchy on the outside, flakey in the middle and my fries were the same. My budweiser was cold and delicious, just like it should be. 

To the preceding disappointed user, I will say that I just can't bring myself to use open table for reservations. I have been tempted by the convenience but there are some things that are best done by communicating with a human being. Restaurant reservations are one of them. Most especially for large parties. It is perhaps your only opportunity to sound out the staff and get a feel for what you might find when you arrive with high hopes, primed for an easy and rapid (rabid) disappointment.
author: Gus J.

description: We went here with a group on a Saturday night and we only had to wait about 20 mins which was a plus.  The server was very in your face but also very helpful.  I ordered the seabass which was wonderful and so full of flavor. My gf the crab fettucine and she was in heaven.  Everyone in our group of 8 was very pleased with the entire experience.
author: Melissa B.

description:
Went there with my wife, sister in law and parents in laws.....lunchtime during the midst of the anti-abortion rally down the wharf.
I've been to this place a couple times in the past, but this time was definitely the worst experience.  Nothing stands out, but the the food wasn't as good and the portions got a bit skimpier as well across the board.
Appetizers - calamari fritti - good stuff ...good dipping sauce

I had the Crabjacks as did my wife - served on toasted sourdough, the sandwich contains an all-too-mayonaisssy crab salad mix - kind of insipid actually...I was bummed out major dude.
sis in law had the Crab Sampler - she reports the bruschetta was fine, crabcake average, and the crab legs, as everyone has stated, are positively dinky.
Other dishes were Fish and Chips, hard to go wrong there, and the Grilled Salmon- that was an uninspired personified.

Service slow and average, food getting worse...there's a lot better you can do even if you have to catch a tourist trap.
author: Vik S.

description: Came here after a long day because we couldn't muster energy to venture far from the hotel.  Bottom line:  it was okay.  I can't go three stars though.  Server seemed worn out, the paneled dining room was a wee bit dreary, and the food was decent but nothing memorable.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night, about 30 minutes before closing time.  They were glad to seat us and take care of us.  Most of the tables were already empty.
The server was friendly and polite.  Even though it was just about closing time, she never once rushed us or even suggested that they were closing.
I don't remember what my gf ordered, but I remember that I was feeling a bit risky and ordered the crab stuffed ravioli.  It was good.  This is definitely not something I would normally order, so I can't really comment on the quality of the crab.  All I can say is that it was edible and it tasted good to me.
Overall, seemed like a solid Italian restaurant.  Far from bad, but far from great.
author: S. M.

description:
Cool little place located right near Fisherman's Wharf. Best seafood louie salad I have ever had simply because they add crumbled bacon to it, which adds a much needed saltiness to the otherwise creamy salad. So great.
Have been here a few times and its not a must try place, but stopping by for a quick lunch while navigating the wharf is a pretty decent idea. 
The clam chowder is pretty delicious as well.
Better places in the city, but still worth it if in the area.
author: Eric P.

description:
The definition of Wharf faux-chic. Good food, good service, and a very reasonable price. Nothing fancy here. If you're looking for basic Italian (I'll heartily recommend the bouillabaisse) . 

Yep... it's heavy on tourists. Be prepared. At the same time, sitting in the bar and people watching can be a blast. Their new outside seating is also great on a nice day.
author: Harry M.

description: Great place for tourists.  I've lived in San Francisco for 42 years.  Haven't eaten there since 1969.  I don't know any locals who would eat there.  I wouldn't.  But the tourists seem to love it.
author: Paul S.

description: Friendly service, but way overpriced for greasy seafood. I would have expected more pan fried or broiled choices - nearly all were deep fried. Crab cake sandwich was no match for the ones found on the east coast, specifically at Baltimore's Inner Harbor. We did get to enjoy front row seating to watch the parade of low-riders driving past on Sunday evening.
author: Patty L.

description:
While cruising the Fishermans Warf by boyfriend and I were looking for an inexpensive place to get fish and chips and chowder. We randomly chose Pompeis Grotto. Nothing super special about the place besides the prices, the selection, and Steve the bartender (very social guy). 

Decor: Cheesy Italian/SF vibe

Cup of Chowder: very good and a must have on the warf.

Lunch: I had delicious 3 filets of grilled salmon, pasta, salad, and a cup of chowder all for 12 bucks! Chris's liked his fish and chips. They also had cute cocktails that fit the warf.

Service: Server was a funny bartender who was very talkative and new a bunch about baseball. Never was given a glass of water come to think about it :(

View: We sat inside but if you are outside you just get a view of the street... no ocean sorry,

Price: Lunch specials were $12

Tip: I wouldn't recommend it for tourists but if you want to go on the cheaper side enjoy the lunch specials.
author: Sarah B.

description:
What a greasy, overpriced menu.  Tourists beware, it looks cute from the outside, but the options are slim in the wharf.

generally, don't eat in the wharf (this comes from a local that works in the wharf)
author: Lindsay T.

description:
I have been to Pompei's many times  in years past for lunch and always had a great experience.  Sadly that was not the case last time.  We (3) went on a week night in late December '08 for dinner and I WILL NOT EVER go back.  My two stars take prior experiences here into account.  Based on my last visit it should have been 1 star at best.  Read on if you want to know why I say avoid this place at all costs.

We were greated and seated quickly enough, that's the last good thing that happened.  

The service was unbelievably bad.  In hind-site I wish I would have walked out, but I never do.  The waiter was so snide and condisending I was honestly in shock.  When he came to take my order I said we just wanted a quick bite and would have a bread-bowl of chowder and a seasonal dungeones-crab appitizer.  The waiter openly scowled and said, with a raised eyebrow, "Is that all?"  I tried to be polite and said yes.  

As I waited another waiter cleared the plates from a nearby table and asked if they would like anythiing else, the customer said, "No thanks, just the check."  The waiter replied, "Oh, sure thing, thanks SO much for reminding me."  He then walked away rolling his eyes and openly gasping.  So help me I wish I was making this all up.  The customer was clearly offended by the waiters snotty attitude.

Our food arrived... sort of.  The appitizer came out and the waiter informed me they were out of bread bowls. (How is it he didn't know this before bringing us the appatizer?  Was this a trick get us to stay?  I'm pretty sure it was.)  He then offered to bring  the soup "...in some cups or something."  We decided to stay and have the appatizer, big mistake.  The crab cake had NO lump crab in it and tasted heavily of mayo.  Mind you this is the height of dungeones crab season and you're not serving lump crab?  The half of a cracked-crab portion of the appatizer was TINY... this might have been the smallest dungenous crabs I've ever seen.  The bruscetta was Ho-Hum at best... again no lump crab.  Really average to poor food.

The server brought the check flopped it down, and snidely commented, "All Full?" when he took the plate.  We paid the outrageous $25 dollar bill and left.  As the waiter cleared our plates, we each said thank you as he took them.  No reply from him, obviously, he was deeply offended by our only ordering an appatizer.  I've been a server, and the kind of attitude this guy was dishing out is totally out of line.  I always tip, and I always try to be polite because I know how tough it can be... these guys were out-of-line.   Again, we ordered 1 appitizer and 2 sodas.  That's all, and it was $23 and change without a tip... for the record, I still left him the change, but I'm sure he just chalked it up to me being cheap.

You can get a bread bowl and whole fresh steamed crab for less from the row of vendors just down the peir.

Needless to say, snotty waiters and high priced mediocer food deserve much lower than a 2.  I will GO SOMEWHERE ELSE for sure next time.
author: pez r.

description: Just spent another great evening at Pompei's Grotto celebrating the Christmas season with 19 family members.  We've been going there for over 15 years as part of a family tradition and the staff could not have been more accommodating to our large party.  Food was great and service was excellent.  Given that our group spends a lot of time laughing and enjoying this wonderful time of year, Pompei's always welcomes us!  Thanks for another memorable evening! Some people on Yelp have commented on the décor...we love it as it is such a warm setting.  And the French bread was awesome!!!
author: Susan R.

description: On vacay here last week and we were just walking along the wharf, looking for a place to eat and decided to stop here.  We sat outside and I had a great tomato stuffed crab lunch. .Service was  little slower but still very nice. I'm sure there are probably other places worth checking out, but I really enjoyed this one.
author: Alissa B.

description:
The service is decent, and the prices are pretty good for that area BUT... the food is not good.  Me and my boyfriend ordered the calamari appetizer and then each got the lunch specials.  The lunch specials came with clam chowder which was ok but i've never had really bad chowder anywhere.  Then the Calamari which again was ok but pretty bland.  Not too greasy though.  
The fillet of sole was too fishy tasting if you know what i mean.  I know it's fish but I dunno... it didn't seem fresh.  I got the shrimp... the shrimp were big and actually pretty good but the thing that pulls this place down to 1 star is that the veggies and pasta that comes with the lunch special is horrible.  The veggies are way over steamed and are just mushy and the pasta is worse than pasta you would get at a high school cafeteria.  

Anyways 1 star might be too harsh but I would NEVER eat there again so in my book that's 1 star.
author: Susan L.

description:
I've lived in the city now for about nine months. When I came out for the first time I did all the shit that now pisses me off as a new-native. Namely, I ate at the wharf. A visiting aunt dragged me to Bubba Gump on the pier once, but that's a another frustrating story. 

However, when I took a date to Pompei's Grotto I wasn't dissapointed. Now, this isn't some authentic north beach joint and it doesn't pretend to be. It's campy and nautically themed and I think it embraces this. Lord knows it does good tourist business and it plays to this dynamic without looking like a pirate ship. 

I had fun. My seafood was tasty. I was a little drunk. My date and I shared laughs and the waiter was friendly. The food was affordable as well, as to be expected. 

Overall, I wouldn't make a trip for the Grotto, nor would I make a point to take an out of town guest there: it's simply not that memorable. However, if you are in the area and you want something tasty and affordable, this place is a good option. 

Bottom Line: A good place. I would give it 3 1/2 stars if I could.
author: Jay C.

description:
So I was born and raised in San Francisco. When I was walking down Jefferson this evening I was struck by the fact that I couldn't remember the last time I had walked down the street. For a lot of people who come to visit San Francisco, Fisherman's Wharf is no doubt a quintessential part of SF - not so far as I am concerned!

Still, we came here on this night because my mom was nostalgic. She wasn't born in the city, and moved here in the 60s. Sometimes she and her friends at work downtown would hop in a cab and come down here for dinner, and she wanted to experience the nostalgia once more. I relented and decided to allow myself to be subjected to the tourist nightmare that is Fisherman's Wharf.

And yet, the dinner really wasn't that bad at all! Service was a bit iffy, with some spilled cocktails and over-burdened waiters, but the food was pretty good and the experience not too shabby. I had a bowl of Boston clam chowder that was perfectly satisfactory (not special, but very competent) and then a pasta dish with some yummy, sweet shrimp. It was heavy on the alfredo sauce, but not a big deal. My mother, meanwhile, went all out and got a massive pot of crab legs which she happily cracked and devoured with her hands. What can I say?

You must be at peace with the notion that you are in enemy territory when you come down here, and your guard needs to be up. But actually, the restaurant was really not bad at all. They had my whiskey (Wild Turkey). They served up an Anchor Steam in a frosted mug. They brought out a basket of good sourdough bread. It wasn't even ALL that expensive for a tourist trap! You could do a lot worse in Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Richard N.

description: Great atmosphere for a romantic dinner.  But....the crab sandwich was ok and the lasagna was just fair.
author: Jeff P.

description:
THESE STARS ARE ONLY FOR THEIR CLAM CHOWDER.

The chowder is thicker than your average clam chowder.  The flavor it not run-down or watery.  I only got their cup size.  Imagine if you ordered the sourdough bowl with it?  MMmmm

[stars and comments are subject to change with each visit (^_^) ]
author: Alice C.

description: Good location good food good service. Nothing blew away everything was good. Bloody Mary was probably the stand out. They use a cucumber vodka! Clam chowder was average as was the fish and chips. Many better and many worse places to go!
author: Andrew F.

description: The dinner entrees were excellent and the service was great!  The Fisherman's Stew really hit the spot after a chilly night on the Hop on Hop Off bus around San Francisco!
author: Dave D.

description: Understand where you are before you rate this place.  This a great family run, low key, San Francisco FISH HOUSE. That should be enough said. But for those that don't understand:  This is an Itallian neighborhood. The fish is fresh daily, It IS NOT overseasoned or oversauced because it does not have to be. It is not bland. It tastes like fresh fish. This is not emerging trend OMG trendy-shemdy asian fusion cusine. The plump, fresh prawns with linguini were very good. The sea bass was some of the best I have ever had. The simple veggies and potatoes were fresh and cooked just right. The traditional ungarnished spumoni was good sized, creamy and delicious just like I expected. The atmosphere is definitely on the casual end of fish houses. I prefer more formal like Scomas. But again, know where you are. The decor could be freshened up just a little. But I expect wood paneling in a San Francisco fish house. The building is lacking a view.  This is fresh fish from the bay, then cooked.
author: Peter C.

description: Thank you to the waitress for putting up with me. My family and i were tired after walking, sight seeing and also returning from the Alcatraz tour and we were famished. The one thing I had been craving since my last San Francisco trip was a crab Cesar salad. I don't know why a lot of restaurants do not serve this anymore. The one restaurant I enjoy this salad with was in the financial district and my party wanted to eat now. Meaning on Fisherman's Wharf. So I yelped crab Cesar salad and Pompei's Grotto came up. We had a lovely waitress who explained the lunch soup/salad combo could not be modified, even with an up charge to a crab Cesar salad. That they no longer have crab Cesar salad on the menu. A little frustrated, I said I would have to look on the menu again to see what I could order. I vented a bit to my mom and aunt that the one thing I wanted before we left was a crab Cesar salad. Not knowing our waitress asked the chef and she came back and said they would make it and at no extra charge. Delighted I had a great crab Cesar salad and all of us agreed the best clam chowder we had tasted on the wharf, based on three other restaurants. We will definitely visit again when in town and recommend. Thanks for the great service!
author: Marisa M.

description:
Amazing dishes, fresh from the boat, and very knowledgeable staff make this a wonderful location.
Must try the gigantic squid steak. An excellent spot whenever visiting the piers and Ghirardelli square.
author: Jessica D.

description: Always excellent service and quality food. The clam chowder and calamari were incredible.  I ate here twice on my trip to San Francisco.  Great food, excellent service, reasonably priced.
author: Jason D.

description: Loved this place! My boyfriend & I got in late from a plane trip from Florida. We wanted a night cap and walked into the right place. Judy, the bartender was working.  She is AWESOME!  She was very friendly and knowledgeable about the area.  We met some awesome regulars (Silver Fox guys) and had the best Fourth of July on their boat. Great place to have drinks and meet nice people. Drinks were awesome. We never ended up eating there because of our schedule. This is a COOL spot!!!
author: Toni O.

description: Had a great late lunch here. Linguini and clams were great. Wife loved her crab sampler. Employees were courteous and friendly. Good food for the price and quieter that most of the tourist areas.
author: Brad W.

description: Everything was good, everyone was nice, but nothing that made me excited.
author: Rich G.

description:
My neighborhood joint (live in aquatic park). Nancy is the owner and, she's great. Their Chicken Piccata is very good, lightly lemony-buttery with capers, Pesto and Fettucine Alfredo's are good if you want all that pasta and, cream sauce. But, really great seafood pasta dishes with plenty of seafood. Francesco's Misto is the family favorite. The 2nd best Tiramisu in town (first is Steps of Rome). Great sauteed crab legs for the crab lover...

family owned, low key joint with good italian food!
author: L P.

description:
The best part was watching the tourists trying to translate the menu to each other.
I got the lasagna and was sad to receive a half inch stack of shrimp, crab meat, cheese and pasta.  All of this sat on a hellishly hot plate with some very bland tomato sauce.

The decor was very uninspired and unromantic.

Thinking back, maybe the blandness was to keep the tourists comfortable.
author: Max K.

description:
The Alcatraz Night Tour takes so long.  Everything seems to close by 9 or 10pm.  We were stuck eating on the damn Wharf.....again.  

We landed at Pompei's Grotto because it was near the end of the Wharf, it didn't seem heinously overpriced, and we were just worn out and didn't want to look anywhere else.  We were seated right away, and the place was hopping with business, even that late at night.  I was so happy we didn't have to wait.

The service was very prompt--almost rushed--and not at all friendly.  I didn't care because I was so hungry.  It was nice to get in, get fed and get out because I wanted to go to sleep.

They dished up an excellent gin gimlet, made automatically with fresh lime juice, not Rose's, which made me VERY happy.  My boyfriend's glass of red wine was awful, which was surprising for an Italian restaurant.  I had the Gamberetti Pasta, and it was *fabulous.*  My  boyfriend had jumbo shrimp with potatoes and zucchini, which he seemed to enjoy (but he did like my dinner much more).

Overall, I was satisfied and surprised that it wasn't worse, given the location.  :)
author: Heather T.

description: Went here last Friday evening because I had a Groupon for two people. The place is cute and wasn't very busy at all which was nice for a Friday evening on the wharf. The food was good. I got the jumbo fried shrimp which came with a lot of food, my boyfriend got the captain's platter and that also came with a lot of food. For dessert we shared a brownie sundae and it was decently sized for 2 people, but we were both really full from our dinner plates and cups of chowder. The service was great and very timely. It's a good place to check out if you're in the area.
author: Ash K.

description: Great food, great service! This was our favorite eatery in San Fran! The ambience was relaxed, the restaurant was clean and the food was exquisite. Highly recommend to anyone for a nice dinner that will not disappoint.
author: Jennifer C.

description: We were able to walk right in for dinner with a party of 5. The calamari was good for an appetizer. Each of us ordered something different and we all liked our choices. Mannicotti, crab, fish and chips, shrimp and scallops. The server was pretty busy but overall service was good.
author: M S.

description: Stopped in here on a whim (the twinkly lights drew me in) & was pleasantly surprised! Ordered the lunch special of grilled salmon and it came with veggies and a small side of pasta. It was very filling but still light which is very important to me. The salmon was spot on and the White Zin went perfectly with it. Also tried my boyfriends pasta and it was buttery perfection. The service is very good as well.
author: Mia S.

description: Best mannicotti ever! Waiter was a charm, even gave us directions to other places. Would return in a heartbeat.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Worst restaurant we ate at on this trip. The food was not terrible but below average.  If I can make it better myself at home, then I could not recommend paying to eat there. The server was not very attentive and not very friendly either.
author: Brad L.

description:
My mom and I planned on eating at Tanguito, but it was freezing outside so we decided to find somewhere where we could sit inside.  We didn't have to wait for a table, but once we sat down the service was very very slow and our waiter seemed confused and new (even though he said he was experienced but just tired).

The bread was served ice cold, as was the butter.  The drink orders took forever as did the salad/soup that came after them.  The clam chowder was tasty, even though it took forever to come.

I had the fish and chips and while the fries were nicely cooked and crispy the fish was still cold in the center and not cooked.  My mom's grilled salmon was overcooked.

Overall, very disappointing service and food for the price.
author: Hillary B.

description: Nice service,  yummy clam chowder, good sourdough!  Recommend seafood scallops were well cooked and fresh .  Came on July 4 th and the place was packed bit the wait was short.  Not bad for a tourist trap
author: Kevin C.

description: Garlic shrimp, sauteed shrimp, and pene pasta were esquisite. Not overly priced but place doesnt have much of a view or asethetic quality otherwise itd be a five.
author: Carlos F.

description:
hmm.. i am on a business trip and should've checked out Yelp first.

I was staying at the Marriott Courtyard across the street, and the concierge tells me to go to Pompei's.  Later I find out that he gets free food from Pompei's in exchange for telling customers to go to this restaurant. 

I get to the restaurant and, as the concierge tells me, "tell the bartender that xxx told me to say hi and that he recommended the Grotto for dinner. " The bartender is now really friendly jnd is an expert at sparking up a conversation.  True salesman and nice guy.  Later on he even pushes ice cream on the obese people that already ate a bowl of soup, full crab each, and shared another entree.  Literally telling them how great their sundae's are and how bad Walmart's brand is in comparison and oh he (like them) will be craving it later.  haha.  

Anyhow, he is super nice and recommends some good white wine along with the chowder I ordered.  Good chowder.  Hits the spot with the whole fisherman's wharf theme.  Meantime, I enjoyed watching some sports hi-lites and bantering with the bartender & fellow male-travelers about how the Patriots are not the best team ever and how Clemens is a cheater just like Bonds.

So far so good.. adequate.  Now to the fish.  Horrible!!!  Just filled with garlic and butter like it was a soup.  I asked for a replacement (rare for me) and get a grilled fish that could not be eaten.  i left and went back to my room to feel sick.  oh well, he hooked me up with free drinks and espn.  what else could I ask for as a lone business traveler?
author: Anna and Matt G.

description:
This restaurant was half way decent if there is such a thing. The best part of the meal was the clam chowder, which the waitress/ bartender described as "white." I was served by a bartender on the bar side because even though I made reservation, for 7, I still had to wait for a table.  Then hostess asked me if i wanted to eat at the bar instead because of no wait time. I agree and I spent the rest of the night watching the Yankee/ Red sox game. 

Now onto the food: I had some sort of sauteed seafood stuff.  It was not refined nor special, just globs of food in 3 quadrants. one glob of spaghetti, one glob of zucchini and this glob of seafood mix. It did not look appetizing, the preparation anyway  and it was heavy on some flavor i could not recognize, maybe wine?! I do not know. The piece of crab they served me was ehhh, nothing to write home about. The 6 dollar crab cocktail I had earlier in the day tasted better. 

An okay meal,  but I am not going to go out of my way to go back, just like like Joes' Crab Shack, although that was a tad more affordable.
author: Christopher C.

description: Restaurants on the Wharf usually serve overpriced crap to a bunch of tourists who don't know better.  Pompei's is the exception.  I've been dining here for years and can say that of all the Wharf restaurants this one is the most reliable with the freshest seafood and best staff around.  Stopped in for lunch during the last trip.  Place was crowded so sat in the bar.  Bartender was wonderful, took great care of us.  Crab Louie was excellent with good portions of crab, egg, and a wonderful Louie dressing.  Did the fried calamari as well which was light and not fishy or greasy.  Accompanying marinara was outstanding especially with the local sourdough bread.  Prices are fair for SF and the Wharf and the quality of the food, cleanliness of the restaurant and friendliness of the staff make it worth the price.  SF is a great dining town.  And while Pompei's is not the best restaurant in The City, it's for sure the best on the Wharf.
author: Jerry G.

description:
We ate lunch here on the suggestion of my g.f. who had dined here previously. According to her their clam chowder and crab meat sandwiches are to-die-for, so she was eager to bring her family (who were vising us from TX) to eat seafood here while we were sightseeing around the Fisherman's Wharf area. 

I had the fried calamari dish with a cup of clam chowder. The food was delicious and fresh. The Clam Chowder was in fact yummy and I was satisfied with my choice of calamari as it was quite light and crispy (I must admit it was some of the best I've ever had!). 

The service was fine but not very speedy. Waitress was attentive with refills but it took a while to receive our order. We came around the lunch hour but it wasn't at all busy inside. All in all I'd come back if I were in the neighborhood again.
author: Kelly K.

description: For a Fisherman's Wharf area restaurant, this place was pretty darned good. I sat at the bar & enjoyed a wonderful fresh crab and seafood pasta with a competent and engaging bartender who's been a local for years. If you're in the middle of touriist-ville & in need of a bite, this is a great spot to hit!
author: Danielle C.

description: One bite of the clam chowder and I was ready to wish for a volcano to come along and take care of *this* Pompei.  Sea bass entree was OK, but not great.
author: Tim G.

description: We arrived late fresh of the airplane.. I had a restaurant.com certificate in my pocket. But the restaurant was closing. So we walked down the street a few feet and were welcomed into Pompei's Grotto. We were starving so we were happy they served us at nearly 10pm. I had the sole and husband had house salad, 3 oysters and large prawns.  The waitress was a little rushed as she was waiting on all the tables by herself. Doors were open but hostess said they were closed for dining but bar was open. Enjoyed the Halloween decor which was nice to see. We really enjoyed our meal
author: S A.

description: Not much to say really.  Portions were a bit small, not that memorable.
author: Larry C.

description:
I'll be fair and give this place 4 stars instead of 5 because, truth be told, I only ate one dish here.

It was the BEST effing pasta dish I ever had (linguini & fresh clams).

Simple pasta, yes. But it was cooked to perfection. The pasta was al dente, just the way I like it, instead of soggy. The clams were plentiful, fresh. And the sauce wasn't too much and too oily. It was a delightful dish, done just right. It came with clam chowder, and although it was kinda runny, it had a lot of goodies in it with much flavor that just makes your tongue dance.

If you can, get a window seat by the bar area. It's the best place to get some sunshine and nice ocean wind and to people watch. I want this place to be transported to LA.
author: Linda T.

description: I had a nice lunch at Pompei's Grotto consisting of a sole sandwich and french fries. The food was good, though the fish was a tad bland. (The fries were great, though). I really liked the outside dining area and actually had it completely to myself, which was rather nice. The server was very friendly and helpful, though a bit slow and I had to wait awhile for my check. I felt like he kept forgetting about me since I was outside. Overall, I thought it was a great place for lunch and I'd recommend.
author: Marjie T.

description: eh, nothing too special about this place. I had linguine alfredo, nothing really outstanding. ok portions. Wait time was supposed to be 10 mins but took 20 instead...
author: Ashraf C.

description: Food was decent. Some of the items were over priced, but you will get that in touristy areas. Staff was very polite and service was quick.
author: Laurie D.

description:
So I would probably really only give this place 2 1/2 stars, but the clam chowder in the sourdough bowl was amazing. I was in Boudin cafe a few blocks down after I'd eaten here and the chowder did not compare. Boudin's was very soupy and watered down. Pompei's was the exact opposite with celery in it. 
  The dinner itself was not that amazing. I ordered the stuffed calamari that was supposed to be pan fried, but the only part that was truly pan fried was the creamy filling, not the actual calamari like it should be. The fish and chips were good though with some really tasty fries. 

I would go back, but mostly for the clam chowder. Worth a try if you are at the wharf.
author: James H.

description:
We finished with the duck tour and our stomach were rambling. We stopped by a few restaurants looking at the menu knowing the price and the quality of food will be roughly the same for a tourist area like the Wharf. So, eventually I ended our perpetual hunt (my friends would carry on walking, believe me!) and said, "I like the menu here." (I were not lying!) My order was the lunch specials, which was what they put on the blackboard outside of the restaurant that got my attention. Lunch specials comes with a cup of chowder or salad at $12.95.  Needless to say I went for the chowder, then I had linguine and clamps in white sauce.  I love the taste of chowder but there's not enough clamps in it. (that brings back fond memory in Scoma's just over a couple of months ago, when I first started yelping lol.....) As for the main dish, I like the presentation and the portion. It's not huge like most places and it didn't feel like a struggle to finish it.  The only thing is I cannot make out if I like the sauce. It tastes somewhat garlic and butter? The linguine was cooked to the right texture which I like very much; the clamps were certainly very fresh; they were so fresh that two of them gave me a mouthful of sands I had to rinse my mouth to get them out! Thank goodness of the bowl I were given for the shell earlier because it certainly saved me from running to the bathroom twice to wash out the sands in my mouth!!  My friends and I then proceed to have a conversation of how one should clean their clamps before cooking them and the various methods of preparing clamps!  

This is an average type of restaurant with average type of service and with an average type of flavour in the dish. My friends had chicken and portabello mushrooms risotto and they said it's tasty and they love it. We also agreed the sourdough is more sour than any sourdough we've eaten! Maybe it tastes more sour when it's not warm?   

I would have given a 3 star if they washed the clamps properly. (my friends accused them of not being washed at all!)
author: Bella A.

description: Love this place! Crab cakes awesome, fish n chips where delicious!.
author: Gerard A.

description: Reasonably priced and very tasty seafood right at the wharf. Service was really friendly.  The crab cake appetizer was superb. No stuffed seafood, but a nice selection of shellfish except lobster.  Scallops were done perfectly and very tender. Jumbo shrimp were excellent. Some wine at $6/glass.  The history on the place was interesting.
author: Pete G.

description: My friend and I stopped by this place for dinner last Saturday night before attending the Chantey Sing on the Balclutha. We arrived at about 7 PM, and we were seated right away at a nice indoor table.  We ordered a Caesar salad to share. The lettuce was fresh, and the croutons were crisp, but the dressing lacked flavor, and there was not much parmesan in the salad. It was way too bland for my taste. We also ordered the crab trio appetizer to share. The bruschetta  had lots of punch. The crab cakes were well done, and the meat in the crab legs was fresh and sweet.. The appetizer was the high point of the meal. I ordered breaded, deep fried shrimp for my entree. The breading was not as crunchy as I would have liked and not seasoned well, and the shrimp had a funny taste. Perhaps it was not fresh. I have had better breaded shrimp at Denny's. It was a bit of a surprise to see french fries on my plate, as the menu had indicated that the fish would be served with a different kind of potatoes. As it turned out, the fries were better than the shrimp. This place has a very nice atmosphere with its red and white checked table cloths, real linen napkins, wood paneling, port hole windows and soft lighting. Our waitress was attentive and checked back with us frequently. The food came out of the kitchen in a timely fashion. I'd give Pompei's a 2 for overall food quality, even though it deserves a 4 for service and ambiance. Next time I visit the wharf, I will pop into their bar for a crab appetizer with a nice glass of wine. This place specializes in crab dishes, and I conclude that is what you should order if you go here.
author: Gail E.

description: Pleasantly surprised! Got a Groupon and went on a "tourist for a day" Groupon spending spree--this place, the aquarium and mirror maze. I did not have high hopes for Pompei's but was happy with the meal. It was Easter and they honored the Groupon no problem. The host was friendly, as was the server. We sat outside and watched the tree man scare the sh!t out of people. Good sourdough bread, too bad not warm.  They let me swap the clam chowder the Groupon called for with a mixed green salad, which was nice. The salad was nothing special though. Had the chicken piccata which was delicious, tender chicken, generous portion, great sauce, nice zucchini and linguine on the side. Hubby was pleased with his salmon, veggies and potatos.  Their parmesan cheese was actually good, not the cheap stuff.  Dessert was tiramisu which was ok but not the best I've ever had. All in all a very pleasant meal. A great deal with the Groupon.
author: D R.

description: I have eaten at this restaurant many times while visiting San Francisco.  Although it is located just down the street from Fisherman's Wharf, the prices here are much more reasonable. It is very clean, warm and inviting.  I learned of this restaurant several years ago, and it has become one of my SF favorites.  It is Italian and Seafood.  The portions are adequate, the service is great, the ambience is good, and it is rather small and intimate.  There is also an outdoor patio area, if you prefer and it has a small bar area.  I have never had a bad experience here whether it be food, drink, or service.  No hype...just good food!
author: Melinda B.

description: This place is awesome!  Great service, nice atmosphere.  I always get the popcorn shrimp and Crab out of the shell dish in wine sauce...it melts in your mouth.  I've never had a bad meal here.  Oh, and the ladies bathroom is haunted - more reason to visit.
author: Jen K.

description: Owned by the same family since 1946, the restaurant has that standard Fisherman's Wharf decor - paneled walls sport faux portholes and fishing prints, and the tables are decked out in red-and-white checked cloths. Sadly, there's no view, because it might have distracted us from the mediocre food. Steamed clams in a buttery white wine broth were perfection, but crab cakes were heavy on breading, salmon was overcooked, fried calamari was rubbery, and seafood ravioli was swimming in a pink-hued sauce that tasted like Campbell's cream of tomato soup. At some point in time, the kitchen had to have done a better job, because even tourists from Kansas couldn't keep this place going for nearly sixty years with quality like this.
author: Gourmet G.

description: I go there for lunch as often as I can when I'm in that part of the city.  I strongly recommend the crab sandwhich and clam chowder.  The crab sandwhich is cold dungeness crab on thinly sliced San Francisco sour dough with a thin layer of mayo and the cup of New England clam chowder really hits the spot.  I walk away with total contentment every time.
author: James B.

description:
yeah shoot me for eating at the wharf.............. my sweeite works there............ we have lunch there..... fine ill go to hooters next time. 

right to it, popcorn shrimp was... hmmm fishy. 
halibut was over cooked, 
crab sampler had the tiniest crab legs ive ever seen. ive seen rock crabs with bigger legs
i did enjoy my sierra nevadas though. 

ive said this many times, and ill say it many times again, im a seafood nazi, you cant pass off bad seafood to me.
author: Euge L.

description: My family and I ate here while vacationing in San Francisco. We ordered the grilled garlic jumbo shrimp and the grilled garlic scallops. The meal was so good! The meals also came with veggies and potatoes. The sourdough bread was out of this world! All of the food was so terrific. The service was very good, the prices are reasonable, and the atmosphere of the restaurant is very nice.
author: Lauren M.

description: Maybe it was because it was Valentine's day and I was in good company, but I thoroughly enjoyed my edible experience at Pompei. Gratefully, we were seated without a reservation (Our first choice restaurant had a 3 hour wait! See: Scomas), and we were pleasantly surprised at how delicious everything turned out to be. As an appetizer, we had the seafood sampler (the mini crab cakes and crab legs were off the chain!). I don't exactly remember what our main course meals were, but I remember having absolutely nothing negative to say about 'em.
author: Ro D.

description: Neat little place in Fisherman's Wharf. We just wanted a nice seafood meal to split as we had just arrived from out of town and wanted something to hold us over until dinner. We did not expect much, but got less. We seemed to offend the waiter that we just wanted the seafood sampler to split between the two of us. We never got a single refill on our empty water glasses and the seafood was just fried mediocre food. Then we had to wait quite a while for the bill. We tried to make it quick but it turned out taking a little while.
author: Chris C.

description:
i stayed at a hotel in fisherman's wharf, and when i checked in, i was given a list of nearby restaurants. my boyfriend and i were drawn to pompei's grotto because we liked the name of the restaurant, but we were expecting it would be mediocre food given its location in such a touristy area. we were pleasantly surprised - pompei's grotto has great service and hearty, well-made dishes. 
great for romantic dinners
author: Jane H.

description: As far as I know, this place is one of the few places open after 10 pm that serves clam chowder in a bread bowl. I have tried the manhattan chowder and regular boston clam chowder. For me, the boston clam chowder was decent but did not stand apart from the 50 other joints that serve chowder in a bread bowl on the wharf. But the Manhattan chowder was very satisfying and had a good tang. Overall it was decent.
author: Daphne N.
