description: Get the bruccetta with crab.  It is excellent. One block away from the very touresty Pier. Prices are lower than the pier. The food is very good, nice sized. Waitress was very friendly. Clean with nice atmosphere. Italian restaurant look. Relaxing atmosphere, not noisy and busy like the restaurants on the Pier.
author: John O.

description: Can you say Tourist Trap. What was I thinking? Ok, I was fresh off the boat, it was raining and we were hungry. I had the sautee shrimp that were pretty good actually. The soup that came with it was clam chowder. It was also acceptable. Not the best but it didn't smell like dead fish. Everything in the joint came with pasta. So why isn't it any good? My friend had the salmon. It looked more like chicken fingers? Three little planks that were a bit over cooked even from my side of the table. And what's with the pea's. I can't remember the last time somebody tried pushing green prune's on me. The service was very fast and friendly, again. Next time I see a cruise ship I will head for the hills.
author: Steven M.

description: This is an old school restaraunt. No frills but  pretty fresh seafood. I've been here on a sweltering hot day, in the bar swigging down an icy cold beer with their mussels in a butter, garlic, and wine sauce (gotta sop up the sauce with the sourdough bread!) The mussels were so big and tender, not chewy. I've been for lunch and dinner a few times. The hot crab sandwich is rich, but crazy good! The cold one isn't as flavorful. Pretty standard fish and chips. Clam chowder is satisfying.
author: foxy b.

description: Hands down, I love this place! They have a great variety of dishes at a fairly reasonable price for the wharf. We go there every now and then and the service has always been great along with the very tasty food. They give you bread that goes well with the meal and a glass of wine. I've never been disappointed or have went home unsatisfied. It's delicious and I always look forward to going here. It's a must try!!
author: Rochelle F.

description: Nothing particularly spectacular, but when everywhere else was crowded, this place wasn't.  Maybe that's because it's about a block or so away from the pier, but maybe not.  I'd come here again just to have a place to sit down without having to wait for a table.
author: Jonathan K.

description: Great seafood. However, they took their best desert off the menu. Large portions and friendly staff. Have an hour and a half to spend...
author: Mary B.

description: YUM! we go here for romantic special occasions. the owner lady speaks to certain people in italian, and she is always there! we had one waitress that wasnt very friendly, but the food is so good. He always gets seafood, i always get pasta. i did like the calamari steaks, but i am a sucker for pesto torteleni (sp?) its a small resteraunt, crowded, but it makes for romance i guess.
author: Ashley R.

description: It was cold, windy, and we were starving and just got back from an Alcatraz tour.  The two star description fits this place perfectly, "Meh.  I've experienced better."  To be fair, the bread was good and my husband enjoyed his seafood lasagna.  But the service was spotty, the bruschetta was mediocre at best, and my halibut was underseasoned.  The decor was tired - fake wood paneling and fake flowers with frayed edges.  I wouldn't eat here again given another choice.
author: Melissa H.

description: Great food for great prices!  I couldn't believe how affordable the prices were considering the location.  My sole with potatoes and green beans was $18.95, I think, which is great.  Most of the seafood on the menu wasn't over $20.  It's also a varied menu with italian food and seafood.  I'm allergic to shellfish and didn't have any problem finding something.  It's also very quaint with very friendly staff.  I'd go back!
author: B S.

description: Despite the numerous negative reviews for restaurants on Fisherman's Wharf, my wife and I were pleasantly surprised when we came here during our honeymoon.  We started out with the bruschetta which was delicious on sourdough bread with fresh basil and tomatoes. She had the clam chowder in a bread bowl and it was definitely homemade and complimented the chewy sourdough perfectly.
author: Jeremy B.

description: split a coaipino with my son in law last night, crab very good fresh, tomoatoe sause too salty
author: pochini m.

description:
This is one of our fave stops when out and about in the area--before or after a game in particular. I just don't get the overpriced comments at all. I wonder where those people are eating in SF. What with costs of payroll, rents, etc, it is super expensive to do business in SF, so I think this place is just average--not too expensive and not cheap.

We love the fresh stuff here, and I usually order the pastas, which are cooked just the way I like--not over or underdone. with really tasty sauces (the gamberetti is great and so is the meat sauce). Hubby likes the grilled garlic shrimp or the fish. Had the halibut special last time and licked his plate. We also love the family who owns it--really friendly folk.
author: Mimi S.

description: My husband and I had the clam chowder in the sourdough bread bowl and it was quite good. I was particularly grateful for the service. The hostess and other employees were attentive to and understanding of our needs, and that'll keep us coming back.
author: Susana A.

description: Got in late and had to pick a restaurant quickly. Decided to go here as it was quiet and the menu looked decent. After being seated it took 15 minutes before someone took our drink order. The food we alright. Nothing to brag about and definitely nothing to return for. The service was awful. Had to ask for refills every time. Choose something else or save your $50.
author: Amy P.

description: Fisherman's Warf is quite the tourist trap on a Saturday nite but really wanting fish and not in the mood to wait forever at the Tadich and having heard this was the more off the beaten path with good food I gave it a try.  It is OK but not great.  The filet of sole was good & fresh but quite small portion of fish with one small potato & one kind of vegatable.  The mussels we ordered were undercooked.  The meal with a half bottle wine (wine had a screw top no cork) was $60. Too much for an average meal.  The place is kind of old & worn out & the restroom smelled so strong of cleaning products not very inspiring to return.
author: mike d.

description: I've dined at other restaurants on the wharf and never checked out Pompei's Grotto. Short story-- we asked to be seated outside. We were left out there for ten minutes, no greeting, no NOTHING. The waitress walked by us twice, and assisted the only two other tables that were there, one of them having gotten there AFTER my friend and I. We put our menus down and went down to Capurro's (so much better, great service, great food, try them instead).
author: Jennifer A.

description: Pleasant atmosphere, sunny staff, and a comprehensive menu. This is my first time at this place and my first problem right off the bat was how to narrow down my choices from all the appealing options on the menu. We took the calamari starter, which was delicious with the included tomato sauce (and no, nothing like ketchup, thank goodness) and was not too heavily battered. For the main course we had grilled salmon and clam linguini, both good. Perhaps a little more adventurousness would have been nice with these dishes, though.
author: Stephen P.

description: The food was so good here. And plentiful! I had a crab salad and a boowl of their clam chowder. The waitress was so nice and on top of things.
author: Tina L.

description: Everything my husband and I had was SO GOOD. I don't know what all these other people are talking about. He had Sea Bass and I had Fettuccine Alfredo w/bay shrimp.  We also had some crab as an and it also perfect.  The service was great and I look forward to returning to this spot.
author: Melissa S.

description: My friends and I came here one night after we had been desperately craving clam chowder all day and needed to get our fix.  I'd been here once before when I decided to hit up local tourist spots throughout San Francisco, but it had been awhile.  Though it wasn't the best seafood I've ever had, I have to say it did the trick!  We were seated immediately and, since we all wanted the same thing, were served very quickly -- which definitely added to the experience!  The clam chowder was good, but what made me really happy was that it was served in a bread bowl (which for me is the best way to eat clam chowder).  There's a nice, local feel to the place and the outdoor seating is excellent for people watching.  For what you get the food is reasonably priced, and overall I have to say I was pleasantly surprised with the entire dining experience.  Head here if you're looking for a quick seafood fix and don't want to spend a ton of money.
author: Ashley T.

description: It was average at best. We went on Thanksgiving weekend, and ate the lunch special. The service was friendly. The food was only ok. The side salad was a pile of wilty, bitter lettuce. The pasta and veggies that came with the dish were awful. I had the sole. It was pretty good. He had the chicken parm, he really didn't care for it, but ate it all. Probably won't eat here again.
author: Lori M.

description: Defiantly a hidden treasure.  The people are always nice.  The food is authentic Italian as are the owners.  I've been going there probably a few times a year for quite a few years now.  I would recommend it to anyone who loves sea or Italian food or a really good mixture of the two!!!
author: duane s.

description: when we got there we were seated right away which was very good. the food came up fast and it was good too, the only bad part was our host/ waiter , when he came up to us he never told us his name ( he had short hair and believe the only none italian) but what he did was when we left we tipped him 5 bux for a 30 dollar lunch he gave us the worst attitude ever because we only tipped him 5 dollars. not cool...
author: Jamal N.

description: I have been going to Pompei's Grotto for approximately 20 years and I can honestly say that I have never had a meal that was not up to my expectations.  The food is always fresh and delicious.  I recently spent 11 days in SF and ate at Pompei's on all but the couple of days when I took 1 day trips out of town.  This is my usual pattern and I go to SF 2 to 3 times a year for a week or more.  The staff is always friendly and knowledgeable.  The clam chowder has always been velvety smooth and full of fresh clams with just a subtle taste of leek which makes it special.  I would rate it as 1 of about 2 or 3 of the best chowders I've ever had anywhere and I go to New England a lot.  My top favorite is the sand dabs in white wine garlic sauce.  They are the best I've ever had any where.  My next favorite is the crab cakes as a dinner entree--it's not on the menu but you can ask for it.  I've tried all the restaurants around Fisherman's Wharf and several seasfood restaurants in the financial district and this is by far the best food and also the most reasonably priced.  It's one of my favorite restaurants in the country.  I love the chewy Italian sourdough bread.   The owner is a super nice lady.
author: Paul S B.

description: On Sunday afternoon my family and I walked by Pompeii's Grotto. This has been a long time favorite spot for my parents when they are in town visiting... Not any more. We were seated at the tables out front, and were not served or brought menus for well over 15 minutes, at which point my little brother went inside and asked for service. The host then brought us water and menus and it was another 5-10 minutes before the waiter finally showed up. At that point we ordered a round of drinks and 2 orders of bruchetta - to which the waiter replied that there was a $15 minimum per person. 1) we had already been there nearly 30 minutes without being served; 2) it was 230 or 3 pm - not lunch or dinner rush - they were not crowded; 3) 5 drinks and 2 apps put us around $10 each; and 4) who is to say that we wouldn't have ordered another round?! Nevertheless, because we weren't ordering full meals we were denied service. Needless to say, we will never, ever dine there again. Ciappinos is right down the street and was gracious enough to serve us apps and drinks (with a better bar selection).
author: Jenifer G.

description: Oh boy is this place AWFUL.  We had such a lovely day on the wharf with out of town friends who had never been to SF and thought, this place looks reasonable, pretty crowded, let's eat here.  What a mistake.  Maybe it was the cook that was on that night?  Maybe I expect better fish/seafood in SF?  The reviews on here are pretty mixed...........  I ordered the grilled sea scallops (aren't they supposed to be bigger than bay scallops???!!!) and giants prawns for $19.95.  Now I don't mind getting 3 of each for that price if it was GOOD.  It wasn't, the scallops had absolutely NO flavor whatsover; the shrimp, eh.  They came with a measly little white skinned potato, alas, no seasoning on it either, and some really overcooked, mushy halved zucchini.  Now doesn't that sound appetizing??  My other half ordered the fish and chips, again, figured we're on the wharf, should be "fresh".  I think Gorton's in the freezer section are MUCH better.  DRY and I swear they had been sitting there since the day before.  AWFUL.  Pretty much inedible actually.  What a disappointment.  Fortunately, the guests ordered non-seafood/fish items, which I guess were ok for their taste buds.  Won't ever go back to this place!
author: Deb U.
